loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Dudu is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a charcoal burner. She has nine children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C., from the village of Centro 2, is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income is derived from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hope Group 2, Mukono

texts.en: S. Grace is 45 years old and divorced with seven children of her own in her care. She has been in the business of selling clothes from Kikko for nine years, from which she makes about $315 in profit a week, although she still faces the challenge of lacking enough capital. She makes certain that her stock is of good quality, which attracts more customers. Grace has hopes of building a house for her children plus educating them to the University for Self Reliance in the future. She needs a loan to be able to buy more quality clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her shop expansion.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
47-year-old Edgardo needs additional capital for his business. He manages a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) rice field and is involved in a hog-raising business.

Edgardo wants to do well in his business so he can provide for his family’s needs. His wife, Mary Grace, and their three children are what give him comfort and joy at the end of the day.

Edgardo applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. This loan will help him achieve an abundant harvest and expand his hog-raising business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to expand his hog-raising business

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora A. is from the town of Dibuluan in Jones. She is 51 years old. Flora is the leader of a 11-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dibuluan Group.

Flora is single. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Flora's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: C2348 Abahuzarugwiro Group

texts.en:
Florence was born in 1974 and is married with six children aged from 2 to 12 years. She and her family live in the Gasabo district, Kigali province, in the region called Kabuga.

Florence owns a small business in the market selling cassava flour. Her husband has no job and that is the reason why Florence works hard to provide all the needs of her family.

Florence is the leader of a group called Abahuzarugwiro in the local language; this group contains eight members. Each member has a different business such as timber and foodstuffs. As all of them are women, they work hard in order to resolve their particular problems.

Florence, who is the leader, has two years experience. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to four in the evening every day, even during the weekend. Right now, Florence’s seed money is not enough to attract more customers and this is the reason why she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more cassava flour.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Rosario Fabiola

texts.es: Rosario tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (corazón de res condimentado cocinado  a la parrila). Cada día muy temprano prepara sus platillos y ya en la tarde los vende, su negocio se ubica  en la esquina de la casa de su madre porque es una zona muy transitada. Vende todos los días hasta altas horas de la noche  y esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene ganancias regulares, además cuenta con  su principal  herramienta de trabajo que es una parrilla pequeña fácil de transportar. De esta manera  consigue tener los ingresos  que ayudan a sostener la economía de su hogar, y su deseo para el futuro es mejorar su negocio ofreciendo mayor  variedad de platillos.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando.Rosario tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que  necesita para la preparación de sus platillos como  carne, salchichas, palitos,  carbón y aceite.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They live in the house of her mother-in-law. For the past two years, she has been selling “anticuchos” (pieces of spicy beef that are cooked on a grill). Each day she wakes up early to prepare her dishes and them sells them in the afternoon. Her business is located at the corner of her mother-in-law’s house because it is a busy area. She sells every day until the late hours of the evening and is very pleased to obtain a regular income. Her main piece of equipment is her small grill because it is easy to transport. This helps her to have income to financially support her household. Her wish for the future is to improve her business by offering a greater variety of dishes.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rosario is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she could continue progressing. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of ingredients and supplies in quantity that she needs for preparing her dishes such as meat, sausages, skewers, charcoal, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to continue her food business

loans.name: Lizabeth

texts.en:
Lizabeth A., is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lizabeth sells dry goods.  Lizabeth has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her store.  This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.  Lizabeth plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.
------------------------
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
49-year-old Tita G. is a widow who works hard in her business to gain profit to support the financial needs of her seven children. Her eldest, who is 21 years old, has not been able to pursue her education in college due to Tita’s small income which is sometimes not even enough to support the needs of her six remaining children whose ages range from 8 to 19.

Despite her failure to graduate her eldest child from college, Tita is still hopeful that, by growing her business making and selling “bandi” (sweet peanut delicacy), her profit will increase as well. Then she would be able to support her children’s education, especially her second child who is now in her second year. In two more years she will be graduating and hopefully will have a better career in the near future.

“Bandi” is one of the most popular delicacies of Antique province and tourists buy it as a present. Demand for this product is increasing as the province industrializes. Tita wished to have large amount of capital to increase her production, thus meeting the demands of her customers.

With that, Tita is hereby requesting a much larger amount of loan through ASHI and, with that amount, she wishes to expand her market coverage. She is also hoping that she will be able to have more vendors in different places to increase her turnover.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of ingredients for "bandi" production

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn P., 50, has been planting a variety of crops on farmland he owns and typically earns around US$4 per day. He lives in a commune in Phnom Penh, the capital, with his wife and their two children, while another two children are married and live separately. His wife, Mrs. Noun Ly, 50, who appears in the photo, is a farmer who grows rice for a living.

To increase his family's income, Sorn P. wants to improve his farming business, but he lacks capital. Hence, he would like to request a loan of US$800. With the loan, he will buy a couple of cows to help plow the farmland, as well as buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows as well as seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Raji

texts.en:
Raji is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has five members living in his household. He has been working as a car mechanic for 15 years. His customers include friends and neighbors from his community. He is proud of his ability to manage his money well. He says that he has had some difficulty in securing enough financing for his business.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in a machine that can test a car’s carbon levels. He also wants to invest in a new business: a small picnic/seating area located next to one of Lebanon’s rivers. He will rent out the tables to families who want to enjoy the day sitting next to the river. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair equipment

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty P. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old. Liberty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Liberty owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Liberty has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Liberty joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberty is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Liberty from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Lunsar” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 2 children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 8 years now; she sells soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy S. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 32 years old, married and has school-aged children. Medy has been selling household items in the local community for the past 5 years. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income of 2,600 PHP. In 2009, Medy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Medy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Medy from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of her business

loans.name: Jorge Aladino

texts.es:
Jorge Aladino V. M. tiene 25 años. Es soltero vive con su padres, no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jorge  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jorge  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras las realiza cada mes en Matilde Esther y las ventas las realiza en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para cacao y maracuya. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener una plantación para aumentar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es el clima y las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta los deportes.
texts.en:
Jorge Aladino V. M. is 25 years old. He is single, does not have any children, and lives with his parents in the Chillanes district in the province of Bolívar. Jorge is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural loan group, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. In all, there are 23 members of the group, and the majority of them make a living farming. This is the first loan that Jorge has taken out with Cooperativa San José. Jorge also makes a living farming: he grows cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases in Matilde Esther each month and also sells his produce there. Jorge will use the loan he is requesting to invest in cacao and passion fruit seeds. He sees the loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a field so that he can increase his production. The main obstacles he faces are the climate, pests, and diseases. Apart from farming, Jorge enjoys sports.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cacao and passion fruit seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria J. lives in the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store where she sells products people use daily, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bayarbileg

texts.en:
Bayarbileg G. is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her two children in the Central province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter is a student and her son attends a local middle school. 

Bayarbileg has been living in her town for 21 years and now she operates a clothes-making business with the help of her daughter. Bayarbileg worked as a quality examiner of DaDi Mongol, a local garment industry from  2004 to 2008 and since 2009, she has owned her own small tailoring shop where she not only sews traditional Mongolian-style clothing, but also sews European-style clothing in cooperation with a tailor.  

Because she has gained a lot of experience, she knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality clothing. She wants one day to upgrade her old sewing machine to a newer, more sophisticated one so that she can experiment with more elaborate designs in her clothing. Bayarbileg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and other materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad C. owns and operates a motorcycle service. She is 59 years old, widowed and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Trinidad has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchased spare parts for the motorcycle. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza S. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Annaliza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Annaliza is just starting this business.
In 2009, Annaliza joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annaliza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sayrabubu

texts.en:
Sayrabubu U. is a 58-year-old widow with four grown children. She is engaged in sewing clothes and is known as a careful master who makes her clients look modern and elegant. One of her daughters was inspired by Sayrabubu’s creative processes and became an interior decorator, following her mother’s steps in making the world around her beautiful. 

In 1991, in order to support her children, Sayrabubu started this business with her initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan som (KGS).  She worked hard to develop this activity and, using the revenues, managed to renovate her flat. 

Sayrabubu will use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her range of products by purchasing different kinds of fabrics. With the revenues, she plans to buy accessory equipment and employ women who are good at sewing. In her personal plans, Sayrabubu wants to see her son marry and make essential preparations for a young family.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia vive en casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de EWl Alto zona urbanización Mercedario. Ella es profesora de primaria y trabaja en la unidad educativa Brasil, está es su principal fuente de ingresos para su manutención. Ella tiene un hijo y vive con su hermana. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, estuco y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para refaccionar su cocina.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro
texts.en:
Silvia lives in her own home, which is located in the Mercedario development in the city of EWI Alto Zona. She is a primary school teacher in the Brasil school. This is her main source of income to support herself. She has one child and lives with her sister.

Silvia will use this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, stucco and bricks. This will enable her to refurbish her kitchen.

This is her first loan with Impro.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to refurbish her kitchen

loans.name: Telma

texts.es:
Telma pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Telma tiene 50 años, es madre y padre para sus cinco hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio de   venta de productos de belleza de forma independiente. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Telma es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Telma que espera recibir $ 200 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar mas cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, aretes, etc. 

Telma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Telma belongs to the Juntas y Unidas (Together and United) communal bank of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, and she lives in the same city.  Cusco is an enchanting city which hearkens back to the time of the Incas.  It is built on the ancient Incan city. 

Telma is 50 years old.  She is both mother and father to her five children, and she alternates household activities with her small business as an independent seller of beauty products.  She has done this for several years now, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Telma is a hardworking and responsible woman who takes care of her family.  Telma hopes to receive $200 USD for her next loan.  At the moment, she wants to increase her business and is going to buy more cosmetics like perfumes, earrings, etc.

Telma is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy more cosmetics like perfumes, earrings, etc.

loans.name: Clarisa Angelica

texts.es: Clarisa Angélica tiene 38 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio pues inicio con este medio de vida por una compañera, que le mostro esta forma de vida Ella es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de faldas, camisas, pantalones, trajes para damas y caballeros. Sueña con llegar a tener una tienda de ropa en su hogar.
texts.en:
Clarisa Angélica is 38 years old and she sells clothes.  She has had this business for more than five years.  She started in this business because of a colleague, who showed her this mode of making a living.  She is very responsible and enjoys her business.  

The loan is for the purchase of skirts, shirts, pants and suits for women and men.  She dreams of having a clothing store in her home.

loans.use: Working capital for clothing store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine W. is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a cosmetics shop for more than four years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Catherine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open another cosmetics shop in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost her business. With the KES 20000 loan, she wants to purchase body lotions, perfumes and baby powder for sale.

loans.use: To purchase body lotions, perfumes and baby powder for sale

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi owns a hair salon for both women and men. She is 30 years old and married to a security guard, and they have two children who are two and six years old. 

Zawadi has requested this loan to buy more equipment to use in her salon and to employ more barbers. She would like to use the profits from her hair salon to set up a new restaurant to generate more income.  She has found her salon very helpful as it has allowed her to assist with many family problems.

loans.use: To add more equipment for the hair salon

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 30 años, está casada con Héctor, de 34 años de edad. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Jessica, de 13, Piero de 6 y Sandra de 4 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo al que se dedica está talentosa mujer es la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arveja, flor de gladiolo, siendo este último producto que más ingresos le genera, ya que cosecha semanalmente. Ya tiene 13 años dedicándose a ello y es conocida entre los vendedores del mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que le molesta de su trabajo, son las temporadas donde bajan los precios de sus cosechas, pero a pesar de las inconveniencias, está segura que podrá salir adelante, por ello está planeando tener ingresos extra. Ante esto planea ampliar su tienda de comestibles que tiene en la ciudad de Tarma, para ella es una buena inversión ya que se encuentra dentro de un ciudad de mayor movimiento comercial. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y asegura que obtendrá buenos resultados en sus proyectos con el apoyo de su banco comunal, que son personas responsables y trabajadoras. De obtener el crédito que solicita, está pensando invertir en la compra de 20 sacos de abono orgánico los cuales oscilan entre 100 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Nancy, aged 30, is married to Héctor. They have three children: Jessica is 13, Piero 6 and Sandra 4 years old. The family lives in its own house in the hamlet of Cumutay. This talented lady works in agriculture. Her main crops consist of potatoes, peas and gladioli. The latter is the most profitable product, because she can harvest it every week. Nancy has a 13-year experience in this activity and is well known among the merchants at the main market in Tarma. What bothers her in her work, are the seasons with low crop prices. However, in spite of the inconveniences, she is sure that she can progress.

Nancy plans to earn additional income. Given this, she plans to expand the grocery store that she owns in the city of Tarma. For her it is a good investment, because it is within a city of major commercial activity.

This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she says that she will get good results with her projects thanks to the support of her communal bank, which consists of responsible and hard-working people. She intends to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer at a price averaging 100 nuevos soles each.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Saidodkhom

texts.en:
Saidodkhom is married and has 4 children. His family lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan. Saidodkhom is a small entrepreneur and an owner of a grocery store, selling food items in his home town. His store is well known in his community for the variety of inventory and his reasonably priced, quality goods. Saidodkhom has managed to stay afloat for 5 years. He admits that it has been partly possible due to the consistent demand for the type of merchandise he offers for sale. 

Saidodkhom is seeking a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional merchandise and to increase his turnover capital. He has an enterprising spirit and is always full of ideas on how to improve his business and make it even more profitable. Saidodkhom has a good credit history, which secures prompt repayment of the current loan.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more food for increasing the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa T. is from the city of Calabayan,Purok 2 Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old and widowed with six adult children. To make a living, Alfonsa raises cassavas. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Alfonsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Alfonsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 12 years now and sells his milk to a local cooling plant. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea. 

Stephen is 48 years old and married with six children who are between the ages of 9 and 24. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that with the dairy cow he will acquire with this loan, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and for sale. He plans to construct a zero-grazing unit in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina K. and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Sann, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter. 

Dina sells roasted fish, and her husband is a construction worker who also drives a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) taxi. Dina has already asked for a Kiva loan. She is now requesting another loan of $600 to expand the space of the shop where she sells roasted fish.

loans.use: to expand her shop

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: La Señora Flor de Maria R. P. de 25 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo Rodrigo que esta empezando a asistir a la escuela. Ella es una mujer llena de metas y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante. Flor  tiene un puesto de verduras ubicado en el mercado de Opico en el departamento de La Libertad, dicho mercado es muy visitado por las personas del lugar, en especial el puesto de Flor ya que ella se destaca por ser buena vendedora y por ser amable con su clientela. Es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita surtir con todo tipo de verduras como tomates, chiles, cebollas, papas y otros, para abastecer a sus clientes con lo que necesitan y asi lograr mas demanda con las demas personas que visitan el mercado. Flor de Maria tiene gran esperanza en que esto le permitira mejorar la economia de su hogar y asi aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Flor de Maria R. P. is 25 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and her son Rodrigo, who is starting to attend school. 

She is a woman with many goals and has a lot of enthusiasm to succeed. Flor has a post with vegetables located in the Opico market in the department of La Libertad. This market is visited by local people, especially Flor's stall, as she is known for being a good salesperson and being kind to her customers. 

Because of this, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to stock up on all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, potatoes and others, to supply customers with what they need and get more demand with other people who visit the market. 

Flor de Maria has great hope that this will allow her to improve the economy of her home to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as: tomatoes, chilies, onions, and potatoes.

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Idalia Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

La señora Idalia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 10 hijos 9 de ellos ya son mayores de edad, el ultimo tiene 16 años y estudia en colegio, siete de sus hijos son solteros y viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella y su esposo  con la ayuda de sus hijos siembran  todo tipo de legumbres, maíz y frutas como melón y sandias, trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 6h30 hasta las 12h00 y de13h00 hasta las 15h00 en el sembrío. Tres días a la semana sale su esposo en su triciclo por las calles de Montecristi a vender  sus productos y otros que compra en el mercado de Portoviejo.  Trabaja en esto los viernes, sábados y domingos desde las 5am hasta las 14h00.

Este crédito es para comprar, semillas, insumos agrícolas y para pagar una parte de la mano de obra ya que tuvieron que contratar personal para la limpieza de la maleza.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener una propiedad.
texts.en:
The La Sequita community bank meets in Sequita parish, in Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí.  The locals are very hard-working people who are devoted to their families and very proud of their roots.

Idalia is a founding member of her community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are lower than those of other loan institutions.  Idalia is 53 years old, married, and has 10 children.  Nine of her children are already grown up and her youngest is 16 years old and attending high school.  Seven of her children are single and live with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Idalia and her husband, with the help of their children, grow all kinds of vegetables, corn and fruit such as melon and watermelon.  They work from Monday to Friday, from 6.30am to 12.00pm and then from 1.00pm to 3.00pm, growing their crops.  Idalia's husband goes out on his three-wheeled vehicle through the streets of Montecristi three days a week in order to sell their own produce and additional produce which they buy in Portoviejo market.  He does this on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, from 5.00am to 2.00pm.

Idalia will use this loan to buy seeds and agricultural supplies, and to pay some workers as she had to hire people to help with their weeding.  Idalia's dream is to some day own her own property.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies, and to pay workers

loans.name: Togoohuu

texts.en:
Togoohuu is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her  son is a student and her daughter hasn't reached school age yet. 

Togoohuu manages a construction materials business with the help of her husband at a trading center. She started her business in 2005. Since then her business has been quite profitable and she has been able to stabilize her business. Now her monthly sales have reached 7,000,000 MNT.  She imports her goods from Ereen, a border city of China. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. She is an honest women who attributes her business success to good communication skills. She says, "I want to complete construction work on my house and live as comfortably as I can." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more construction materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. N. is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman and they have 4 children; aged between 10 and 25 years old. Mary's business is located in Kakamega town. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the "sugar belt region". 

Mary runs a clothing sales business and her major customers are the local people. She says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open outlets elsewhere. She also hopes to give all her children a quality education to the university level. Mary describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La  señora Sandra, es casada con el señor David, con quien procreo dos hijos David Emanuel de 10 años  en quinto de primaria y el más pequeño es Jareth Julián  de un años  quienes son su razón de trabajar.

  Ella estudio lo que es belleza  profesional, y solicito el préstamo para comprar su material que utiliza para su estética como: tintes para el cabello, tratamiento de capilar, y  de colorantes,  entre otros, en donde lleva dos años y nueves meses.

   Se dedica a esta actividad  ya que sus papas la apoyaron a que estudie una carrera y le ayude mas adelante con sus ingresó de su hogar ya que lo termino cuando estaba casada y gracias adiós logro terminarla.

    Su más grande deseo es que con el tiempo pueda tener ahorrar para comprar materiales y mandar a construir su estética y tenga más clientela para así tener su trabajo en donde logre salir adelante con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra is married to Mr. David with whom she has two children: David Emanuel, 10, and if fifth grade and Jareth Julián, 1. They are the reasons she works.

She studied to be a professional Beautician and asked for the loan to buy the supplies she uses in her salon like: hair color, scalp treatments, dyes, among others.  She’s been in business two years and nine months.

She is in this business because her parents supported her so that she could study a career that would help her later on with income for her home since she finished her training when she was already married and, thanks be to God, she managed to complete it.

Her greatest wish is that in time she’ll have savings to buy materials to build her salon and have more customers to have work and get ahead with her small family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Marie Elise

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 37ans et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17ans et 8ans est dans la vente des beignets il y a 14ans, ce commerce lui a permis à contribuer aux taches ménagères.
Par jour, elle a des ventes de 18000f et son activité est située dans un coin a l’entrée d’un centre de soins de santé  ou les clients sont diversifiés.
Avec ce prêt, elle veut augmenter son stock en achetant, 1sac de farine, 1sac de sucre, 1sac de maïs, 1bidon de 10litre d’huile, 2 paquet de levure boulangère.
Son projet est de faire une unité de pâtisserie avec livraison et pour cela, elle veut beaucoup vendre, Réaliser des bénéfices considérables, épargner, afin de sollicité un prêt plus important à l’avenir.
Comme une mère avertie, elle encourage ses filles  à faire la  même activité quand elles  sont en vacances.
texts.en:
A married woman for 37 years and mother of 5 children whose ages vary from 25 to 40 years, she has been selling fritters for 14 years. This business has enabled her to contribute to the household tasks.
Every day, she makes sales for 18000 f and her stall is situated in a corner at the entrance to a health care center where the customers are of diverse origin.
With this loan, she wishes to increase her stock by purchasing ; 1 sack of flour,1 sack of sugar,1 sack of corn,1 can of 10 liters of  oil and 2 packets of baker’s yeast.
Her plan is to create a pastry company offering delivery and with this in mind, she wants to make a lot of sales, make considerable profits and save up in order to request a larger loan in the future.
As an experienced mother, she encourages her daughters to do the same activity when they are on holiday.

loans.use: purchase : a sack of flour,a sack of sugar,a can of oil,yeast and a sack of corn.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a single mother of one child.  Her child attends school. Nzara lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing and school fees.

For the past 2 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza has a shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has had her business for three years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Juan Eric

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, la actividad la aprendió de su padre.
Por el momento se encuentra cultivando para ello solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario y poder realizar bien el trabajo, espera tener un buen invierno que le permita aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es apoyar a sus hijos a través de su trabajo diario, con el mejor interés de superación para el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living growing maize and breeding livestock. He has two children and lives with his wife. He has made his living in agriculture for 8 years and works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm. He learned the trade from his father. 

At the moment he is farming, this is why he is requesting a loan to invest it in manure and fertilizers. This purchase will help him to have everything necessary and be able to do a good job. He hopes to have a good winter that will allow him to increase production.

His objective is to support his children through his daily work with the improvement of his family’s future and in their best interest.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth D. 28 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su madre, 4 hijos y 3 sobrinos. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora que ha trabajado durante mucho tiempo para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee un pequeño comedor en el cual venD. rica comida y bebidas. Su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y muy concurrida por los habitantes del lugar. Muchas personas prefieren los ricos platillos D. Yesenia ya que para ella lo más importante son sus clientes y siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa. Su sueño es aumentar la variedad D. platillos que ofrece para poder atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel D. ingresos. Para esto necesita invertir para comprar la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración D. los deliciosos platillos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los insumos necesarios como: verduras, carnes, pollos, bebidas, etc. Que le permitan elabora variedad D. platillos con el objetivo D. atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y por enD. su nivel D. ingresos.
texts.en: Yesenia Elizabeth is 28 years old and lives with his mother, four children, and three nephews.  She’s a hardworking and above all very enterprising woman who’s worked long to get her family ahead.  She has a small restaurant where she sells delicious food and drinks.  Her business is located in a very strategic zone, well known to its residents.  Many people prefer Yesenia’s dishes because her customers are the most important thing to her and she always serves them with a smile.  Her hope is to increase the variety of dishes she offers in order to attract more customers and increase her income levels.  To do this, she needs to buy ingredients to make her delicious dishes, so she has seen fit to request a loan through INTEGRAL.  She will use the money to buy things like vegetables, meats, poultry, drinks, etc., that will allow her to make her dishes and attract more customers, and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Yosip; el socio tiene  31 años de edad; el socio tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad,  el socio es soltero y el socio  es guía de turismo de profesión desde hace 5 años atrás y siempre que puede implementa su tienda de alquiler de  equipo  turístico,  el socio compra carpas,  matras, zapatillas, ponchos, sleeping,  el socio  alquila equipo de camping para los trekking, y también compra  para implementar  la cocina con  sillas, mesas, platos y el socio apertura su tienda de alquiler de camping. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo para alquilar.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, in the Department of Cusco.

His name is Yosip, and he is 31 years old. He has one 8-year-old son. He is single, and he has worked as a tourist guide for 5 years. In addition, whenever he can, he stocks his store renting equipment to tourists. He buys tents, camping mattresses, sport shoes, ponchos and sleeping bags. He rents camping equipment for trekking, and he also buys items to stock the kitchen, such as chairs, tables and plates. He has opened a store to rent camping equipment. The borrower is requesting a loan to invest in buying equipment to rent out. 

The borrower is grateful for the support that will be provided to him, and accordingly, he is committed to fulfilling his payment schedule in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying equipment to rent.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра проживает в районе Кубодиён. Возраст, 34 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Сайёра имеет среднее образование. Он у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. В основном она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается восемь лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух голов бычков.
texts.en: Sayora lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is 34 years old, divorced and has two children. Sayora has secondary education. She breeds large horned cattle at home. She mainly breeds it for future sale. She has been in this business for eight years. Sayora is taking out the loan to buy two heads of calves.

loans.use: to buy two heads of calves

loans.name: Faavae Setalisa

texts.en:
Faavae is 44 years of age and married with three children. Faavae owns and operates a business venture selling dairy products in the local community. She has four years of experience in this business. Faavae needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Faavae joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Faavae's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business.

loans.name: Sarmad

texts.en:
Sarmad is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with six family members of whom three work.

Sarmad has owned a children’s clothing store since 2010. He has more than four years experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of customer’s needs and a good reputation, and he is well known in his surroundings. His store is situated in a commercial area so a number of potential customer pass by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy an electric generator and a mannequin and to make showcases for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator and a mannequin and to make showcases for his store.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is married and has eight children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, Anjelina has operated a food stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and delayed payments by debtors. She dreams of establishing a poultry business in the future.

Anjelina is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase timber and cement to repair her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and cement to repair her food stall.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde, 51 years old, is married and has two grown children. She has a retail shop where she sells different products in their community.

Clotilde is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy drinks, snack foods and spices for her store so she can more offer products to the people in the community. She hopes to gain more income to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods and spices for her store.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is 30 years old and married with 8 children, none of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Monika requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to able her to purchase more charcoal for sale. She says that with the extra income from this loan she is planning to send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 39-year-old mother of five daughters and one son. She is married to Khalaf who has retired from the military and started working as a bus driver. To be able to support their family, Mona started a small retail business from selling clothes at home, which grew through the last two years to include accessories. Now that Mona has gained a respected number of customers through friends and neighbors, she decided to increase the quantity she has of goods and add blankets to sell as we are knocking on winter’s doors. In the future, Mona wants to expand her business by having her own store to sell clothes, blankets, and accessories, and have a special section for home products.

loans.use: to buy clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario comes from a large family. He was given the opportunity to enter college and took courses in criminology, but it’s sad to say that he only finished two years. He did not continue college because his parents could not afford his expenses in school. Now, Apolinario is 56 years old, and married with four children. He engages in the farming business, planting rice in his village. His wife is a housekeeper.

With his interest to help his children finish their college education, Apolinario did his best just to pay for their college fees. He sold part of his farm just to support the needs of his children in school. Nowadays, Apolinario is proud to share that his four children are all working as seaman and already have their own families.

Apolinario doesn’t want to rely only on his children because they already have their own families. For his farming business, Apolinario is asking for a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
A diario, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, en el municipio del Sauce, Alejandro está preparado para su labor diaria abriendo su negocio que consiste en un pequeño taller de bicicleta y venta de repuestos el cual atiende a diario habiendo adquirido mucha experiencia en este trabajo.

Actualmente Alejandro requiere invertir en el taller y para ello acudió a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de rines, llantas, neumáticos, rash, cadena, monturas, manecillas, pescantes, pedales, postes y cables. 

Al adquirir estos enseres continuará vendiéndolos y brindándole servicio a la población para así alcanzar las mejores condiciones de vida tanto para él como para su familia
texts.en:
Every day Alejandro gets up very early in the morning to prepare for another days’s work in the municipality of El Sauce. He opens up his small bicycle repair shop, which also sells spare parts. His daily work in the shop has provided him with a lot of experience in this area. 

Alejandro currently needs to invest in the repair shop and so he turned to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of wheels, wheel-rims, tires, chains, saddles, handles, seats, pedals, poles, cables and other bicycle parts.  

When he receives this equipment he will continue to sell them and provide a service to the public so that he can he attain the highest quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy wheels, wheel-rims, tires, chains, saddles, handles, seats, pedals, poles and cables.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 30-year-old married lady who has one daughter. Her husband works in a private company.

Three years ago Yasmeen opened a small beauty salon to practice what she got training on, and through these three years, she was able to expand and add more seats and addmore services preparing brides' make-up and hair styles. 

Now Yasmeen has applied for a loan to buy new equipment and repair a few things in the salon.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and repair a few things in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Milton Gustavo

texts.es:
el joven Milton Gustavo tiene 23 años de edad, esta soltero y su principal fuente de ingresos es la venta de verduras, actividad que realiza desde hace dos años, manifiesta que durante ese tiempo le ha ido muy bien, sus ventas las realiza al por mayor a diferentes negocios del municipio de Las Trojes, Milton viaja a la ciudad de Tegucigalpa para comprar verduras dos veces por semana (martes y viernes) y despues las vende en las Trojes en su carro pickup.
utilizara el credito para comprar mas verduras, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son mayores y no cubre con todos los pedidos que le hacen.
texts.en:
Young Milton Gustavo is 23 years old and single.  His main source of income is selling vegetables, a job he has been doing for two years.  He says that during this time it has gone very well for him.  He makes his sales wholesale to different businesses in the town of Las Trojes.  Milton travels to the city of Tegucigalpa to buy vegetables twice a week (Tuesdays and Fridays) and later sells them in Las Trojes in his pickup truck.

He will use the loan to buy more vegetables because his customer demand is great and he cannot meet all the orders they have made.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, chilis, and yucca.

loans.name: Maria Elina

texts.es:
La señora María Elina, tiene 39 años de edad, casada, vive en Quintas Venecia, la Lima, Cortes, junto a su compañero de hogar y sus tres hijos de 21, 18 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo es transportista.
Maria  Elina siempre ha tenido el deseo de superarse y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, hace dos años ella empezó vendiendo cosméticos, carteras, bolsos, fajas y achinerías, en cantidades pequeñas, ahora ya tiene mas surtido su negocio gracias a su buena administración y a los prestamos que  ODEF a otorgado. Este es su segundo préstamo y lo esta invirtiendo en productos de cosméticos, achinerías, carteras, bolsos y fajas, para mantener el negocio surtido e incrementar sus ventas. Con este negocio al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias ella quiere tener una mejor estabilidad económica  y  contribuir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María Elina, 39, is married and lives in Quintas Venecia, La Lima, Cortes, with her housemate and three children who are 21, 18 and 16 years of age.  Her husband works in transportation.

María Elina has always wanted to get ahead and have her own source of income.  Two years ago she started to sell cosmetics, purses, wallets, girdles and assorted low-cost items in small amounts.  Now she has more varied inventory in her business thanks to her good administration of it and to ODEF loans she’s gotten.

This is her second loan and she is using it to buy cosmetics, low-cost assorted items, wallets, purses and girdles to keep the business well-stocked and increase sales.  

She spends twelve hours daily at work and she wants to have better economic stability from it and contribute toward household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Fatima” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memunatu. Memunatu is age thirty-nine; she was born in Port Loko town but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For fifteen years now, Memunatu has been selling clothes. With this loan, she will buy clothes wholesale to add to her business inventory.


(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B.Konteh, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale prices to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en: Marie Solange is 24. She is married with three children aged between one month and six years. The oldest child attends school. She wants a loan to buy equipment for her salon, such as shampoo, dryers and mirrors. Marie Solange has spent three years running this business. With the profits, she will renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 55 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has three children. 
Leonida has a general store and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock such as shampoo,toothpaste,soap,vinegar,and salt for her general store business. Leonida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Leonida hopes to have more savings for her children education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo,toothpaste,soap,vinegar,and salt for her general store business.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is 34 years old, widow with 2 kids and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Roy is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been in this business for seven years. Each month he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2008, Roy joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services, to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Roy wants to save money as a reserve for his kids future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle.

loans.name: Dovi

texts.en:
Dovi K., 38 years old, is married and the mother of two children. Her main business activity is the selling of smoked fish. Her husband is a bike mechanic, but he does not practice his trade due to a lack of means to get established. As a result, all household responsibilities fall upon the shoulders of Mrs. K.. She is thus driven to do her best struggling under these responsibilities. Smoked fish is of the utmost necessity, and the market demand she receives each day is huge. But due to a lack of funds, she has not managed to increase production to meet the demand.

Mrs. K. is now requesting a loan of $850 as capital for buying boxes of fish and the wood need to fuel her stoves. This will allow her to produce and sell enough smoked fish, to have substantial income, and therefore to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Dovi, âgée de 38 ans est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle a comme activité principale, la vente des poissons fumés. Son mari est un mécanicien à deux roues mais il n’exerce pas le métier à cause du manque de moyen pour s’installer. Du coup, toutes les charges du ménage se reposent sur Madame K. Dovi et elle est obligée de se battre pour être à la hauteur de ses responsabilités. Le poisson fumé est un produit de première nécessité et la demande que reçoit Mme K. tous les jours est très grande. Mais par manque de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à augmenter sa production en vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

Aujourd’hui, Madame K. Dovi sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat des cartons de poissons, de bois de chauffe et refaire ses fourneaux. Cela lui permettra de produire et de vendre assez de poissons fumés disposer d’un revenu consistant en vue de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fish and smoke them

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en:
This 36-year-old man is a miller. He has run this business for 5 years. Elbrus works hard for the success of his children. With this business he meets the needs of his family.
Elbrus is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Mahmudlu  village. He is married and has 3 children.
Having borrowed $600 he bought wheat. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the spare parts for the mill.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for  his mill

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking, honest and responsible woman. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver in a transportation company, but his salary is not enough to cover all the family expenses; due to this situation Carmen started her business of selling footwear two years ago. Thanks to her taste for sales and character, it is easy for her to relate to others and like this increase the number of clients. >

Carmen wishes her business grow; now she is requesting for a loan of $250, that she will use to purchase merchandise. She promises to repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. Be an important part of Carmen’s dreams and help her family to improve their conditions of life. They are very grateful for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer en un empresa de transporte, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ante esta situación Carmen emprendió su negocio con la venta de calzado desde hace dos años, en la que gracias a su gusto por las ventas y carácter, se le facilita relacionarse con los demás y de esta manera incrementar sus clientes. Carmen desea que su negocio pueda creer, en estos momentos solicita un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Se parte importante en los sueños de Carmen y ayuda a su familia a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy Merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Narciza

texts.es:
Ms Narciza has a business selling ice cream and cooked viscera. She has had this business for ten years, and it has grown noticeably. She started with little capital, and today she has three employees who help her with the distribution of ice cream. Her husband and son also help her.

She hopes to purchase two tricycles for the distribution of ice cream, especially since her customers continue to grow and she is the only provider in the area.

She is 32 years old with 2 children. Her goal is to grow her business and have her own place from which to sell her ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Narciza tiene un negocio de venta de Vísceras cocidas también vende helados, en este negocio tiene diez años, ella empezó con un capital pequeño hoy tiene tres empleados que le ayudan con la distribución de los helados también le ayuda su esposo y su hijo, es notable su crecimiento.

Quiere comprar dos triciclos para la distribución de los helados , ya que sus clientes crecen y en el sector solo ellos son los proveedores.

Tiene 32 años y 2 hijos su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer y tener su propio local de distribución de helados.

loans.use: To purchase two carts/tricycles for greater sales

loans.name: Assucena Albertina J

texts.pt:
Assucena Albertina Jorge M. is 21 years old and lives with her husband and son. She lives in the Polana Caniço area and runs a clothing business in the Xipamanine market. She purchases her products in South Africa and in Downtown Maputo. She entered the program in February of 2007, taking a loan of 6,000 MT (meticais). She is now seeking the same amount to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Assucena Albertina Jorge M. tem 21 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com o esposo e um filho. Vive no bairro Polana Caniço e tem o seu negócio de venda de roupa no mercado Xipamanine em Maputo. Faz as suas compras na Àfrica do Sul e na baixa da cidade de Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2007 e tomou de empréstimo 6.000MT. Vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more inventory for the holiday season

loans.name: Davron

texts.en: Davron K. lives in Mastchokh; he is married and has 4 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. Mr. K. is in the business of livestock, milk-sour products sales. He works intensively. He dreams of buying a wide and roomy home so his family could live happily . Now he requests a loan of US$600 to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy a home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes and materials to sell

loans.name: Saidat

texts.en: Saidat A. is 28 years old, is married, and has 2 children. She hails from the Mushin Area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells bags of flour, rice, and beans. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan amount of $700 to buy more bags for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, flour, and beans for sale

loans.name: Laura Mery's Group

texts.es:
Mery, Isabel, and Teresa have belonged to the Banco Comunal Emprendedoras for 8 months, 1 year, and 1 year respectively. In their Banco Comunal, they have learned to save money, be responsible and to deal with clients.

Mery, 32 years old, is married and has one 4 year-old son; she has a store at her house where she has been selling groceries, vegetables, etc. for 5 years.

Teresa lives with her partner; she is 21 years old and has one daughter that is one year old. She is studying Accounting. Teresa and her husband sell clothes on order, their merchandise come from Lima.

Isabel is a 54-year-old single mother of 4 children; two of whom live with her. She makes skirts typical to her area. She makes them at her house and sells them in the Santa Clara market.

Mery, Isabel, and Teresa are asking for loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles respectively. They will use this money to buy rice, sugar, notebooks, pencils, pants, sweaters and fabric.

They will use their savings to build their houses, buy groceries and pay for their children's education. Mery, Isabel, and Teresa dream of having their own houses, offering a good education to their children, finishing their studies, and having a job.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Mery, Isabel y Teresa pertenecen al Banco Comunal Emprendedoras hace 8 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables y como tratar a los clientes.

Mery es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Mery tiene una bodega en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras, actividad que realiza hace 5 años.

Por otro lado Teresa es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hija de 1 año, estudiante de Contabilidad, Teresa junto a su esposo venden ropa a pedido, su mercadería lo traen de la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Isabel es madre soltera, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Isabel confecciona polleras típicas de la zona, su taller esta en su casa y vende en el mercado Santa Clara.

Mery, Isabel y Teresa necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cuadernos, lapiceros, pantalones, chompas, telas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizarán para construir su casa, alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Mery, Isabel y Teresa son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, culminar sus estudios y tener trabajo.

loans.use: Mery, Isabe, and Teresa are asking for loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, and 400 soles respectively. They will use this money to buy rice, sugar, notebooks, pencils, pants, sweaters and fabric.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Señora Melania has made a living by making bread for one year. Her small bakery offers bread to everyone who lives inside and outside her community. She has dedicated herself to this business for one year. She also sells cosmetics and clothing.

Doña Melania is an enterprising, positive woman. She hopes in the future to be able to grow her business to the degree that she can make deliveries of bread to small grocery stores so she can capture new customers that value the quality of her products. As time goes by, she hopes to be able to diversify her products and reach new segments of the market. She will invest this loan in the purchase of supplies for her business.
