His dream is to complete his building project to start a business for his wife and buy a chainsaw to make charcoal after his retirement and to do this he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials for his building project (boards, planks, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Juan y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores trabajan independientes. Ellos viven en armonía familiar en el caserío de Cumutay. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos. Y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, y carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen  de la ciudad. Además le gusta mucho este; en la actualidad le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también prepara y comercializa comida en la feria de la ciudad.  Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito. Basilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuir en sus cultivos de alverja y papa de la variedad “única”; ya que hace 3 meses sembró y tienen que ser nutridos y fortificados.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, lives in her own house with her partner, Juan and 5 of their 7 children since the two oldest work on their own.  They live in harmony in the village of Cumutay.  This hardworking woman is a farmer together with her husband.  She plants potatoes, field peas, corn and gladiolus, and  she says that they have to be very dedicated to the work and watch her fields patiently.  She waits for the harvest while caring for her animals such as: cows, bulls, sheep and pigs.  When harvest time of their good crops comes, she sees the rewards of all their effort and she and her relatives carry the heavy sacks of their products.  She sells them at competitive prices to the wholesalers who come to the city.  What she likes also is that currently the work allows her to offer her family a good quality of life.  As if it were nothing she also prepares and sells food in the city market.
And since she is an enterprising woman in the future she plans to plant more to improve her earnings.
She belongs to the communal bank “Lindo Amanacer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Dawn of Cumutay) and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She promises to be very punctual with her payments and she is very grateful to all the people who made the financing possible.  Basilia will use the loan to buy various sacks of natural fertilizers to spread on her crops of special field peas and potatoes since she planted them three months ago and they have to be fed and fortified.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker earning $2 per day for his income. She has two children, 5 years old and 2 months old. The older one is studying. Every month, she spends $80 on food, $10 on school fees, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work and also to provide motor taxi service when he is off work. She wants to help her husband to earn money to support the family so she has a plan to buy grocery goods to sell at home when she can save enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's travel to work.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: 27-year-old Janette earns a living through farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Janette works for her family. Janette says she is able to provide for her family through her business. She hopes to continue generating income from her farm. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Janette hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Editha has been in this business for 9 years.

Editha requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, etc. to sell to customers. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants etc. to sell to customers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old and lives in Labo Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Emma is a buyer of coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emma hopes to have a lot of capital and be a copra (dried meat of the coconut) buyer. Emma is a (MIGS) Member In Good Standing of PMPC. She is a hardworking mother and an honest person who takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

loans.name: Ishkhan

texts.en:
Ishkhan is 58 years old. He lives in Yerevan with his wife, who does not have a job. Ishkhan’s son lives and works in the Russian Federation.  For more than 30 years, Ishkhan has run a workshop where he repairs cars. He repurposed his home garage to do this. He has a lot of experience and therefore has never had a shortage of clients. He sometimes buys old and broken cars to repair and sell. Thanks to his business, Ishkhan is able to provide for his family.

Ishkhan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to purchase a broken car to repair and resell.

loans.use: to buy a car to repair and resell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow and blessed with three children who are still in school.  She runs a hardware shop to support her  family. She has been in this business for three years.  She also runs a green grocer to earn extra income.  She has employed one person to help her manage the business.  

Mercy is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy paints and bolts for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: buy paints and bolts

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo , vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 25 días de nacido  en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá agrandar la cantidad de trabajo en el campo y comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes ninguno. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina is 22, is in a common-law relationship, and has a son. She lives with her husband and 25 day-old son in Ventanas in Los Rios province. The "Dulce Sentimiento" communal bank is located in Recinto Caimito II, in Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of Pueblo Viejo canton.  

The members of this communal bank work in short cycle agriculture, and grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Diane grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. They carry out their purchases and sales in Ventanas canton.

She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer, in order to maintain her crop in good condition. 

The loan will be a big help because she will be able to expand her production, and buy supplies and seeds with no difficulty. 

Her dream is to keep  working, in order to buy more land. In her free time she likes to dance.

loans.use: To buy seeds, and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Stevenia's Group

texts.en:
Stevenia's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Stevenia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Stevenia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Stevenia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Stevenia to generate greater profits and pay school fees and medical expenses. Stevenia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Stevenia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Stevenia's future prospects by helping her to learn life planning skills like how to be assertive.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Bertha Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra.Bertha tiene 32 años, está acompañada con el Sr. Crispín viven en la Ciudad de Itá. Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cria gallinas, patos, chanchos, guineas y ademas posee vacas que producen una buena cantidad de leche que pone a la venta, su vaca lechera produce 30 litros de leche por día.
Ella comenta que trabaja mucho todos los días para poder criar a sus animales y para que gracias a eso pueda tener un mejor ingreso con lo que podrá ayudar en los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales, ya que le será de mucha ayuda. La Sra. Bertha se define como una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, que día a día se sacrifica para llevar adelante su pequeña granja.
texts.en:
Bertha, 32, lives with Crispín in the city of Itá.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens, ducks, pigs and guinea pigs.  In addition, she has cows that produce a good amount of milk that she sells; her dairy cow produces about 30 liters of milk per day.

She comments that she works hard every day to be able to raise her animals so that she can earn better income to help with household expenses.

She’s asking for a loan to buy animal feed which will be of much help.  Bertha defines herself as a hardworking, responsible person who sacrifices day to day to make progress with her little farm.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is 36 years old and widowed. She works in a photography studio taking photos for people whether in the studio or at their parties such as  wedding parties.

After gaining experience in photography, Feryal decided to start her own business using her connections, so as a start she has applied for a loan to buy a new  professional digital camera and a PC so she can one day have her own studio.

loans.use: to buy a new professional  digital camera and a PC.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzyuki is a passion fruit farmer who lives in the Likoni are of Kenya. He is married and has seven children. When Nzyuki sold his farm produce a few months back, he was enlightened about passion fruit farming and investing the sales into the project. It has continued to give him returns. He has been running the business for the last four years.

He is applying for a loan KES 20,000 to pay for the transportation of his produce from the farm to the market. He has the ambition of supplying produce to various parts of the country.

Nzyuki will use the extra income from the business to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: To pay for the transportation of his produce from the farm to the market.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de Calca y donde vive, ella tiene 45 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo, ella es profesora y trabaja  en uno de los colegios más importantes de la ciudad de Calca, ella  trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Ya son 10 años que se desempeña su carrera profesional y le va muy bien pero el sueldo que le paga el estado no le alcanza para los gastos del hogar entonces se las ingenio para abrir un negocio. El negocio que abrió es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad vio que el negocio está creciendo entonces ella necesita más capital de trabajo por lo tanto requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallinas. 

Luz Marina es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in the city of Calca where she lives.  She is 45 years old and has a partner with whom she has two children.  She alternates her home duties with her work.  She is a teacher and and works at one of the most important schools in the city of Calca.  She works from eight in the morning until one in the afternoon Monday through Friday.  She has had her professional career for 10 years now and it is going very well for her, but the salary the state pays her doesn't cover her household expenses, so she found a way to start a business.  The business she started is that of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She saw that this business is growing and so she needs more working capital, which is why she needs this loan to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

Luz Marina is a member of the Virgen de Asunta de Calca Group, which is made up of 15 members who live in the city of Calca in the Calca Province of the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca se dedica a la venta de chompas hace 17 años estas prendas son  para hombres, mujeres y niños el puesto esta ubicado en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Comenzó con un capital mínimo y gracias a la ayuda que le brindo la institución actualmente tiene un puesto surtido con todo tipo de prendas de distintos precios. El domicilio de la Sra. Esta ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio junto al apoyo de su esposo lograron salir adelante en la actualidad el esposo sr. Melitón  trabaja de garzón en distintas zonas de la ciudad, la Sra. Francisca solicita el  crédito esta destinado a incrementar su capital comprando ropa al por mayor por la demanda de fin de año, ya que esta época tiene mucha venta, la Sra. francisca se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca has been selling sweaters for 17 years. These garments are for men, women, and children. Her vending post is located along one of the busiest avenues in the city of La Paz. Sra. Francisca started with minimal capital. Thanks to the assistance Emprender provided, she currently has a well-stocked post with all types of garments at different prices.

Her home is located in the District of Villa San Antonio where she lives with her husband. They have been able to forge ahead together. Her husband, Sr. Melitón, currently works as a waiter in different parts of the city. Sra. Francisca is requesting a loan so that she can increase her capital for buying clothes in bulk that are in demand for the year-end season. She has many sales during this time. Sra. Francisca is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the year-end season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old. She has owned a food stall for the past year. She wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar and rice to sell. She will use the profits to renovate her house. In the future, Josephine dreams to own a shop.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Doha

texts.en: Doha is a 23 year old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and two children who are still studying. Her Husband is the main income provider in the family. Due to the bad circumstances, she decided to support her husband who works as a soldier in the Lebanese army and she was working days and nights to be able to manage her expenses and business operations as well. She has opened her house a room to prepare homemade foods since three years and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments… in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own Store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions such as seeds, refreshments…

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.en:
Akouwa K. was born in Tabligbo, in the prefecture of Yoto, on October 30, 1979. She is married, the mother of a children, and the guardian of another child. Her husband, who is a scrap metal merchant, goes from construction site to construction site looking for work. Nearly all household expenses rest on the shoulders of Mrs. K.. Five years ago, she began her business selling tomatoes using the paltry resources she had at the time. Her business has not changed significantly since its beginnings due to insufficient capital. It is doing OK now, because of her devotion and determination, and so she is deserving of financial support today.

Towards the goal of improving her business, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $750 for keeping a big enough inventory to meet the demands of her customers. To finance this women is to rescue her entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Akouwa est née le 30 Octobre 1979 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle élève un autre enfant d’un proche parent. Son mari est un ferrailleur qui va de chantier en chantier pour rechercher du travail. La presque totalité des charges du ménage reposent sur la femme. Elle a commencé ses activités de vente de tomate il y a 5 ans avec les moyens dérisoires qu’elle disposait. Cette activité qui n’avait pas connu une évolution significative au départ pour insuffisance de fonds de commerce, est aujourd’hui assez florissante à cause du dévouement et la détermination de Madame K. Akouwa qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement aujourd’hui.

Dans le but d’améliorer son commerce, Madame K. sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir à faire un stock suffisant pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver toute une famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling various produce, such as tomatoes

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.en: Hello, my name is Martha. My primary activity is making and selling reed baskets. I have been doing this type of work from my home for several years. I have a good client base, and to me, the most important thing is to be able to help my family and generate an income to cover my family’s expenses. My children also help me during their free time.

loans.use: Purchase of reeds (raw material)

loans.name: Edilia

texts.en:
Edilia is 32 years old, she is married and has 1 child. Her business is 4 years old and she sells all kind of clothing, from men's socks to lady's cowboy boots.

She invested a previous loan in the purchase of winter clothing, which enabled her to realize several orders of fixed customers. With the income of her business, she can pay for the family expenses as well as for her studies: she is studying Administration.

In the beginning, it was hard for her to start her business as she didn't have the capital necessary. She could make her first investments thanks to her first loan. Her business is growing, and she is thinking about opening another subsidiary. In this enterprise, Edilia is helped by her sister, also a student, who is doing a market study and who will be responsible to run the new store. In order to succeed with this, Edilia want to re-activate her credit line with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Edilia tiene 32 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 4 años donde vende todo tipo de ropa desde medias para caballeros hasta camperas para damas. La inversión del préstamo, lo destinó a la compra de ropas de invierno, lo cual posibilito la realización de varios pedidos de clientes habituales. Los ingresos que le genera este negocio, permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos de su estudio, ya que está cursando la carrera de Administración

Al inicio fue muy duro y difícil para ella poder iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con el capital necesario, y las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias al préstamo al cual accedió. Su negocio está creciendo y ya tiene pensado más adelante abrir otra sucursal. En este emprendimiento Edilia cuenta con el apoyo y acompañamiento de su hermana, también estudiante, quien está llevando adelante los estudios de mercado y quien sería la responsable de atender el nuevo negocio. Para concretar este proyecto tiene pensado activar nuevamente su línea de crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy ladies' lingerie and men's clothing

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Mr. Vusal is an IDP from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his private business the same year. He is 28 and single. He had a very low income before and decided to apply for a $550 loan from Normicro Baku branch to solve his problems.  With his next loan he plans to buy a modern electronic scale for his shop.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Jawiyah

texts.en: Jawiyah is 45 years old and is married with two daughters, aged 18 and 14. Her husband has no fixed income, and is only able to do odd jobs. Therefore, to contribute to her family's income, she sells food and snacks at her small kiosk. She usually earns $5.50 per day and it's not enough to cover her family's daily needs. She asks for a $75 loan to expand her business. Jawiyah is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some food and increase the capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes P. is a widow and a mother of 2 children. She is 52 years old and hails from semi rural area in Lagos State. She is a farmer and she is into vegetable farming (pankin). She has been in her business since 1992 and needs the loan of $175 to buy more pankin seedily for planting and farm maintenance. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more pankin seedily for planting

loans.name: Hasifer

texts.en: Hasifer is a 41 year old widow with 7 children, and she cares for 3 orphans. For the past 18 years she has run a retail shop where she sells basic essentials to the villagers. Her shop is like so many others of its kind selling maize flour, soap, bread, sugar, sodas, beer, etc. In the villages, it is quite common to see businesses that look exactly the same. In poor areas, you can not afford “luxury” items so everyone sells the basic essentials. It should be noted that few people lack for the basics and their needs are not forever growing like in the developed world. So far, they have not been marketed to the point that they begin to believe they are lacking in something. For the most part, the villages are quite pleasant, safe, with a strong sense of community. People have time to visit and look after their children. Time passes much more slowly, and I find it a great respite from the developed world. With her loan Hasifer will continue to stock her small store with items for her village. One of her dreams to buy a matatoo which she would operate to and from her village.

loans.use: Hasifer plans to use her loan to stock her small store with items for her village.

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en: My name is Kaneez Y.. Neither I nor my husband are educated but still we are familiar with its importance.  Therefore, we send our kids to school. It is because we do not want them to do menial jobs like us but rather obtain a high level of success in their lives. I have five boys and one girl. My husband is a driver at someone’s house. We have also a rickshaw that we rent to supplement our income. Now our rickshaw is need of repairs and we need a loan for this purpose. I request loans for my loan group members as well: Parween H., who will use the loan to buy a donkey cart. Haleema B., who will invest the loan to start a barber shop and Shamim B. who will also buy a donkey cart to transport animal fodder on it.

loans.use: To repair rickshaw

loans.name: Honorio

texts.es:
Honorio has a workshop where he creates leather footwear for women and works with an employee. His residence is located in the Tembladerani zone of the Western Slope of the city of La Paz. He has three children and his wife is a merchant. This is the fifth time that he has requested a loan from Impro and his record qualifies as him as a good client: that is to say he has a good record of compliance in the repayment of his loans. The loan will be used for the purchase of materials (leather, soles, heels, glue and pvc). His previous credit record permit us to agree to this loan since he has experience as an artisan. He has been a client of IMPRO since the year 2005.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Honorio tiene un taller donde elabora calzados de cuero para mujer y trabaja con un empleado. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene Tres hijos y su esposa es comerciante. Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro y su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. El crédito será destinado para la compra de de materia prima (cuero, planta, suela, tacos, clefa y pvc). Su antecedente crediticio le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como artesano. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: To buy materials such as leather, soles, glue and heels to make footwear.

loans.name: Sareourn

texts.en: Mrs. Sareourn Y. is a farmer who has worked in the fields nearly all her life. She is 60 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband, Eourn Sun, works as a farmer with her. Both of them usually earn $7 a day by selling vegetables in a local market. She asks for a loan so that she can buy more crop seeds, to grow a more diverse crop, and thus increase her business in the market.

loans.use: To buy more crop seed to grow crops.

loans.name: Kampong Svay Ii Group

texts.en: The Kampong Svay II group consists of twelve members, and Mrs. Bunthin S. is the leader. She is 40 and is the mother of four children, two of whom stuD.. The others stay at home. Mrs. Bunthin S. is a grocer and she also runs a lottery business in the village. Her husband, Mr. Meng Hong, is a house builder. Last year, her children fell ill, and to cure them Mrs. Bunthin S. spent around $10 for each child each time they were sick. She has had a loan from another microfinance institution, which she used to buy groceries to sell. Now she would like to request a loan to fix the ceiling of her house.

loans.use: To fix the ceiling

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Mrs. Bunmi I. is 34 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 4 children. She started selling provisions 2005, and she is soliciting for a loan of $450 to enable her buy more provisions to sell to improve her business. She has been a dedicated LAPO client for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more Provisions for sales

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with a grown son. She started her business selling knitted wear a year ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Currently Marina has about $2,400 in turnover capital. Her monthly profit is about $1,400.

Marina is a very hard worker. She has proven to be a very prudent client of Hope Intl-Nadiya Ukraine – she never asks for a bigger loan than she can pay back. These loans, in combination with her perseverance, trustworthiness and responsibility, have helped to guarantee success in her business. Marina is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivna to increase her inventory. She would like to purchase assorted knitted wear at wholesale prices to resell in her store. Marina is able to reduce her transportation expenses by purchasing more inventory in bulk when she travels to remote wholesale centers. Marina’s long-term goal is the continued expansion of her business. She would like to purchase more vending facilities in the Nikolaev area and eventually open a whole network of knitted wear stores in Nikolaev.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria Salomé

texts.es:
Salome, 60, is a lady who has had to work since she was very young, first to help her parents and then to help her own family. She owns a taxi which her husband drives daily to support their family. She also works, as a secretary for the taxi cooperative of which she's a member. She has four children, three now prepared for life and one still at school. Twelve years ago she pulled her savings together to buy the cab. Her short-term plan is to get enough money together to buy another one.

The goal of remodeling her house is the one that she wants to fulfill now and she's asking for a loan to invest in a false ceiling, one step along the way to ultimately seeing the whole house transformed.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Salomé es una señora de 60 años, que desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y después para hacerse cargo de su propia familia. Doña Salométiene un vehículo taxi el que su esposo lo trabaja diariamente para llevar el sustento a la familia. Ella también trabaja como secretaria de la cooperativa de taxi de donde ella es miembro. Tiene cuatro hijos a los cuales tres ya preparó para la vida y uno todavía se encuentra estudiando. Hace doce años juntó todos sus ahorros para poder hacer la inversión en la compra del vehículo, sus planes a corto plazo son poder reunir suficiente dinero para poder comprar otra unidad vehicular.

La meta de poder llegar a acondicionar su casa la quiere cumplir en estos momentos, y solicita el crédito para invertir en la construcción de un cielo falso en su casa de habitación y así poder poder verla algún día construida totalmente.

loans.use: Home remodel.

loans.name: Elizabeth Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is a member of Confianza Communal Bank.

Roxana lives with her boyfriend, she is 27 years old and mother of 2 children, Roxana lives in the traditional neighborhood of Santa Ana next to her parents. Roxana has a stand in the central market of the city of Huanta which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho where sells groceries to wholesalers and regular customers. Roxana has an employee who takes cares of the customers. Roxana travels every Saturday to make sure the business is running well. In addition, Roxana sells cheese at the market 12 of April, she buys the cheese in the fairs of Putaja. Roxana has a future business project in mind; she would like to offer Internet services in small booths.

Roxana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing computers.

Roxana dreams of improving her business, buying a home and save up for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana Es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza.

Roxana es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Roxana vive en el barrio tradicional de Santa Ana junto a sus padres, Roxana tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad de Huanta que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende abarrotes al por mayor y menor, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de una empleada que se encarga de la atención al publico y Roxana viaja todo los días sábados a controlar las ventas de la semana. Además Roxana vende quesos que compra en las ferias de Putaja, actividad que realiza en el mercado 12 de abril. Roxana tiene proyectado implementar cabinas de Internet.

Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de computadoras.

Roxana sueña con incrementar sus negocios, tener casa propia y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Roxana needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be invested in purchasing computers

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mr. Houn H., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Lai Lau, 55, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1972 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two daughters are garment factory workers. One son is a wooden house builder and the other three children study in a local school.

Mr. Houn has been a wooden house builder for over thirty years. Beside his construction business, he also does farming and fishing. His wife does farming. Fishing season is coming soon, and Houn needs a boat for fishing. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase wood to build a boat for fishing and use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a boat

loans.name: Narcisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Narcisa habita en el barrio San Judas, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda, con cuatros hijos mayores de edad, tiene una pulpería desde hace diecisiete años, e inició sólo con ventas de gaseosas y productos lácteos, con la solicitud del préstamo es par invertir en la pulpería en los diferentes productos para mejorar la oferta a sus clientes, y poder tener más capital ya que entre las dificultades ha sido la poca inversión de su negocio para crecer. A futuro quiere tener una miscelánea donde pueda ofrecer todos los productos que el cliente necesite, y así obtener mejores financiamiento y generar más ganancias y capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa lives in the neighborhood of San Judas. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with 4 adult children. She has had a small grocery store for 17 years and started by selling sodas and dairy products. With this request for a loan, she will invest in her grocery store by buying different products to improve the selection for her clients. She will also be able to have more capital because as a result of difficulties, there has been little investment in her business to help it grow. In the future, she wants to have a general store, where she can offer all the products that her clients need. In this way, she will have better financing and earn more income and capital.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for her grocery store

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group

texts.en: Viola N. is a member of Twekembe women's group in Bulenga and has run a retail shop in her area for 4 years. She is a married woman with children and works with her husband for the upkeep of their family and children's school fees. Since joining her lending group, her loans have helped her so much in transforming her shop in a way that she is now able to make a higher profit compared to before the loans because now she has much to sell in her shop. She still plans to develop it more with this loan, so that she can stock goods that are lacking right now, like eggs, baking flour, and others.

loans.use: To buy sugar, eggs, and baking flour for her shop

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl S., or nanay Sheryl, is a good follower and good leader of her local Center. She is a resident of Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Sitio Igcaputol,Tobias, Fornier, Antique. She is married to Adriano S. and has two children. Currently, nanay Sheryl is the center chief of ASHI in her center. She meets her obligations well and encourages the group to join ASHI. A Sari-sari store is her means of making a living, and her loan from ASHI was used to finance this business for the children's future. 

Nanay Sheryl came from a very poor family and her sisters were adopted by other people. Her parents believed that it would be easier for them to provide foods if they were fewer. Fortunately, she found a responsible husband who provides for their financial needs. She wants what is best for her family and that is why she works very hard and inspires her children to go to school so that they can find stable jobs for the future. 

She dreams that some day her small store will become a mini-grocery where the people in the sitio will conveniently find their needs. To make her dreams come true, she needs a big capital loan. She is asking for a lender who could help her to achieve all her dreams in life.

loans.use: Variety store & food vending

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia  y el departamento de Puno. Tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están aún bajo su responsabilidad. 
Con su primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300 compró papa para venderla. Nos cuenta que primero se dedicó a la venta de papa y posteriormente cambió de rubro para dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir. Tiene 6 años trabajando con el banco comunal.
Con este préstamo de S/.700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará más prendas de vestir para vender en las fiestas de navidad.
Luz desea seguir trabajando para aumentar sus ganancias y continuar apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” Communal Bank located in the district, province and state of Puno. She is 61 years old, married, and mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are still under her responsibility. With the first loan for S/.300 she bought potatoes to sell. She tells that that at first she sold potatoes, but then changed profession to selling clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for 6 years. With this loan for S/.700, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy more clothing to sell in the Christmas holidays. Luz wishes to continue working to increase her earning and continue supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing.

loans.name: Philomène Yèyinou

texts.fr: Originaire de EKPE et agée de 26 ans, dame D. Philomène est mariée à monsieur  Gilbert SOTIN et mère de deux enfants. Dame D.  Philomène est  maitresse coiffeuse de formation et a construit son atelier proche du grand carrefour  de sa localité. Elle vend des meches à ses clientes et à d'autres personnes desireuses de s'en procurer. Au vue du nombre important des demandes effectuées par sa clientèle,elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Originally from EKPE, Ms. Philomène D., age 26, is married to Mr. Gilbert SOTIN and has two children. She is a master hairdresser by training and constructed her salon near the major crossroads of her town. She sells hair extensions to her customers and to others wanting to obtain some. Given the sizable number of orders made by her customers, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 10 dozen hair extensions of all kinds and some hair products

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs like rice, bean, tubers of yams and cassava. She is a LAPO client. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sopha Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of twenty-three people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sopha K. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer in the local village. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder. In this business, her pigs are growing bigger and bigger and she does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed thE..  She decided to ask for a loan to buy food for her purpose. She is a widow with two children who both assist their mother in the business activities. Mr. Bra H. and Mr. Mon S. did not attend the loan meeting but their wives did, so they are presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Mr. Sokea Kem's Village Bank  Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Akreiksat village in Kandal province comprise this village bank group, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sokea K.,  aged  27, is the leader of the group. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Hout Sambath, is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it to earn more income. Thus, Mr. Sokea K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. Mrs. Samnang C. does not come to take a loan but her husband is taking a loan, so she is shown in the picture instead of him. 

Three members in this group  are taking end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama has operated a clothes, food and juice shop in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She belongs to Bora utu group loan (Group code 2028). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $95. She works at her business 2 hours daily.
Salama is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania. With the loan, she will by more commodities like khanga, bedsheets, flour, sugar and juice for her business. She is hoping to increase her profit so that she can expand her business. Salama is 43 years old, married and has five children. Her children are 25, 24, 18, 9 and 8.

loans.use: To buy more commodities like khanga, bedsheets, flour, sugar and juice for her business.

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar Agusto S., tiene la edad de 63 años, habita en Lomas del Gavilán, en municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposa , la cual le ayuda con los trabajos agrícolas , ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos , tres varones de 12,11 y 6 años y una niña de de cuatro todos ellos estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Cesar desde hace 55 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que a enfrontado es la falta de financiamiento , sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos con una carrera universitaria , para que no pasen todas las dificultades que el a pasado . Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder lograr una buena producción que se venda a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar Agusto S. is 63 years old. He lives with his wife in Lomas del Gavilán in the town of Nindirí. She helps him with the agricultural work. They have four children, three boys 12,11 and 6 years old and a four-year old girl. They are all currently going to school. The plans are to improve living conditions for his family. Cesar has worked in agriculture for 55 years. The lack of financing is the biggest difficulty he has encountered. His dream is to see his children get a university degree so that they don’t live through all the difficulties he has. He is going to buy supplies and fertilizer with the financing to improve the crop for better production to sell for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizer to improve the crop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 26 years old. She is married with three children. At the moment, they are all schooling. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for three years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Her production is on a small scale due to having inadequate capital to buy machines for processing.

Mary A. wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. She said she would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: buy more palm nuts and a small milling machine

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly B. is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 20 years old. Rolly is single. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2009, Rolly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He wanted to help improve his living situation and incrase his ability to engage in business activities. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer for growing corn. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rolly from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for growing corn

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: G. Tojiniso comes from a humble family, but her desire to succeed in life superseded her economic condition. At an early age she learned to make new and different articles of women’s national dress. Thanks to her excellent work she won the admiration and loyalty of her clients. With the benefits she obtained she was able to pay for her advanced obstetrician studies, and to support her parents with family expenses. In order to realize her plans, for which she works hard, Tojiniso appeals to your caring heart and requests a loan to buy a new sewing machine to continue making her fine dresses. Let’s support this excellent seamstress so she can continue sewing her elegant and distinguished articles of national dress. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina B. is managing a vending business. She has a small stall on the sidewalk in front of her house where she sells cooked snacks and some grilled chicken parts. She also sells bread, juices, candies and other goods. She hopes to improve her business to be able to provide herself and some of her relatives with enough financial support to meet their immediate daily needs. Since her capital is not enough to maintain her business and to build on it, Florentina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital.

Florentina resides in her cousin’s vacant house located in Sta. Barbara Old Centro Ilagan, Isabela. She is already 36 years old and has no children yet because she separated from her husband a long time ago. She is working diligently to generate an income to support herself. She hopes that her retail business will soon expand because she also wants to help her family who have supported her in her time of need.

loans.use: To expand a retail business

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр Гафаров  делает мебель.  Начинал он с ремонтов мебели и разных мелочей. Постепенно научившись делать различную мебель решил сам строить фурнитуру. Со  временем  он     перешел на постройку только кроватей и диванов. Его профиль по стройке  кроватей начала развиваться. Кредит необходим для получений  досок и других необходимых строительных материалов.

loans.use: покупка сырья для мебели

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo G. y su esposa la señora María Cristina Vargas, tienen tres hijos pequeños de edad, a los cuales les quieren dar lo mejor y que tengan un buen estudio.
En este momento tiene un problema que sus niños entran ha la escuela y el no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar las colegiaturas y comprar los uniformes que necesitan para que sus hijos no tengan ningún problema cuando entren a la escuela, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir está necesidad que se presento con los estudios de sus hijos.
Don Rodolfo tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, artículos de belleza, zapatos y variedad de cosa en diferentes partes de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que tiene para darle lo mejor a su familia y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo G. and his wife, Sra. María Cristina Vargas, have three young children. They want to give them the best and provide them with a good education.

At the moment, Sr. Rodolfo does not have the necessary funds to pay for his children’s tuition and uniforms in time for the beginning of the school year. He is requesting a loan to cover these costs so that his children can continue their education.

Don Rodolfo has a business selling clothing, beauty products, shoes, and a variety of other items in different parts of the city. He uses his earnings to provide the best for his family and will set aside a portion to repay this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his children's tuition & school uniforms

loans.name: Elza Patricia

texts.es:
Elza Patricia Guamán C. es socia del Banco Comunal Si Se Puede, vive en el Barrio Parco loma vía a Santa Rosa que está ubicado  a 45 minutos a las afueras de Cuenca.
Tiene 31 años de edad, es casada hace algunos años y mantienen una buena relación conyugal, su esposo es chofer de transporte público, actualmente  viven en la casa de sus familiares, tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad que ya  va a la escuela Juan Estihellr en Quinta Chica.

Elza es vendedora de productos de belleza para la mujer como perfumes, labiales,  joyas, etc. También realiza  trabajos en todo tipo de costuras en el tiempo que tiene disponible, el horario se fija ella ya que es independiente. Las ventajas de su trabajo son los premios que le otorgan por las ventas de los productos, las desventajas encontrarse con clientes morosos y largas horas de caminata por que visita a sus clientas  casa por casa.

Este es  su primer crédito y se lleva muy bien con las socias, María Zhañay la ánimo para que se integrara a este gran grupo de mujeres muy alegres y solidarias, con el préstamo solicitado ella va a incrementar su negocio comprando más productos para tener un buen surtido de perfumería para sus clientas.

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio auto  para su comodidad y un mejor servicio a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Elza Patricia Guamán C. is a member of the communal bank Si Se Puede. She lives in the neighbourhood of Parco loma near Santa Rosa which is located 45 minutes from the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 31 years old and has been married for a few years. She has a good relationship with her husband who is a public transport driver. They currently live in the house of her relatives. They have a 5 year old son who already goes to the Juan Estihellr school in Quinta Chica. Elza sells beauty products for women such as perfumes, lipsticks, jewellery, etc. She also does all types of sewing work in her free time; she sets her own schedule since she works independently. The advantages of her job are the rewards that she gains through the sale of her products. The disadvantages are late-paying clients and long hours spent walking, since she visits her customers house by house. This is her first loan and she gets along very well with the other members. María Zhañay encouraged her to become part of this great group of very happy and supportive women. With the loan that she is applying for she will increase her business by purchasing more products so she can have a good selection of perfumery for her customers. Her goal is to eventually have her own car for her convenience and to offer a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products and increase stock for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his commerce

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is thirty – six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children and in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Monica is a trader. She trades in plantain. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Monica also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy plantain

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of P-24, Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Nida is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 3 years. In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to improve the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand into other businesses.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: P-24, Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del No

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Anjelina J. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in primary school, and three of whom are in secondary school. Anjelina runs a food store in Dar es Salaam. She purchases her goods directly from either wholesale shops or the producers. With the income her business has generated, she has been able to build two houses and pay for her children's school fees. She has been a borrowerer with YOSEFO for the last 10 years; currently, she is requesting a loan of TSHS 800,000, with which she will buy more business goods.

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Silas Ambei

texts.en: Silas Ambei, 30 years old, owns the Tumaini Traders. He sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, tealeaves, sodas, brakes fluid, baking flour and bicycle spares to the local customers and motorbike operators in the area. He has been in this business for the past three years. In addition, Silas also raises poultry. His business challenges are strong competition and fluctuation in the price of goods. He is using the proceeds of KES 80,000 to increase his stock of household goods. In future, he wants to be the best stocked wholesaler in his area. Silas is married to a nurse and he describes himself as a pastor and a serious man to his creditors.

loans.use: To buy household goods.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is Salamatu K.. She is 30 years old, married, and is from Tombo town in Waterloo. She has two children: one girl and one boy.

Salamatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Salamatu sells bagged rice walking in the street in Tombo town. With her previous loans she purchased an additional inventory of rice. With her new loan she hopes to add even more bags of rice to her business. She is planning to keep some of her increased profit as savings in the bank.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice

loans.name: Nulu's Group

texts.en: Nulu L. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard working and friendly lady with a strong sense of humor and school-going children. She takes care of other siblings and orphans also in school. Nulu has a salon business in Mpumudde village from which she is able to make profits that help her run her home as well as contributing to her children’s education with the help of her husband. Other sources of income are a transportation business in which she contracts someone to ride a motorcycle, cows at home, plus a kiosk. She says that her major challenge is not having enough capital to make her salon much bigger. Nulu needs a loan to be able to buy more braids and weaves since most people like to plait their hair during certain seasons. She would also like to stock some hair chemicals and hair goods for business continuity.

loans.use: To buy more braids, weaves, and hair goods for the expansion of her salon.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun C., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Sarat Phai, age 34, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One child stays at home, three attend school, and the other one is still too young.
 
Sokhoeun is a rice farmer. When she is free, she also sells fruit in the school near her house. Her husband has been operating a motor remoque taxi for two years. A remoque is a motorbike pulling a passenger trailer. 

Sokhoeun is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seed and pesticide for her rice farm

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enhtuvshin is 32 years old and lives with her mother and two children in a house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, Namuun, is 9 years old and is a secondary school student while her husband works and lives in Korea. Her husband went to Korea as a contracted worker and has stayed for a total of four years now. 

Enhtuvshin operates a clothes trading and household goods selling business out of a rented stall at a local market in her town. She started her business in 2005 after working as a dressmaker for several years and has gained much business experience over the years. Now her working capital is 4,000,000 tugrugs (about $2,800) with a daily profit of 100,000 tugrugs (about $70). 

Enhtuvshin is a very hardworking person and is always working toward her future goals. She says, "I want to expand my business for the future and be able to pay for my children's education until my husband comes back home." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Rutila

texts.es: Rutila tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar. El inicio de su negocio surge por la necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida, por lo que siempre se ha interesado en mantenerlo aunque no ha sido fácilmente ya que la situación esta difícil, esto no la desanima a continuar pues a ella le gusta su negocio y con las ganancias ha mejorado ciertas cosas en su vivienda. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisetas, faldas, vestidos, perfumes, cremas y colonias. Rutila sueña con establecer un negocio amplio en su casa.
texts.en:
Rutila is 54 years old, her economic activity is the buying and selling of clothes. For more than ten years she has been dedicated to this activity, since she was very young she has liked to work. The beginning of her business was out of the necessity to improve the conditions of her life and she has always been interested in maintaining the business although it hasn't been easy because the situation is difficult. This hasn't discouraged her from continuing because she likes her business and with the earnings she has improved certain things in her life. She is seeking this loan to buy underwear, pants, tank tops, skirts, dresses, perfumes, creams and colognes. Rutila dreams of establishing a big store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase underwear, pants, tank tops, skirts, dresses, perfumes, creams and colognes

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Mr. Elias D. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 43, married and is blessed with 2 school-aged children. His income of 6,000 comes primarily from his salary and from his SSS (social security system) pension. In 2009, he joined PMPC to access the programs and services of this co-op. He is requesting a  loan of 7,000 which will be used for educational purposes. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for his children

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 40-year-old married man with 3 school-age children. He has owned an electrical equipment and phones shop in his town since 2000. He sells phones, phone accessories and rechargeable cards. He sells, in addition, electric equipment. He took out a first loan from Ameen and he's very thankful for the result of the loan. He has been very reliable in his repayments to Ameen and has repaid on time.

And today, Abbas is asking for a bigger loan amount of $2,000 to purchase additional merchandise needed to increase his sales and thus his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Buloba Development Of  Lugazi Group

texts.en: She is a divorced mother of 8 who herds cattle, pigs and poultry. With profits coming from the sell of some of her domestic animals, 56 year old N. Donata has fully provided for all her children’s education. She began her business venture 6 years ago in Buloba, Lugazi. She has faced many challenges particularly during the dry season where animal feeds are hard to come by. The thoroughbred domestic animals she has been rearing and selling have gotten her a strong inclination among her clients. In a week she says she makes 35,000 shillings. With this loan she wants to enlarge her business by buying more pigs, more chicken and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase  more poultry,pigs, and cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Doh

texts.en:
P. is married to two wives and has seven children, four of whom are under the age of fifteen. He lives in Kobenyang, Momo Division, in the northwest region of Cameroon. As a very hard-working guy. He has faced some major challenges in life, such as inadequate funds to pay for his children's education, ill health, and death of relatives. In 2008, he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member. He has received and repaid loans from GHAPE twice and his previous repayments were encouraging.

With the loan he is requesting now, he plans to invest in his farm. With the profit from the loan, he will pay for his children's education, clothe them, and give them good food and good medication whenever they are sick.
	
He prefers to receive loan from GHAPE, rather than other financial institutions, because of the training GHAPE offers and because proper follow-up is done to ensure the loan is properly managed.


About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement

loans.use: To purchase yams, corn, beans, and seeds

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella J.  is 41 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder. She has 4 children who go to school.  Stella is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal. She  requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build  a store for her charcoal. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes G. is a married woman who lives in Martinez Compund, Brgy. Pugalo, Alcoy, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures. She operates a general store , she buys and sells recycled materials and also has a Vidoeke businesses.  Her husband Basilio G., who is 62 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 9 children who are between 2 to  25 years old. 

Gertrudes  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gertrudes  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,500 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use in purchasing necessary commodities for her general store while the rest can serve as a capital in her scrap business so that she could continue to save up for the future renovation of their house and to send their children to school . 

Gertrudes G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To be used for additional working capital

loans.name: Joen

texts.en:
Joen D. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and more tomatoes to sell. Joen is 34 years old and is married with a husband who is an inspector general. She has three children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier V. E., tiene la edad de 38 años, está en unión libre, y un hijo de 8 años de edad, es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Además, desea comprar una novilla, y así aumentar el número de animales que posee. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Didier trabaja desde hace varios años a la agricultura y al ganado . El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Didier V. E. is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage and has an 8 year old son who is his main priority. The loan will be used to help his ranch, specifically his coffee crops by buying manure and fertilizer. He wishes to give his coffee crops adequate care to have a better quality product so that when it is harvest time he will have better earnings. Didier also wants to buy a heifer to increase the animals that he has. This will be his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with their help. Don Didier for some years has worked in agriculture and with livestock. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing in his personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For  his coffee crops and to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as cement and sand

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. lives in Purok 1 Yardahan, Barangay Bal-os in Basay, Negros Oriental. She and her husband earn their living through fishing and fish vending.  Her husband Beltasar, age 67, is a fisherman.  They have 4 children ranging in age from 2 to 17 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her increase their family income to PHP 22,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th loan, she is requesting PHP 15,000 which she will use to purchase a new engine for their fishing boat so that her husband could continue with his fishing activities and Rosalie will have fish to sell. They are both working very hard to send all their children to school. Rosalie S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy an engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is from the village of Quezon, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Editha joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Nuon N., 23, together with his wife, makes and sells brooms at the local market in Takeo province. They have been running this business since 2005 and they are able to make US$4 profit every day. They have one young child living at home to support. Since Nuon N. spends a lot on transportation to bring brooms to the market, she would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike to carry them.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Naji

texts.en:
Naji is a 36 years old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. Naji works in construction; he is specialized in digging, in addition to another business he owns, which is transporting students to and from school.  

This is Naji’s fourth cycle with Al Majmoua; his previous loans improved his business. Naji’s loan will be used to make the necessary maintenance to his school bus and to buy a new car. His clients are numerous and he has a well know business reputation. He hopes to continue improving his business.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his bus

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
La señora Griselda es soltera, tiene 1 hijo menor en edad escolar; ella se dedica en la producción artesanal y venta de colchas, tiene 12 años de experiencia en el ramo y con clientela formada.
 Ella tiene 2 operaciones canceladas con Fundación Paraguaya, con buen promedio de pagos.
Es una persona muy luchadora y muy responsable,con ganas de superación.
Hace un buen tiempo que se dedica a la venta de colchas en, ella viaja hasta la ciudad de San Lorenzo y Asunción donde se encuentran sus clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas.
  Ella aún vive en la casa de sus padres y su máximo sueño es tener casa propia, por lo que necesita incrementar sus ingresos para poder llegar a su meta.
texts.en:
