Señora Griselda is single with one young son of school age.  She is dedicated to crafting and selling bedspreads.  She has 12 years of experience with her communal bank and with the members of her group.  She has completed 2 loan cycles with  Fundación Paraguaya, with a good payment record. 
Griselda is a very hard working and responsible person, with a desire to get ahead.  
She has been dedicated to selling bedspreads for some time.  She travels to the cities of San Lorenzo and Asunción where she finds her clients.  
She requests the loan to buy bedspreads.    She still lives in her parents house and her greatest dream is to have her own house, which is why she needs to increase her profits to be able to arrive at her goal.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads to decorate and resell

loans.name: Edix Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Edix tiene 51 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 4 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos necesarios para el hogar, ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad que tenia y por su hija ya que tendría que ver la forma de que no le faltara nada.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería ya que su negocio no cuenta con lo suficiente para ofrecer a los clientes, ella quiere invertir en productos necesarios para el hogar.
Su principal propósito es tener un negocio estable para que no le falte la alimentación a su hija, tener una fuente de ingreso solida que le permita sobrellevar su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Edix is 51 years old and resides in San Rafael Oriente, Department of San Miguel. She is a single mother and has a four year old daughter. Edix sells basic products for the home. She started this business out of necessity so that she could support her daughter and see that she lacked nothing.

Edix is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise for her business since she does not have sufficient inventory to offer to her customers. She wants to invest in basic household products. Her main goal is to have a stable business so that her daughter will not go hungry. By having a strong source of income, she will be able to provide for her home.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 60 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y amable, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposa Maura de 56 años y su hijo menor Roberto de 30 años, quienes lo apoyan en la siembra y cosecha de sus frutos. Los extensos campos de cacao, café y hojas de coca que posee, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y de una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su fama de cosechar productos de calidad le ayuda a vender a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que atrasan el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra. Este es el séptimo crédito FP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para aplicar a sus tierras, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en: Modesto is a straightforward and friendly 60-year-old  man. He lives in his own home along with his wife Maura, 56, and his youngest son Roberto, 30, who both help him plant and harvest his crops. His extensive fields of cocoa, coffee and coca leaves are the fruits of his arduous labor and firm conviction to move up in life. His products are in high demand in the city of San Francisco since his reputation of harvesting quality products helps him sell the items at very good prices. What he most enjoys about his work is guarding his crops from insects that could slow their development. He has been doing this activity for 40 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting his products since they are very heavy and tire him out. In the future, he hopes to purchase new plots of land to expand his crops. This is his seventh loan with Kiva partner FP, and he knows that this support will be very beneficial to his work's progress. He is a very happy member of his community bank and he always keeps order at the meetings. With the 2,000 soles he is requesting, he plans to purchase fertilizer to apply to his crops so they are more productive.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid S. is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Mesaid has been selling ground nuts, baobab super fruits, and wheat flour for the past four years. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of raw materials. She hopes to establish a cereals shop in the future.

With a loan of 20,000 KES, Mesaid wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts, baobab super fruit, and wheat flour. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of  ground nuts, baobab super fruit, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Sushila D.. She is married and has one child, aged 4. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Audrey

texts.en:
Audrey J. created Visions CPR, First Aid & EMT Training because she wanted to provide excellent training for medical professionals. Audrey has been working in the medical sector for over 30 years. She was originally a medic in the Army and then began training others in 1986. Her passion for teaching led her to open her own training center to ensure students receive top quality courses.  

The Visions CPR courses give medical professionals the skills to save lives. Audrey’s loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana was used to replace old equipment, to pay three months’ rent on the facility, and to put money aside to pay instructors. There are many companies that offer training in the industry, so Audrey has to make Visions CPR stand out. She does this by buying state of the art equipment and by hiring professional paramedics to teach classes. The professional paramedics give her clients “off the books” knowledge that they may not receive at other training centers.

Audrey opened her business in 2006 and has been working to improve it since then. Her advice to people opening new businesses is to find the best ways to advertise because advertising can be difficult. She also wants to tell new entrepreneurs that starting a business is not easy. She says, “You have to have a desire to do what you’re doing.” Audrey has proven that being patient and diligent, despite setbacks, will help a business succeed. She looks forward to continuing to provide medical professionals with the courses they need.  

Feel free to check out her website: www.visionscpr.com.

loans.use: To buy new equipment, pay three months' rent and salaries for teachers

loans.name: Aba Ama

texts.en: Aba Ama T. prepares Fante kenkey (boiled maize dough) at Abura for sale. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. In the photo above, Aba is in the process of wrapping the dough to make the kenkey.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Mukasa

texts.en:
J. Mukasa is 47 years old and married with three children aged twelve, eight and four years. He is from Rukungiri. He has a farm in Mabungo where he has grown bananas for years to sell in Mabungo’s trade center. He is also a spiritual leader and the pastor of one of the churches in Mabungo.

J. attributes his weekly income of 100,000 UGX plus the allowance he gets as a pastor to hard work and friendliness. He is also involved in the sale of coffee and other kinds of produce depending on the season. J. needs a loan to be able to buy more matooke, a medium-sized green banana used in making one of Uganda’s national dishes, for resale.

loans.use: To buy more matooke for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari store. She lives in Ayungon, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 17,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira del Carmen S. B. ella es trabajadora por cuenta propia se dedica al negocio de venta de Comida ella brinda el servicio en su  casa habitación ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes le vende el producto y sus mismos clientes le mandan  clientes nuevos  tiene Diez años  de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casada actualmente  tiene dos  hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  once créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado Para la Compra de Productos como Arroz, Frijoles, Pollo, Plátanos, Gaseosas  etc. y así   invertirle a su negocio y mejorar la condición del negocio, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Yadira del Carmen S. B. is self-employed selling food. She offers her services at her house and has a customer base to whom she sells her products and these clients send her new ones. She has done this work for ten years. She is married and currently has two school-aged children. She has had eleven loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to purchase products such as rice, beans, chicken, plantains, sodas, etc., thereby investing in and improving her business. These loans with CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly since they have enabled her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase  rice, beans, chicken, plantains, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Gaby Evelina

texts.es:
Gaby es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan” ubicado en el distrito de Tinicachi, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 01 hijo.  La señora tiene estudios secundarios.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año,  su préstamo inicial  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en la compra y venta de llicllas (tejidos) y a la crianza de chanchos.
Su nuevo crédito  solicitado fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizará para comprar diez unidades de llicllas, dos unidades de chanchitos y Chacachi (animales de la región), trabaja sola, su esposo trabaja en bordados de mochilas y carteras en la ciudad de Lima.
Su sueño es mejorar como empresaria y tener un negocio más grande.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las ganancias del ahorro.
texts.en:
Gaby is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Lujan” which is located in the District of Tinicachi, Yunguyo Province, Department of Puno. She is 19 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Gaby has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan of 500 PEN was used to buy and sell “llicllas” (multi-colored woven cloth) and raising pigs.

Her new loan of 1000 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy ten units of woven cloth, two piglets, and “Chacachi” (regional animals). She works alone and her husband works an embroiderer who produces bags and purses in the city of Lima. Her dream is to improve as an entrepreneur and have a larger business. What she enjoys most about the Communal Bank is the interest she earns from her savings.

loans.use: To purchase ten units of woven cloth, two piglets, and “Chacachi” (regional animals).

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Desde que  muy pequeño Fidel conoció perfectamente el oficio de vender pescado, porque acompañò a su madre en esa tarea, con la que sacó a sus hios adelante; ahora Fidel es padre de familia que vive con su conyuge y sus dos hijos menores en las edades de 14 y 16 años en el barrio Carrizal, un sector muy alegre y popular en la ciudad de Barranquilla y desde allì se dedica al mismo oficio: "la venta de pescado de rio y de mar".  Fidel inicialmente comenzò en un carro de madera,  vendiendo frutas tropicales, pero se diò cuenta muy pronto que vender pescado le generaba mayores ingresos y con la ventaja de su pasada experiencia en esta actividad, iniciò su idea emprendedora hace 8 años, sus principales clientes son vecinos y recomendados por estos a quienes vende pargo, bocachico, mojarra, sierra y lebranche entre otros. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con esté su credikiva, comprará pescado aprovechando la temporada de mayor repunte de sus ventas en el año, lo cual garantiza el éxito de su inversión en este momento.   Mientras el sueño de Fidel es saber leer y escribir bien, porque aunque su conyuge le ha enseñado a firmar y a escribir su nombre, tambien lo tiene entusiasmado para mas adelante lograr su propósito.
texts.en:
Fidel has known the fish selling business very well since he was a young boy because he used to accompany his mother while she carried out this work.  It was through this work that she managed to get her children ahead in life.  Now Fidel is a father.  He lives with his wife and two children aged 14 and 16 in Carrizal neighborhood.  This is a very cheerful and popular area in the city of Barranquilla and it is where Fidel has his business "selling freshwater (river) and saltwater fish".  Fidel started out in business selling tropical fruit from a wooden cart but he very soon realized that selling fish made more money and, taking advantage of his past experience in the business, he came up with this entrepreneurial idea 8 years ago. 

Fidel's main customers are neighbors and people who these neighbors have recommended him to.  He sells pargo, bocachico, mojarra, sierra and lebranche, amongst other types of fish.  He is currently applying for his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and will use his Kiva loan to buy fish, taking advantage of the fact that this is the season of the year when his sales really start to pick up.  This guarantees that his investment will be a success.

Fidel's dream is to learn to read and write well.  His wife has taught him to sign and write his name but he is still very enthusiastic about achieving his goal in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, taking advantage of the fact that this season is when his sales really pick up

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Margaret has operated a firewood selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She also runs a tailoring business, which contributes to her income. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she is requesting, Margaret wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with two school age children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her husband is a security officer and he contributes to his family basic needs with his earnings. 

For the past four years, Florence has operated a vegetable stall business, selling green vegetables like kale, tomatoes and potatoes. In addition she also operates a water selling business which contributes to her other source of income. Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding it and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es: Cindy tiene 23 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. El negocio que se dedica es la venta de ropa, actividad que ejerce desde hace 2 años, su forma de venta es por medio de pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, y cada 15 días recibe los productos al cual lo distribuye de acuerdo a lo que le han solicitado. Ante esto ella debe disponer de un capital para comprar la mercadería necesaria y lo recupera cuando sus clientes  le pagan por el producto. Procura siempre de abastecerse de prendas que se utilizan en la temporada para así tener mayores ventas, por ello debe actualizarse y estar al pendiente de las tendencias de moda para que pueda cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes. Reconoce que a veces tiene dificultades de pagos de algunos de sus clientes y eso le ha enseñado a ser más prudente en las ventas. Por otro lado posee un vehículo el cual ofrece el servicio de transporte de esa manera recibe un dinero extra, por tanto ha logrado contratar un chofer para no dejar de ofrecer este servicio y ganar más dinero. Es su crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP,  durante este tiempo de trabajo grupal en su banco comunal le ha servido como una experiencia positiva de la que hoy esta agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir que estén a la moda.
texts.en: Cindy is 23 years old and she lives with her son in her parents' house. She has had a clothing business for the past 2 years. Her sales method is to take orders from her clients and every 15 days she receives the products which she then distributes accordingly. Therefore she has to have a capital fund to purchases the necessary merchandise and to recover it when her clients pay for the product. She tries to always have articles of clothing appropriate for the season in order to have greater sales but she needs to be aware of the latest style trends to be able to meet her clients' needs. She admits that sometimes she has difficulties collecting payments from certain clients but this has taught her to be more prudent with her sales. In addition she has a car with which she provides public transport services to earn extra money. She has managed to hire a driver to not have to interrupt this service and to generate for income. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and during this time she has worked in a communal bank for which she is thankful for the positive experience. With the loan that she requests she will invest in the purchase of articles of clothing that are in style.

loans.use: Comprar más prendas de vestir.

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es: Angel  vive en el barrio Soledad 2000 con su cónyuge y tiene un negocio, su experiencia data de hace 20 años cuando trabajó en ese oficio y al emprender  su negocio hace 8, aprovechó su gran conocimiento en esa actividad para mantener la estabilidad de su negocio, reflejada actualmente en el sostenimiento de un importante número de  clientes fijos. Su meta es adquirir  su propio local por eso planea persistir en ideal de negocio, incrementando su capital de trabajo para lograr su sueño. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  materias primas en mayor volumen para producir productos derivados de la harina de trigo, pues se proyecta un aumento de estos insumos y quiere adquirirlos antes de que ocurra; así mismo comprará víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, pues  está muy atento a tener surtido su negocio con lo que requiere su clientela,  en fechas especiales como la que se acerca : El día del padre, época en la cual su negocio tiene gran movilidad comercial.
texts.en: Angel lives in the community of Soledad 2000 with his common-law partner. He has a business. His experience dates back 20 years when he started working in this business, but he has had his own business for the past 8 years. He profited from his extensive knowledge in the field to maintain the stability of his business and it is reflected in the considerable number of steady clients. His goal is to have his own store space and this is why he plans on maintaining his business in the ideal and to increase his working capital. This is the first loan he has had with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he will purchase ingredients in larger quantities to make wheat products. There is a projected increase in price of these ingredients and he wants to acquire them before this happens. He will also purchase food products, grocery products and soft drinks. He is very concerned in keeping his business well stocked with what his clients require. During special days, as the one approaching, Father's Day, is when he has more business.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of ingredients such as wheat products, food products, grocery store proudcts, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Riziki operates a food-stall business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. Her major goal in the business is to expand and establish a restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall business

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 29, is the treasurer of this group. She chose to get involved in trading vegetables and fruits, and became quite successful despite the fact that she was younger than most of her colleagues. She has her own ideas of running and promoting the business. 

When in season, she purchases strawberries wholesale from her parents who grow them in a village called Kun Tuu, and she resells them to local grocery stores and bazaars. Gradually she added other vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes and cabbage to her assortment. She calls it a family business because when her husband is free from his main job as a security officer, he provides the transportation for the goods. At present she has 2,500 soms in circulation and is requesting a loan in order to buy more berries and vegetables. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Marcos Benedo

texts.es:
Marcos Benedo tiene 30 años, Es soltero vive con solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Marco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz por mas de 5 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar un carro y tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y visitar a los hijos.
texts.en:
Marcos Benedo is 30 years old.  He’s single and lives alone in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He has three children.

The members of the “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank are located in Aguas Frías de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton and are dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming tasks.

Marco has been farming corn and rice for over five years.  He buys his supplies at Comercial Peña and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is asking for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  His dream is to buy a car and have a house of his own.

He enjoys playing sports and visiting his children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery oriunda de la localidad de San José Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Rider, tienen dos hijos pequeños, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en el zona los pinos, su actividad económica es venta de ropa, joyas y productos cosméticos por catalogo de las distintas empresas de cosméticos a nivel mundial, hace ocho años que se dedica a esta actividad, también sale a vender comida los fines de semana en el mercado de la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (cosméticos de promoción), se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is originally from the town of San José in Santa Cruz. She lives with Sr. Rider and they have two young children. They live in their own home in the District of Los Pinos. Rosmery has a business selling clothes, jewelry, and cosmetics through catalogs of various international companies. She has been in business for eight years. Rosmery also sells food on the weekends at the local market.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise (cosmetics through a promotional offer). She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics through a promotional offer.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is five. Celsa's husband works as a farmer and carpenter. For the past four years, Celsa has been farming rice. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Celsa sells her rice harvest and pigs at the market in her town. 

Celsa is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to be able to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz, 52, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy dried fish to sell.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring/clothing sales business. Specifically, she makes dresses and sells them to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring/sales business.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman. She has eight  children, three of whom attend school while the other 5 children are married. They live at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mose has operated a cattle selling business. She sells her cattle at the market to her neighbours and butcher shops. Her major challenges are disease outbreak and seasonality in her business.  She dreams of having her own slaughter house in the future.

With the KES 40,000.00 she wants to purchase herds of cattle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase herds of cattle.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр житель города Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 24 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена не работает. Сам Абубакр предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Abubakr lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 24 years old, married and has four children.  His wife does not work.  Abubakr provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and lives in small village of Bontod, Province of Siquijor.  She is married with four children.
To earn a living, Gina has a business selling of Assorted Fruits, Spices and Vegetables. She earns about PHP 5,000.00 every month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amounting to fifteen thousand pesos for additional investment in the said business.

Gina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  Gina would like to let her children finish studying now in college and land a good job in the future through the financial help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase Fresh Fruits, Spices & Vegetables to sell in the market everyday

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
Odette est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire.  
Odette travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend des parfums et des assiettes 555, à toutes personnes à Lomé et dans ses marchés environnants. Elle achète ces produits au Grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Odette a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums et des assiettes. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Odette voudrait avoir un magasin de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Odette is a 31-year-old woman. She is unmarried.
Odette has worked as a retailer since 2005. She buys and re-sells perfumes and '555' brand plates to all types of customers in Lomé and in the surrounding markets. She buys her goods at the grand market in Lomé. She works by herself.
Odette has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy perfumes and plates. She wants to reinvest her supplementary profits in her business.
In the coming years, Odette would like to have a sales store. She says that with her profits, she foresees having a happy life.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and plates.

loans.name: Parpetua

texts.en: Parpetua is a hardworking businesswoman aged 31 years. She is single. She has been running a general shop business for the last three years to earn a living. Previously, she was involved in farming. Parpetua has employed one person to assist her in managing the business. In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Castro

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Matola, Província de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 5ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas alimentares. 

É motorista ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa(areia, cimento, pedra, ferro, e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 6.000.00mt, 6.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 10.300.00mt,  para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir uma oficina , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Castro was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, who are both still in school. He went to school through fifth grade but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother financially, sending her money to help with her food expenses 

He's been a driver for more than six years and earns a salary of 9,000 meticals a month. He uses his earnings to pay for household expenses and also saves a little in a bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 21,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to build his house. His first loans, in the amounts of 6,000, 6,000, 10,000, and 10,300 meticals, were all also used for his home.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to build an office.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to build his house.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
La Sra. Asunción pertenece al Banco Comunal “las rosas D. la paz II”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D.  San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo D. 8 años que cursa el nivel primario.
Empezó  vendiendo productos D. belleza, dejo D. vender estos productos para dedicarse a la venta D. abarrotes con un capital D. S/. 1,000.00. Además se dedica a la crianza D. cuyes. Actualmente continúa desarrollando estas actividades  pues le esta permitiendo sacar adelante a su familia. También cuenta con una buena clientela pues les brinda un trato amable.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00,  piensa comprar productos que tienen más salida para implementar su negocio como golosinas, bebidas gaseosas, sacos D. arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite por cajas, medicinas   y cuyes D. esa manera captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales. 
Asunción es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por facilitarle los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ms. Asunción belongs to the communal bank "Las Rosas D. la Paz II" [Peace Roses II] of the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín. She is 43 years old, married, and has one 8-year-old child who is attending elementary school. 

She began selling beauty products, then stopped selling those products in order to devote herself to selling groceries with S/. 1,000.00 in capital. Additionally she raises guinea pigs. Currently she continues to develop these businesses since it is allowing her to get her family ahead. She also has a good clientele since she provides friendly service. 

With this S/. 1,000.00 loan she is planning to buy high volume products to stock her business such as sweets, soft drinks, bags of rice, sugar, milk and oil in cans, medicines and guinea pigs, so as to gain new customers and keep her current customers happy. 

Asunción is a hardworking woman. Her dream is that her business would continue to grow. She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for supplying the loans.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, bags of rice, sugar, milk and oil in cans, medicines and guinea pigs for stocking her business.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La socia Juana; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, la socia es casada y  tiene 5 hijos,la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. salon D. belleza,ella hace trabajos D. teñidos,cortes D. cabello,ondulaciones entre otros trbajos,la socia trabaja desD. las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. salon D. belleza . La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materiales para implementar su salón D. belleza como bigudíes, peines, secadoras D. cabello.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, age 56, is married and has five children.  She continues to devote herself to her business, a beauty parlor.  In her work she does dyes, haircuts, and permanents, among other services.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Through this business she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her beauty salon.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials for her beauty parlor.  She will buy things like rollers, combs, and hair dryers.

She is grateful for the support of the loan that she will receive.  She pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy materials like rollers, combs, and hair dryers for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio, para comprar mercadería ya que viene la época de diciembre y es necesario tener varios productos para vende y comprar bebidas como: jugos, gaseosas y golosinas para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Ella se siente bien por los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a mejorar su inventario y los ingresos fueron mejores y  dar mejor estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to take out a new loan to invest in her business. She will buy merchandise, because the December season is coming and she needs to have a range of products to sell. She will buy beverages such as juice and soft drinks as well as candies to offer to her customers. 

She feels good about the previous loans, which helped her greatly to improve her inventory. Her income has been improved, and she has been able to provide better stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy juice, soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el mismo corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Andrea;  La socia tiene 46 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia confecciona lindas mochilas en manta con diseños típicos de los andes y los vende y también lleva  a vender al mismo Machupicchu; la socia desea invertir en la compra de materiales como mantas, cierres, botones, hilos para la fabricación de las mochilas.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Community Bank ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”.  This Community Bank is located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Inkas in the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Andrea is 46 years old.  She is a cohabitant of her residence.  She buys and sells handicrafts.  She makes pretty backpacks with designs typical of the Andes.  She takes them to sell in Machu Picchu.  

She wants to invest in the purchase of materials such as blankets, closures, buttons, and thread for the manufacture of the backpacks.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her dues according to the payment program.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of materials such as blankets, closures, buttons, and thread for the manufacture of backpacks.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y dos niñas, también vive con ellos el padre de ella,  Ana se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este surgió por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, generándole sus propios ingresos, lleva tres años en él.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz por quintales, que serian 8 quintales, esta compra le ayudara para mantener la suficiente cantidad de materia prima para la producción, este préstamo le ayudara para suplir la necesidad y mejorar el negocio.
El sueño de Ana es como persona mejorar, crecer con sus ventas y que su esposo sienta el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and two daughters, and her father also lives with them. Ana works selling tortillas, and started doing so out of a need to help her husband with the expenses of the home by generating her own income. She has been doing this work for three years.

She is asking for a loan to buy eight hundred-pound bags of corn. This purchase will help her maintain a sufficient quantity of ingredients for production and will help meet demand and improve her business. Ana's dream is to improve as a person, increase her sales, and for her husband to feel supported by her.

loans.use: buy hundred-pound bags of corn

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La mayoría de los socios del banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN” se retiraron pero entraron otras   personas. Actualmente, el banco comunal encuentra en el noveno ciclo de funcionamiento (cada ciclo está conformado por 4 meses). El banco comunal está conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad donde realizan sus actividades económicas. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

La socia Vilma, tiene 35 años, es padre y madre para sus dos hijos, ella trabaja en una de las municipalidades distritales de la ciudad del Cusco en el área de seguridad ciudadana. Ya son varios años que se dedica al trabajo y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone a sus funciones, ella requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para la alimentación y ropa de sus hijos.   

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido. (En la parte inferior de la fotografía aparece la socia que llego tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
The majority of the members of the communal bank "Moyopata -- San Sebastian" have withdrawn from the group, but other people have joined. Now the communal bank is in its ninth loan cycle (each cycle is four months long). The communal bank consists of 10 hard-working and entrepreneurial people who are looking at every moment for opportunities to advance and with their daily effort to give their children a better future. The majority of the members live in the city, where they carry out their business activities. Cusco is known for being a very touristic and business area, for its traditional festival, the Inti Raymi, and because one of the seven marvels of the world, Machu Picchu, is found there.

Bank member Vilma, who is 35 years old, is both father and mother to her two children. She works in one of the municipal districts of the city of Cusco in the area of city security. She has done this work for a number of years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her duties. She needs a loan for personal use; she needs to buy food and clothing for her children.

The members appreciate and are grateful for the loan that is offered to them through this means, and they promise to make all their payments on the established schedule. (A member who arrived late for the meeting appears in the lower part of the photograph.)

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for her children.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mr  Ibrahima âgé de 34 ans marié et père de deux enfants, tailleur de profession  depuis  15 ans confectionne et vend des habits et des draps. 
Mr Ibrahima sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus, les confectionner puis les vendre afin de satisfaire la demande des clients. L’argent issu de ces ventes lui permettra de nouveau  d’acheter  des tissus, les confectionner et de les vendre, de prendre en charge les besoins quotidiens de la maison, de rembourser l’argent emprunté.
Mr Ibrahima  a comme projet future l’acquisition d’un local pour son atelier.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima - 34 years old, married and a father of two, a tailor by trade for the past 15 years - makes and sells clothing and linens.

Mr. Ibrahima is seeking this loan to purchase fabrics, prepare them, then sell them in order to meet customer demand. The money that comes from these sales will allow him to again purchase fabrics, prepare them and sell them, as well as to see to the daily needs of the house and to pay back the borrowed money.

As a future project, Mr. Ibrahima plans to acquire a premises for his studio.

loans.use: To make and sell clothing and linens.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. 

Hellen is happily married and the proud mother of a lovely family, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds. 

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming and also build a new modern house. This loan will help Hellen to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in, then that person is Hellen. She will not let you down.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Thelma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.en:
Abandoned by her polygamous husband, Edwige K. had to take on the responsibility for educating her children very early on. Thank goodness they are in good health! Still, the expense of schooling is becoming more and more costly. And to deal with the situation, it is critical that she grow her business. The name of her business is «La Princesse», where she will sell clothing for children, shirts for men, and some grocery items. The clothing she offers is highly appreciated in certain areas and is furthermore preferred by a select clientele.

Her business is in a growth sector. However, lacking substantial capital, Mrs. K. has not been able to benefit fully from the fruit of her labor, most recently during a period of high demand. She would like to expand her range of goods for sale and to provide for her children in a more proper manner. To do this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to lease a store and then acquire and sell clothes and food items.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Abandonnée par un mari polygame, Madame K. Edwige a dû très tôt prendre en charge l’éducation de ses enfants. Dieu merci ! Ils sont en bonne santé. Cependant les charges scolaires deviennent de plus en plus pesantes et pour faire face à cette situation, il lui est indispensable d’étendre son activité. Elle est revendeuse de vêtements d’enfants, des chemises d’hommes et un peu d’alimentation générale. Ces vêtements sont très appréciés dans certains milieux et préférés par une catégorie de personnes.

C’est une activité très porteuse mais ne disposant pas d’un capital substantiel, Madame K. n’a pu bénéficier pleinement des fruits de son activité ces derniers temps où la demande a été forte. Elle souhaite agrandir l’éventail de ses articles et de subvenir plus décemment aux besoins de ses enfants. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour louer un magasin puis acquérir et revendre des vêtements et des produits d’alimentation générale.

loans.use: To lease a store and then acquire and sell clothes and food items

loans.name: Nelly Karina

texts.en:
Nelly is 21, she is a single mom with two kids. The only income she can get to support her family and to pay for her house is by selling shoes. She is an enterprising young woman and she is completely devoted to her work; the well being of her two children is very important and this is why she works so hard every single day. To expand her business and be able to meet her clients' demands, Norma needs a $250 loan.

It is in your hands to help Norma and her children get ahead; she will put her best effort and is confident she will be able to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. Don't hesitate any longer, her family and her need you.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Nelly tiene 21 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos, la venta de zapatos representa el único sustento para su familia y para el pago de su casa. Ella es una joven emprendedora que se dedica por completo a su trabajo, para ella es muy importante el bienestar de sus hijos y es por eso que se esfuerza tanto cada día. Para hacer crecer su negocio y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, Norma necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará con este fin.

En tus manos está el poder ayudar a Norma a sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella dará su mayor esfuerzo y confía en devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. No lo dudes más, ella y su familia te necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Saodah

texts.en: Saodah is a 43 year old mother and is married with one boy who attends high school.  To supplement her husband's income, Saodah sells cigarettes, spices and coconut milk rice at her small kiosk. From this business, she can earn about $15 in a day as an income.  Saodah needs a loan of $75 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell, thus more or less double her income. She really wants to have more income for her child's education to give him a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of one year.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: César Omar

texts.es:
Due to a lack of resources, César had to drop out of school and start working in his father's electrical shop eight years ago. Little by little, he learned the trade and helped his father to expand the business. Today César is married and has a little son, to whom he wants to offer a good education so he will have a better future. This is what motivates him to exert himself more and more each day.

At the moment, César needs a loan for $250, which will be used to remodel his workshop, installing tile to improve the working conditions and improve the quality of service they offer. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Your help can improve the life of this family by contributing to the growth of their business. They are grateful for your support.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Ante la falta de recursos César no pudo continuar estudiando y empezó a trabajar en el taller eléctrico de su padre hace ocho años, poco a poco fue aprendiendo el oficio y ayudando a su padre a crecer más con su negocio. Ahora César está casado y tiene un pequeño hijo al que desea poder ofrecerle una buena educación para que tenga un mejor futuro, esto es lo que lo motiva a esforzase más cada día.

En estos momentos César necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que destinará a la remodelación de su taller, instalando un tejaban para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y mejorar la calidad de servicio que ofrecen, él se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Remodeling

loans.name: Zumyati

texts.en: Zumyati is 33 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and almost all of her customers are her husband's friends at work. They buy shoes, shirts, or coats, and she usually earns $22.50 per week. Zumyati asks for a $100 loan to purchase more stock. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling children’s clothing at a busy market in Kharkov, Ukraine. Her business is one of the best in town with good quality products and several locations. Natalya currently has two sales kiosks at the market as well as a large shipping container that she sells from. Eventually, Natalya would like to open a store in a permanent facility. Natalya and her husband, Stanislav have one child, a daughter. Stanislav is also a business owner.

Natalya has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory of hats and gloves. She will be able to help many children keep warm through the cold winter months and hopes to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Lizeth Mariela

texts.es:
Client's background: Lizeth has a store where she sells toys and children's clothing. She has one son and is separated from her husband. As a result, she is the only one earning money to sustain her family. Her home and store are situated in the region of Alto San Antonio in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she seeks a loan. The total amount will be used to buy merchandise (toys and children's shirts and pants). Her work approves her for this loan as she possess experience in her business, which provides her the means to cover the costs of the loan and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Historia del Cliente: Lizeth tiene una tienda donde vende juguetes y ropa de niño. Tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo por lo cual es la única que genera ingresos para la sobre vivencia de su familia. Su domicilio y tienda se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (juguetes, poleras y pantalones de niños). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: To buy toys and children's clothing

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sariani

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sariana takes care of her family and is also very active in her work. Her husband, I Wayan Tama, owns a furniture crafting business. Ni Wayan Sariani does not just sit quietly at home while her husband works. Every day after she finishes her work as a housewife - cooking, managing all of the affairs of the household and caring for their two daughters who attend high school and primary school respectively, she joins her husband to help him with his work. Her husband gets orders to make Sanggah (household shrines used in the practice of Hinduism), cabinets, tables, chairs and more. To help reduce the strain on her husband, Sariani helps him by doing the finishing work on the furniture that her he crafts. This includes painting the furniture, amongst other things. Sariani would like to borrow funding to be used to purchase the basic supplies they need for their business like wood, paint and other items. With a only 20,000 Rupiah per day from her husband, she takes care of all of her family's needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Wayan Sariani adalah sosok ibu rumah tangga yang senantiasa giat berkerja.Walaupun suaminya, I Wayan Tama, sudah mempunyai usaha Meubel sendiri . Ni Wayan Sariani tidak tinggal diam saja dirumahnya. Setiap hari sesudah menyelesaikan perkerjaan sebagai ibu rumah tangga, memasak dan menyiapkan segala sesuatunya di rumah dan juga untuk kedua putrinya yang masih sekolah pada tingkat atas dan tingkat sekolah dasar dasar, barulah Sariani membantu pekerjaan suaminya sebagai usaha Meubel. Pesanan yang diterima meubel suaminya seperti membuat Sanggah ( Pura tempat untuk sembhayang umat Hindu ), lemari, meja kursi dll.Untuk mengurangi biaya penegeluaran tenaga kerja, maka Sariani membantu pekerjaan suaminya. Pekerjaan yang dilakukan yaitu pekerjaan untuk tahap-tahap penyelesaian / finishing dari pekerjaan suaminya. Misalnya mengecat, dan pekerjaan finishing lainnya. Dana pinjaman yang diperoleh pada Yayasan DINARI dipakai untuk membeli bahan baku yang akan dipergunakan seperti kayu, cat dan yang lainnya dalam menunjang usaha bersama suaminya. Dengan upah sebesar Rp. 20.000,- dalam satu hari dari suaminya Sariani pergunakan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for the business

loans.name: Alejos Antonio

texts.es:
The sale of hardware products is a very competitive business as there already exist many hardware stores which offer these products. Being conscious of this, Alejos A. devotes himself to the sale of hardware products in the village of Villanueva in Chinadega in Nicaragua.
Before having the business he used to sell lottery tickets, walking through the streets of Villanueva, however due to low income he decided to invest in the purchase of hardware products.  On having an equipped business site, he decided to invest in his business and it is for this reason he has made use of credits authorised for Ceprodel which he recounts have benefited him enormously in the purchase of new materials to sell and to maintain his immediate family.
It is important to record that since he started receiving these credits, he has been a faithful client paying back on time and in full. His dream is to expand his business and to provide his children with a better lifestyle.
Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer
 La venta de productos ferreteros es un negocio muy competitivo ya que existen muchas ferreterías que ofertan tales productos. Consiente de esta situación, el señor Alejos A. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos ferreteros en el pueblo de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega en nicaragua.
Antes de tener el negocio se dedicaba a vender loteria ambulante por las calles de Villanueva, sin embargo por motivos de bajos ingresos decide invertir en la compra de productos ferreteros. Al tener el local acondicionado decide invertir en su negocio y es por esta razón es que hace uso de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel que según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la compra de nuevos materiales de venta y para mantener su núcleo familiar.
Es importante señalar que desde que inició con estos créditos, ha sido un fiel cliente pagándolos en tiempo y forma. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware products

loans.name: Chanuka Support Group

texts.en:
Chanuka Support Group was formed on 1st May 2005 with six founding members, namely:

1. Janet O. Achola.

2. Samuel O. N..

3. Selline J. O..

4. Hyrene a. O..

5. Lucas a. Odera.

6. Clarice O. Oluoch.

The above founding six members came together on issues and matters affecting their lives.

They came together with an aim of assisting each other and also contributing money to pay for members' transport to attend clinical services at Chulaimbo Rural Provincial Health Centre. As time went by the group registered more members and now has 45 members. The members have also been trained by K-MET in Nutrition support, Home Based Care services, and IGAs management.

The group is run by executives comprised of the Chairperson, Secretary, Assistant Secretary, Organizing Secretary, and the Treasurer. Members wishing to join the group are required to pay a fee which helps them run the day-to-day affairs of the group. A number of members have well-established income-generating activities such as poultry farming, dairy farming, cereal businesses, vegetable stalls, and community pharmacies. Since HIV/Aids is a concern in this area and good nutrition has played a major role in HIV/Aids management, the group through K-MET has applied for US $5000 to enable them purchase Nutriflour in bulk to sell to the locals around and beyond the community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Buy Nutriflour in bulk for sale to the community.

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en: Mirela was born in 1974 and she is single. Her parents are employed and their monthly earnings are 1400 KM (about U$ 1125). The previous two loans that Mirela took at MCO WWI  were in the amount of 500 KM (about US$ 400) and 1500 KM (about US$ 1200). This new loan, in the amount of US$ 975, Mirela wants to use for purchasing cosmetic products.

loans.use: For purchasing cosmetic products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima A. sells foot wear and provisions. She is 28 years old and is married with two children. She hails from the western part of Nigeria and resides in Edo State. Fatima started her business on her own in 2003 and has been running it ever since. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions to sell.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sale

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Designing and selling hats is helping Adela improve the quality of life of her beloved children and her hardworking husband, Julian, who has been doing this for 16 years and that now with the support of his wife and children makes beautiful and innovative hats. Adela's shop is located inside their small house, which they've been fixing with hard work and patience; during this time of year, their products are in high demand and thus she has numerous orders, however she doesn't count with enough source materials to meet the orders. This diligent and responsible mother expects to win generous hearts that help her finance her project.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de confección y venta de sombreros le está permitiendo mejorar la calidad de vida de sus queridos hijos a Doña Adela y a su hacendoso esposo Julián, quien desde los 16 años incursionó en ésta noble labor y que ahora con apoyo de su esposa e hijos producen hermosos y novedosos sombreros.Adela tiene ubicado su tallercito en su pequeña vivienda que con esfuerzo y presteza viene haciendo refaccionar; por estas temporadas su mercadería está logrando tener gran demanda y por ende cuenta con innumerables solicitudes pero no posee suficiente materia prima para cumplir con sus pedidos; esta diligente y responsable madre espera conseguir corazones generosos que le permitan financiar su proyecto.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make hats

loans.name: Alber

texts.es:
Alber is an able and intelligent young man, who has matured with time and established many goals for his future. After finishing high school, and being unable to continue to university, he saw the need to generate his own income and obtained a sandwich truck. Alber offered his delicious hamburgers to neighbors, friends, and general customers in a popular intersection in his home town of Juliaca. This work was very satisfying, but did not permit him to focus on his studies.

As a result, 2 years ago Alber decided to change jobs and try his hand at a pre-owned cellular phone business, something he can commit to only on weekends, giving him enough time for school. This business has proven to be very profitable, which is why he decided to increase investment to expand his business and be able to finish his professional studies with peace of mind. In order to do this, asks for this loan, and we know that your collaboration will be very well invested in the hands of this young entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Alber es un hábil e inteligente muchacho que con el transcurso del tiempo fue madurando y proyectando muchas metas para su vida futura, al concluir sus estudios secundarios y no poder continuar estudios superiores se vio en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, para ello adquirió su carrito sanguchero. Alber ofrece sus apetitosas hamburguesas a sus vecinos, amigos y clientes en general en una concurrida avenida de su ciudad natal Juliaca. Esta actividad le trajo satisfacción, pero no le permitía dedicarse completamente a sus estudios. Es por ello que hace 2 años decidió cambiar de labor e incursionar en el negocio de la venta de celulares de segundo uso, actividad a la que se consagra sólo los fines de semana y le da el tiempo suficiente para sus estudios superiores. Este negocio le está resultando muy rentable. Por ello que decidió aumentar el monto de inversión para ampliar su negocio y poder concluir con tranquilidad sus estudios profesionales, para ello recurre a solicitar este préstamo, sabemos que vuestra colaboración será muy bien invertida en las manos de este emprendedor joven.

loans.use: Increased capital to invest in his cellular phone business.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre de 46 años, quien vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 19 y 5 años. Él es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde siempre se dedicó a la agricultura, sembrando diversas variedades de productos agrícolas; y por ahora está dedicado a la producción de verduras, durante esta temporada, sale de mañana de su hogar rumbo a sus lejanas chacras, para limpiarlas, regarlas y sobre todo abonarlas debidamente, lo que le toma largas horas de arduo trabajo.Para Armando este trabajo es muy duro, pero pierde las ganas de realizarlo porque se siente bien y está en compañía de sus animales, trabaja alegremente a pesar de la amenaza del incremento del costo de los abonos, lo que en algunas ocasiones perjudicó sus sombríos, por no tener el dinero necesario. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono para que su cosecha sea buena, y así ir mejorando la calidad de sus productos, y transportarlos cuidadosamente a las ciudades para su comercio.

Translated from Spanish Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Armando is a 46 year old man, who lives with his wife and three children who are 22, 19 and 5 years old. He is a very hard-working person who has always been a farmer who plants different varieties of agricultural products. For now he harvests vegetables; during this part of the year he leaves his home in the morning and goes to their remote fields to begin cleaning, watering and especially fertilizing which takes long hours of hard work. For Armando this work is very difficult, but he does not lose the desire to do so because he likes the feeling of being in the company of his animals and work happily regardless of the threat of increased cost of fertilizers. This has sometimes hampered their planting since they did not have the money necessary to buy fertilizers. He will invest the money in buying fertilizer to ensure that his harvest is good, and thus to improve the quality of their products, and transport them carefully to cities for their trade.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her agricultural land.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 40 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 3 and 18 years old. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1993. Everyday she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Mwajuma now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwaka.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Linh Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Linh 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2002. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và kinh doanh cửa hàng văn phòng phẩm, đồ dùng gia dụng. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị ngày một phát triển, kinh tế gia đình ổn định hơn, chồng chị là cán bộ xã nghỉ hưu lương tháng ổn định, con trai đi làm thu nhập hàng tháng ổn định 1.500.000đ, 1 con còng nhỏ đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 20.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng kinh doanh văn phòng phẩm.
Thu nhập bình quân: 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Linh Thi P., a 49-year-old woman, joined the TYM fund in 2002. She made loans to invest in farming and to open a grocery store. Her business gradually flourishes, and her family’s financial situation has improved. Her husband is a retiree and has monthly pension. One of her sons has income of 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month; the other is still going to school. She plans to make the next loan of 20,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest more in the store. The family’s income is 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in grocery store

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es: nLa Sra Nilsa tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Calixtro es divorciada  con dos hijos, uno es mayor de edad que actualmente esta trabajando con ella, y la otra está en edad escolar.nnSu actividad principal es la venta de leche, ella comenta que es un trabajo que realizaba desde pequeña ya que siempre  le gusto la ganadería  actividad  a la que dedicaban  sus padres, al fallecer su  padre  ella quedó encargada de llevar adelante  esta  actividad que  es la que  le genera  el ingreso  necesario para   hacer estudiar a sus  hijos ya  que  es la responsable de su  educación  y  formación.n.nSolicita un préstamo para compra de una vaquilla.nnnnntnt n
texts.en:
Nilsa is 52 years old, divorced, and lives in Calixtro with her two children: an adult son who currently works with her and a school-aged daughter. Nilsa's main activity is the sale of milk. She has been doing this since she was a young girl. She has always enjoyed raising cattle, which is what her parents did for a living. When her father died, Nilsa was entrusted with the business which has been her main source of income, allowing her to pay for her children's education and training. Nilsa will use the loan to buy a young cow.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mr. Kheng C. is a farmer in Ta Dokpong village in Takeo Province. He owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Kim Sok Kim, is a veterinarian in the village. Although they have separate businesses, even together they still cannot support their household well. Thus, Mr. Kheng C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. He is 44 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel M. is the name of this client.  He is thirty three years of age, married and a father with two children.  He comes from a clan called ‘Asona’ family.  

This family has a parrot for their symbol.  In the olden old days, they believed that the parrot was a wise bird who could communicate with them when something unfortunate was about to happen.  The bird would reveal the secret things to them. For that reason, anyone who belongs to this family is proud about that.  

Emmanuel is a carpenter who has been manufacturing any form of room decor for twelve years now with lots of experience.  He says to give your specifications and it will be done.  Some of the things he does are beds, wardrobes, kitchen cabinets, etc.  Emmanuel says that, of late, it is becoming a bit difficult to fund his business due to inadequate supplies of wood for further processing. 

Emmanuel wants the loan to buy wood because that has been his major challenge.  He believes the loan will help him to meet the needs of his customers.  As creative as he is, he also has the hope that this will enable him to expand his business and save towards his children's education. 

He is a member of a group called ‘Holiness’ Trust group.  Members agree to guarantee each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy nails, saw, wood, glue and sand paper etc.

loans.name: Jana Group

texts.en:
The group name is Jana; it is a group made of three ladies, who lives in Aley Mount Lebanon. 

-	Mernah: Mernah is a 25 year old married woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for two years. Mernah requested a loan of 200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the shop. This is the first time that Mernah has requested a loan.
Mernah is speciA. in her work because she is dynamic. Her clients are her neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had difficulties finding the right place to open her shop. She decided on doing her business because of the need. In the future, she plans on expanding her business. 
-	Salwa: Salwa is a 32 year old married woman. She has been working in a flower shop for five years. She also sells paintings. Slawa requested a loan of 200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase flowers for her shop. This is the first time that Salwa has requested a loan.  
Salwa is speciA. in her work because she does very nice bunch of flowers and beautiful paintings. Her clients are shops and others. In the future, she plans on expanding her business. 
-	Ramya: Ramya is a 28 year old married woman. She has been working in a clothing shop for a year and a half. Ramya requested a loan of 300 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for the shop. This is the first time that Ramya has requested a loan.
Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Exitosas”, or Successful Women, is a group of 10 women entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a second loan for further business expansion.  Isela is one of the coordinators of the group in Santiago.  

Isela, mother of three (ages: 25, 26, 27) is expecting her first grandchild and is thrilled to share this fact with whomever she comes into contact with.  Isela, aided by her first microfinance loan with Esperanza International, opened Dominican snack sales of “quipes” and “pastelitos”, both consisting of a fried dough with a meat, vegetable or cheese filling.
