Isela plans to use her second microfinance loan to purchase additional materials needed to make her snacks and dreams of one day being able to own her own store from which she may sell these fried snacks.    

Other member’s of Isela’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including undergarment, vegetable and ice-cream sales.    

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to produce fried snacks

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim N., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, where she earns about $3 each day selling rice. Her husband, pictured here, is a musician earning $6 per day. This couple has four children, two employed as garment factory workers and two attending school. To reduce transportation costs, Mrs. Kim N. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation.

loans.name: Toeum

texts.en: Toeum S., 33, earns a living by growing morning glory (water spinach) to sell at the market. She currently relies on planting a crop around the public lake in an area of Phnom Penh City. She can generate an average income of $5 per day to help support the family's living. Her husband helps her growing vegetables and he also drives a taxi motorbike. They have three children who are still young and are studying at school. S. is looking for a loan to purchase more seeds of morning glory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds of morning glory

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru: Кенджаев Гулмурод проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимается торговлей и разведением крупно рогатого скота. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 16 лет. За кредитом обратился , чтобы использовать  сумму для покупки дойной коровы. таким образом он сможет обеспечить семью молоком , а лишнее смогут продавать и получать деньги.
texts.en:
Gulmurod K. lives in the Abdurahmon Jami district. He is 46 years old, married and has four children. He is involved in sales and breeding of cattle. He has been in this business for 16 years. Gulmurod requested this loan in order to purchase a dairy cow, so that he could supply milk for his family and sell any excess milk for a profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa H. grows corn. She is 26 years old and has five children. She married so early she was never able to study in college because they didn't have enough money to pay her tuition. Her husband, Johnniel H., is a farmer. They have been working together in the farm to feed and clothe their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicides, fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will help her grow more corn on her farm. Corn is the second most commonly grown crop in the Philippines, and Adelfa is one of the corn producers who wish to increase the size of her farm for her family's sake.

CEVI has reached out to a lot of people, especially farmers, to sustain their livelihood. CEVI is organized to help alleviate poverty. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services to support businesses.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en: Wahab is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Wahab sells food products and drinks. She is hoping she will receive a loan amount of N100,000 (US$700) to purchase more food and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and drinks to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda B. is a woman of great aspirations. She hails from the City of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is 50 years old and married to a rickshaw driver, Randy. They have four children. All of the children reached college but are also all unemployed.

She is a member of Rizalwest Branch of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She joined the institution in the 2007 with aspirations to uplift her standard of living. She runs a general store as her primary business and sells fried chicken as a secondary business. The businesses are of great help in their day-to-day living.

Now on her 4th loan, she is requesting 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her store and to buy ingredients for fried chicken.

She dreams of improving her housing and also her business performance in order to save for the the school needs of some of her children.

loans.use: To use as capital for her store and to pay for fried chicken ingredients.

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en: N. Shamsiya is 43 years old and married with two children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of national and European cuisines. The café is located in the central local market which allows her to have many clients, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating stable incomes during the last twelve years. Now, Shamsiya is planning to make wholesale purchases of foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil. For this purpose she requests 4,000 Somoni. She had been provided with six loans by IMON International and has proved herself to be a reliable client. Today she thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil for her café

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20206050017) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 5-member loan group offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Y. Vĩ 04 (4).

T. is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time. She is now requesting a loan of 2,912,000 VND which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20206050018) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.

2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20206050019) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206050020) is a 30 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20206050021) is a 28 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her a furniture-making business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Nguyễn Thị (20206050017) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Y. Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Y. Vĩ 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm nung trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.912.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị V. (20206050018) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nguyễn Thị Y. (20206050019) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206050020) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị S. (20206050021) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Margaret Kanini

texts.en:
Margaret Kanini M. is a dairy farmer in Muguga, Kikuyu, a suburb of Nairobi. She is married and has three children. She has been in the livestock and dairy business for the past 10 years. She sells milk and this includes delivery to the local cooperative society.  She has been getting a profit of about 25,000 kshs per month.

Kanini has never borrowed from any other MFI. It is her dream to own a dairy processing firm and sell hay on a more commercial scale.


About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: purchase two cows, increase stock of hay (animal feed) and repair cow shed

loans.name: Hilaria Julia

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresivas”, ubicado en el distrito de Asillo, provincia de Azangaro, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 02 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria completa, vive en el Comunidad Casa Blanca.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi un año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto comprará ganado mayor para engorde (vacas).

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias.

A ella le gustan los bajos intereses y los ahorros
texts.en:
Sra. Hilaria is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas” (Progressive Women), which is located in the District of Asillo, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Sra. Hilaria completed her high school education and lives in the community of Casa Blanca. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to acquire small livestock. At the moment, she is requesting another loan of 1000 soles to purchase cattle for fattening. Sra. Hilaria hopes to grow her business and earn more profits. She likes the low interest rates and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle for fattening

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús D. Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado D. López del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. el Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos  (3 dependen D. ella), ella estudio primaria completa, vive   el  la parcialidad D. Janahui.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas D. 4 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para compra D. ganado menor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo ella lo va a utilizar en la compra D. ganado menor ovino, chanchos, ella los compra en las ferias D. ganado, luego D. mejorarlos los venD. en las mismas ferias que son una vez por semana.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovinos y chanchos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm trees

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married. He is a businessman from Ordzhonikidze. He runs a small business manufacturing and selling windows and doors. Anatolyi owns a store in his hometown. He is new to this type of business as he started it only two years ago. Currently, he has about 40,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. His net profit amounts to 4,800 each month. 

Anatolyi is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to increase his working capital and purchase additional raw materials for his business. He is hoping to use the loan to make more doors and windows out of wood. This type of merchandise always sells well in fall as it keeps houses warm in winter. Anatolyi realizes this type of inventory is always in demand. He is hoping to continue growing his business by opening new vending locations in the future.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy raw materials for making doors and windows

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe B. is from the village of Sta. Filomena. She is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. The first three are adult-aged while the youngest is school-aged.  To make a living, Febe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Febe has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Febe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Febe is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Febe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to support the education of her youngest child. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Rany Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
TwenT.-eight people who are all living in Svay village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Rany V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members and they will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Rany V. is a grocer who owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it to support her customers’ demands. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy some more grocery goods to support her business. She hopes to increase her profits and to improve her business.

Mrs. Rany V. is 29 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Pao Saphorn, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field of land on which he cultivates rice.

All twenT.-eight members are shown in the photo but some of them are blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Flora J. from Tukuyu. She is married and has 3 children, between the ages of 2 and 12. Flora has been running a clothes Business since 2003. Her business is to purchase clothes an a wholesale basis and to sell by retail. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Flora currently earns about 124USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional clothes in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve the quality of her business. Flora thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes in bulk.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John sells groceries at retail prices to his customers in Asaba, Delta state. He is 39 years old and married with four children. He is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. His greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers.  

He hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more groceries to sell. He hopes to own a supermarket in the future. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Cornelio Nera

texts.pt:
Cornélio Nera M. nasceu na cidade de Pemba, Província de Cabo Delgado, norte de Moçambique, tem 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 22, 21, 16, 11 e 07 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez 8ª classe, parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família, e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da cidade de Pemba para Boane sozinho cumprindo serviço militar em 1969, mais tarde fixou sua residência e foi buscar a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio desde 1979 altura em que ficou desmobilizado, não tem empregado e faz em media cerca de 12 horas por dia. Para alem desta actividade recebe uma pensão de desmobilização no Ministério da defesa no valor de 4.209.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária e Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) mensal. 

Já teve empréstimos na antiga organização da cooperação Suíça Helvetas que já não esta trabalhando, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento e maquina de fabricar blocos) para a construção do murro de vedação na sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 2.500.00mt e 8.000.00mt ambos para mesma actividade.

Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aquisição de uma motobomba para a sua machamba e para a conclusão da obra.
texts.en:
Cornélio Nera M. was born in Pemba, Cabo Delgado Province in Northern Mozambique. He is 59, married and the father of five children aged 22, 21, 16, 11 and 7, all of them students. He finished 8th grade but had to drop school when he was drafted to the army. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else. He left Pemba to Boane during his army years in 1969, and later on he fixed residency there and started a family. He has his own business since 1979, at the time when he became disabled. He has no employees and works around 12 hours per day. Besides his business, he also gets a monthly disability check from the army in the amount of 4.209,00MT (U$135), which he uses to support his family and put some away in a business account. He heard of Hluvuku from a friend who's also a client and this is his 3rd loan in the amount of 10.000,00MT (U$350) that he'll use to buy construction supplies to build a wall in his house. His previous loans were for 2.500MT and 8.000MT for the same purpose. In the future Cornelio hopes to get more loans to buy a motor pump for his machamba (a large garden where crops are grown that provide most all the food for the people in the villages) and to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Baatar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter is 8 years old and attends a local secondary school while the youngest, who is 4 years old, goes to a kindergarten.

Baatar operates a wooden product making business in his town with the help of his wife. He makes a variety of wooden products such as tables, chairs and cupboards in his ger. He started his business in 1995 after graduating from his college as a craftsman. Since then he has made much progress with his business.

In order to improve his working conditions, he built a small house near his home. Baatar is very hardworking and attributes his success to his good accounting and record keeping practices. Baatar has many plans for the future of his business. He says, "I want to establish a cooperative with my friends in order to build buildings and houses." He is requesting a 620,000 tugrug (~436 USD) loan to purchase unprocessed wood.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wood.

loans.name: Guluzar

texts.en: Guluzar was born in 1953. She is married and has 5 children. Bakhshaliyev's family lives in Baku city. Guluzar B. has been in this business for 7 years. Now she needs a loan of 1600 AZN to buy goods to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine G. is 27 years old and she lives in Ijevan city. She is married and has two daughters. Kristine’s husband is a journeyman. He works as a carpenter and joiner and does other similar kinds of work to provide for his family.  

Kristine graduated from Ijevan College and after studying with her father she engaged in the business of beekeeping. Now she has twenty-five of her own beehives and does all the work independently. Kristine likes beekeeping very much and takes great pleasure in taking care of her bee families. 

Kristine is requesting a 700.000 AMD loan to increase the number of her beehives.

loans.use: To increase number of beehives

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Foulbé2 depuis 2004 et a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Elle vend à domicile de l'huile de palme des produits halieutiques et des oignons. Avec ses bénéficies elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is a 26-year-old woman, married with two children. Since 2004 she has belonged to the Village Bank of Vélingara Foulbé2, from which she has had ten loans. She sells palm oil, fish products and onions from her home. With her profits she helps her husband take care of the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Рахмонов Сафарали проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Сафарали имеет средне- специальное образование. Более 15 лет занимается ремесленничеством. У него мастерская, где он занимается изготовлением национальных тарелок и других вещей. Кредит берет для закупа генератора, так как свет у них часто отключают.
texts.en:
Safarali R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Safarali has a secondary-specialized education. He has been involved in craftsmanship for over 15 years. He has a shop, where he makes national dishware and other things. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of a generator because he is often left without electricity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a generator

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet T. has been a business woman operating different businesses since she dropped out of school when she was still a teenager. She started her current business, where she sells foodstuffs and some vegetables, in 1991. She buys her stock in Kibuye Market while she does her business and also lives in Manyatta Kisumu.

She is a mother of two children and at the age of 52 years she is working hard to be able to build her own house since she is a widow. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KSH.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Sidibé est âgée de 26 ans, mariée et mère d’une fille. Elle vit avec son mari et son enfant  dans une famille traditionnelle dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à mener des activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, elle évolue seule en menant le même genre de commerce que sa mère, depuis maintenant 8 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété. Elle est bien connue dans le marché château et sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles.
 Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 20 kg de poivre, 10kg de fiéfié et 5kg de l’ail, des paniers de tomates fraîches, des paquets de cube maggi et un sac de sel de cuisine à Bamako auprès des grossistes.  
Madame Assitan Sidibé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de  diversifier ses activités en faisant l’embouche ovine et de constituer des trousseaux de mariage pour sa fille. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Sidibé is 26 years old, married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and child in a traditional family in the Hamdallaye district of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons she did not go to school and learnt at an early age from her mother, who sold condiments, how to manage an income generating activity. After several years' apprenticeship, she has for the past eight years been developing by herself the same kind of business as her mother, and she enjoys a large customer base and a certain notoriety. She is well known at the Castle market and the strength of her sales is due to the quality of her products. With a view to increasing her business in order to meet customer demand, she has turned to the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwso, from which she has been granted her first loan. She is planning on using this loan to buy 20kg of pepper, 10kg of "fiéfié" and 5kg of garlic, baskets of fresh tomatoes, packets of Maggi stock cubes and a bag of kitchen salt, from wholesalers in Bamako. Mrs. Assitan Sidibé sells on cash and for credit to a customer base made up of men and women. She is hoping to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA which will allow her to diversify her activities, by carrying out sheep fattening and making up wedding trousseaux for her daughter. Her ambition is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh T. H. L. is 37 years old. She is married with a son who is going to school. She sells pigs in the market. She has been doing this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2004 and repaid punctually. She is the group leader of four-member group loan from SEDA. For this loan, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND for her small business.

There are three other members in her group who are borrowing money:

Tuy P. D. is 48 years old. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND for his small business.
Ly T. L. is 34 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Tuyet T. L. is 26 years old. She is a hairdresser. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for her small business

loans.name: Bredi Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
James is twenty-two years old and single. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial community in the region. He enjoys being a businessman very much and took to this trade after leaving basic school. James has been trading in second-hand clothes for three years. He sells along the streets and also in market squares. Though not yet married, James is hopeful of raising a family and giving his children the best of education. 
He is a hard-working young man and leader of the trust bank group called ‘Bredi’, which literally ‘means suffer or work to eat’. 

There are eight members in this group and the members are mainly petty traders in food, cosmetics, groceries, and household items. They are requesting the loan to procure stock in bulk to scale up their businesses to enable them to better support their kids in school.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: E. Pauline est née le 27 Septembre 1979 et est mariée à AHOLOU Yeyi Théodore. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a une douzaine d'année que Pauline s'est installée au quartier N'Vènamédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Pauline aide son mari à supporter les différentes charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Pauline mène comme activité, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine, mais également la vente de montres et de parfums à son domicile. Pauline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pauline exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Pauline désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Pauline sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, pour une cinquième fois.
texts.en:
Pauline E. was born 27 September 1979, and is married to Yeyi Théodore AHOLOU. The couple has two children, both attending (or having attended) school. About 12 years ago Pauline settled in the N'Vènamédé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her husband and children. She helps her husband deal with various family expenses. To make ends meet, Pauline has been running a business selling kitchen utensils - but also watches and perfume - from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She has been performing this activity for the past ten years. She is a former client of ALIDé, having already been granted four loans, all fully reimbursed. Facing increasing customer demands, Pauline wants to raise the level of her business activity and improve customer satisfaction. This is why she is requesting the financial support of ALIDé, for the fifth time.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils and watches.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is widowed with five children. Two of her children died and the rest are in school.  She also takes care of her late brother’s son. 

She owns a shop in Kamwokya where she sells children's clothes, both new and old.  She has been in this business for five years.  

Berna wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand and new baby’s clothes.  She works seven days a week.  Her business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  

She would like to be able to build rental rooms in the available space, and also to see her business grow bigger. She would like to import the clothes directly. She joined MCDT because of the low interest rate charged.  

She owns and resides in a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand and new clothes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 22-year-old single man. He operates a motorbike transport business to earn a living and also farms to earn extra income.

Samuel is an active member of Tinganga Mrireri group in Faulu Kenya whose members’ aim is to save money, share business ideas and guarantee each other’s loans.

Samuel has requested 50,000 KES to buy another motorbike to meet his customers’ demands. He hopes to venture into a taxi business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Arnoldo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Arnoldo es padre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 52 años, cuenta con su propio negocio con varios años de trabajar para lograr el equilibrio en su pulpería, que junto con su esposa  trabajan para lograr dar un buen servicio.
Como todo negocio hay días buenos en ventas, mas en fechas de pago de cada mes. Lo dificultoso es que a veces no se ha recogido todo el dinero para ir a comprar la mercadería que falta lo que sus ventas bajan por falta de productos.
Es por eso con este préstamo desea comprar variedad de productos de los cuales se consumen  diariamente y que es de necesidad. 
Comprara: quintal de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maíz, harina, cajas de jabón ase, productos lácteos, leche, queso, huevo, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos entre otros. 
Entre sus planes es seguir mejorando el local, a si como introducir productos de consumo que genere el objetivo propuestos en ganancias.
texts.en:
Don Arnoldo is a father to three children; he is 52 years old and has his own business working on his general store with his wife, they provide good service to their customers.

As with any other business there are good days for sales, especially during pay season each month. The problem is that sometimes they have not collected all the money to buy the merchandize which means that sales go down by the lack of merchandize.

With this loan, Don Arnoldo wants to buy a greater variety of products which are consumed daily and are basic household goods.

He will buy: 100 lbs of beans, rice, sugar, maize, flour, boxes of ase soap, milk foodstuff, milk, cheese, eggs, candy, refreshments, juices among other things.

His future plans include to keep improving his store as well as include new products for his customers that will help his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products such as: 100 lbs of rice, beans, maize, sugar, crates of oil, boxes of soap, candy, refreshments, milk foodstuff, among other products to have better sales.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 45 years old. She is married and has four children between the ages of 9 and 27. Two of her children are attending school. 

Joan has been farming on the outskirts of Kitale town in Western Kenya for the last 20 years. Her main products are milk and maize, which she sells to Kenya Cooperative Creameries and the National Cereals Board respectively. She also earns income from bricks that she sells at the local market.

Joan has requested this loan of 46,800 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will improve her dairy farming, since it will increase her milk production, and earn her more income. Her biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed but, with training, she has been able to improve her breed.

Joan would like to supply her milk to a milk chilling plant in her village and purchase a deep freezer that will help her store her milk in the future. She is grateful to Juhudi for empowering her economically.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Shahnaaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaaz lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the capital city of Punjab province and the second largest city in Pakistan, also known for its history, gardens, culture and food. 

Shahnaaz lives in a 2-room brick house with her family. She is 46 years old and has been living in Lahore for the past 30 years. She is a mother of 2 sons. Her husband works in the government sector as a government employee and she helps support her family by selling clothes. She has been doing this work for the past 5 years. She buys clothes from “Azam market" and "AnarkA.,” two famous cloth markets of Lahore. 

She mainly sells clothes to her neighboring customers but now she wants to sell her clothes to different clothes shops. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah. With the loan amount she will purchase clothes in bulk of different varieties which will increase her chances of making better income and selling more clothes to the clothes shops. 

This is first time Shahnaaz has applied for a loan from any MFI. She hopes that it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Y. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. She is 25 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Mary Jane is just starting this business.

Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

loans.name: Rashmi

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Rashmi S.. She is married and has one 6-month-old child. In 2007, she established her shop business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. The loan from Patan BPW is to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Rashmi plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62. Join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/bpw_patan_nepal

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun A. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Arua Hill in the West Nile region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of which are in school. Zaitun has a hotel business which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Zaitun has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock of food like rice and posho. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zaitun hopes to generate greater profits, pay school fees and buy food. In the future, Zaitun hopes to open new branches of her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of food like rice and posho

loans.name: Afua

texts.fr: Z. est une femme très dynamique. après son divorce avec son mari, elle s'est vu attribué la charge de ses 2 enfants, pour subvenir à ses nouvelles charges. elle s'est lancée dans la restauration en ouvrant son propre restaurant qu'elle a appelé "FUFU RESTO", sa spécialité est le "fufu" qui est une nourriture faite à base d'ignames et très appréciée des togolais. les produits nécessaires à son activité de restauration sont épuisés raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 6 tas d'ignames, 2 sacs de maïs et divers.
texts.en: Ms. Z. is a very energetic woman. After the divorce from her husband, she found herself providing for her two children. In order to support them, she went into food production business and opened her own eatery named “Fufu Resto.” Her specialtiy is “fufu,” a dish prepared from yams and very popular in Togo. She is running out of necessary supplies, which is why she is seeking a loan from wages to purchase six tubs of yams, two bags of corn, and other items.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies necessary to run an eatery

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “CORAZON DE JESUS DE CCATCCAPAMPA ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia;   la socia tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a atención de sus pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda en la cual vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, ella ahora desea implementar sus tienda para abastecer a su pueblo, ella comprar ala por mayor arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra  de mercadería para la tienda abarrotes.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazon de Jesus de Ccatccapampa”, which is located in the District of Ocongate in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Julia manages a small grocery store where she sells all types of basic necessities. She now wants to keep her store in operation so that she can provide supplies for her town. Julia wants to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other products in bulk so she is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for her grocery store.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité inicio  la señora Idolvina S., quien vive en  C.D.E., ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, está constituido  por 15  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.
Todas se encuentran  trabajando en sus actividades y esperan mejorar sus negocios con los créditos que recibieron.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Idolvina quien se dedica a la cría y venta de gallinas.
La forma de trabajo de la señora Idolvina es la de comprar pollitos y criarlos hasta un tiempo determinado y luego los vende en el mercado, esta venta lo realiza aproximadamente dos veces al mes ya que no cuenta con mucha cantidad de animales para vender con mayor frecuencia.
Comenta que desea adquirir mayor número de pollitos y que estos acarrearían un mayor gasto por la cantidad de alimentos que consumen.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de pollitos y balanceados para crecimientos.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Idolvina S., who lives in Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group in the area.
The group is called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ("Hardworking Women").  It consists of 15 very active women who support each other, all from the same area.
They are working at their businesses and hope to improve them with the loans that they have received.
Idolvina raises and sells chickens.
Her business is buying chicks and raising them until a certain time, when she sells them in the market.  This sale happens approximately twice a year, since she doesn't have enough animals to sell more often.
She says she would like to have more chicks, and that this would result in more expense due to the amount of feed they consume.
She is asking for a loan for the purchase of chicks and balanced feed suitable for their growth.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks

loans.name: Gabriel Setek

texts.en:
Gabriel Setek is 35 years old.  He runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as “Bodaboda” at Bissil in Kajiado. He is married to Silvia,  who is a farmer and together they have five children:  Olelekuto (aged 12 years in class six), Sopiato (aged 10 years in class four), Ketura (aged nine years in class three), Sangana (aged seven year in class one), and Naisuli (aged two years in baby care). He was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Gabriel has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 9,000. This loan of Kshs 30,000 is his first loan from KADET LTD, and with it he plans to purchase another motorbike and employ one person to operate it as he supervises. If this loan improves the business, he plans to  buy still more motorbikes.

Gabriel, who describes himself as hardworking and focused, dreams of having many motorbikes in the future.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Rubertina Liucadia

texts.es:
Rubertina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y  provincia de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 04 hijos.  La señora estudió hasta 2do de educación primaria.

Trabaja  con  el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue de   S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes y comprará cajas de gaseosas para venderlo en el distrito de Titiri.

Su visión a futuro es mejorar el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos..
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el préstamo con meses de gracia, el seguro de vida y lo que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Rubertina is a member of the "Las Kantutas" Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Puno.  She is 50 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children.  She studied through the second grade of primary school.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her initial loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business of selling groceries.

Ms. Rubertina is requesting a new loan in the amount of S./2000.00 nuevos soles, which she will invest in her grocery store.  She will buy cases of soft drinks to sell in the district of Titiri.

Her vision for the future is to improve her business and to increase her earnings.

The things she likes about her communal bank are that the loans have grace periods of several months, the life insurance, and what her savings earn.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and other products like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 35 años, está casada con Jhon, de 37 años. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Edu, de 13 y Didie, de 3 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Como docente, Ana trabaja enseñando a niños menores de 3 años en un jardín particular hace más de 8 años; pero la actividad que más le gusta a está laboriosa mujer son las hermosas manualidades como, angelitos, peluches, y muñecas a base de corrospun, micro poroso, telas y cintas; según explica vende la docena de angelitos a un promedio de 40 soles, los cuales le dan una rentabilidad mayor del 50% de lo invertido, pero en esta temporada de verano, Ana también brinda clases a los niño y adolescentes que quieren aprender el arte de las manualidades, donde pueden hacer volar su imaginación; principal cualidad de este negocio que según sus propias palabras, “es su pasatiempo”. Ahora ella quiere abrir una escuela de manualidades durante todo el año. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y según afirma está agradecida por el apoyo que durante todo este tiempo recibió de parte de su banco comunal donde cada reunión que tienen, celebran el cumpleaños de sus respectivas socias. De obtener el crédito, podrá adquirir materiales para la elaboración de sus manualidades, y si el dinero le alcanza lo invertirá en pagar sus capacitaciones de manualidades en la capital del país.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 35 years old, is married to Jhon, who is 37.  They have two children:  Edu,13, and Didie, 3.  The family lives in their own house in the city of San Ramón (in Peru's central jungle).

Ana has worked as a teacher for more than eight years, teaching children younger than 3 years old in a special class.  But this hardworking woman's favorite activity are the beautiful crafts she makes, such as angels, plush toys and dolls.  She makes them from corrospun (a type of plastic), craft foam, fabric and ribbon.  She says she sells a half-dozen angels for an average of 40 soles, which gives her a profit of more than 50% over the amount she invested in making them; but in this summer season, Ana is also offering classes to children and teenagers who want to learn to make crafts, where they can let their imaginations soar.  Imagination is a key quality for this business which, in Ana's own words, "is her hobby."  Ana wants to open a craft school year-round.

This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she says she is grateful for the support she has received all this time from her communal bank, which celebrates its members' birthdays at every meeting.  When she receives the loan, she will be able to buy craft materials, and if the money stretches far enough she will use it to pay for her training sessions in craft-making, which are held in the country's capital.

loans.use: Buy craft-making materials

loans.name: Bernarda Guillermina

texts.es: Bernarda tiene 35 años, inicio este medio de vida que es una pulpería. Pues no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, ya que ha sido de gran provecho  para su negocio. Pues como toda mujer emprendedora ha salido adelante con sus dos negocios que son la pulpería y venta de comida y disfruta de este medio de vida, que es necesario para mantener a su familia. Es por este motivo que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio con ciertos productos como granos básicos, dulces, detergentes y otros productos para primordiales para la elaboración de comida.
texts.en: Bernarda is 35 years old and owns a grocery store.  This is not the first time that she has taken out a loan and her previous loans have been of great benefit to her business.  Like all enterprising women, she has made progress in her two businesses which are her grocery store business and her business selling meals.  Bernarda enjoys her work which is necessary to support her family.  For this reason, she is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her business with certain products such as basic grains, candies, detergent and other products which are essential for preparing meals.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Katooke Tweimukye Group

texts.en: James is a member of Katooke Tweimukye group where each member guarantees the others for access to credit. James has been in the retail trade business for the last four years. His business desire is to own a wholesale shop and his family goal is to set up an income generating activity for his household members. James needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and soap for sale.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice and soap for sale

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old and lives with eight other family members. In 2009, Houssein decided to open his own barber shop after having gained experience in this field. He is well known in his area and has a good reputation.

Houssein is requesting a $1200 loan to decorate his shop. He aims to improve his business and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To decorate the shop

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 48 years old, married and a father of three.  He sells household goods to earn a living.  He has been running his business for 10 years.  He dreams of expanding his shop into wholesale in the future.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his family.  This is because he has been able to educate his children with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He has requested 60,000 Kes to buy cups, plates, buckets and cooking pots.

loans.use: To buy cups, plates, buckets and cooking pots

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 55 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Morropon en el departamento de Piura, unas cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace muchos años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Engorda los animales y cuando alcancen un buen tamaño, los vende en los mercados locales. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección este rubro. Su negocio tiene gran acogida ya que los animales criados en el campo son muy solicitados por su agradable sabor. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado y en la adquisición de más animales para engordar y vender. Su meta es aumentar sus ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. En el futuro, desea tener una granja de ganado vacuno y cabrillo.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 55 years old, and is married.  He lives in his own home in Morropón, department of Piura, some four hours from Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For many years, he has raised and sold cattle.  He fattens the animals and when they have reached a good size, he sells them in local markets.  He has a loyal, established clientele.  He learned the business from his father, which is to say that he knows the field to the nth degree.  His business is well received, since animals raised in the country are in demand because of the flavor of their meat.  He has requested a loan of 1000 new soles, to buy balanced feed, and to purchase more animals to fatten and sell.  His goal is to increase his revenue, in order to continue to invest in his business.  In the future, he would like to have a ranch for cattle and goats.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela B. está solicitando un préstamo mejorar su vivienda, ya que le está haciendo falta terminar y pintar las paredes del interior de su casa. 
Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar las mejoras que necesita su vivienda.
Desea que sus hijos tenga mas seguridad, protección y que este en mejores condiciones en donde viven. 
 Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo, ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos y necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela B. is requesting a loan to improve her home since the interior walls need to be finished and painted.
At this time, she does not have the necessary money to buy the materials and pay someone who will make the improvements on her home.
She wants her children to have more security and protection. For this reason, she wants to improve their living conditions. 
She plans to pay this loan with earnings from her job. Her husband takes care of the living expenses and their children’s needs.

loans.use: to finish improving the interior of her home

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old. She is married to Hamed, and together they have 4 children; ages between 7 and 22 years old. Jane's primary business is selling honey. She has been doing this for the past year.

Jane hopes that with this loan she will be able to add more stock and grow the business substantially. She wants to buy some honey from the locals to sell. 

In the future, she plans to diversify her business and start selling cereals like rice and other grains.

loans.use: to buy honey to sell

loans.name: Esther Isabel

texts.es: Esther Isabel tiene 53 años, hace 3años que tiene este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar los diferentes productos que ofrece ella es una persona muy cariñosa y tranquila así sus clientes sienten más confianza al llegar a su pulpería. En la actualidad está trabajando todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues siempre muestra mucho entusiasmo para brindar una buena atención. Este primer crédito lo va utilizar para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, pan, sopas, enlatados, fósforos entre otros.
texts.en: Esther Isabel is 53 years old and has had this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in her home where most of her customers come to ask for various products that she offers.  She is a very loving and calm person so her customers feel comfortable to come to her store.  She is currently working every day from 7 am to 9 pm and she always shows a lot of enthusiasm to show that she cares.  This is her first loan and she is going to use it to buy candy, soft drinks, grains, detergents, bread, soups, canned goods, matches, and more.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, grains, detergents, bread, soups, canned goods, matches, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda  es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa en sus labores, ella tiene 36 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito pesquero de Santa Rosa- Chiclayo. Santa Rosa es una comunidad de pescadores y artesanos principalmente.

Esmeralda se dedica a la elaboración de bordados en cinta, hace 3  años  se dedica a esto.  Su madre fue quien le enseñó a bordar. Esmeralda cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.  Además, Esmeralda obtiene otros ingresos  por realizar análisis de laboratorio.

Esmeralda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de material para sus bordados como son las cintas, hilos y agujas  debido a que ya tiene pedidos para estos. Además ella necesita surtir  su negocio y para poder tener mayores ingresos y  así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a hard-working woman, dedicated to her tasks.  She is 36 years old, and lives with her parents in the fishing district of Santa Rosa – Chiclayo.  Santa Rosa is a community consisting mostly of fishermen and artisans.  

Esmeralda does ribbon embroidery, and has been doing this for 3 years.  Her mother taught her to embroider.  She has a customer base in the area.  Esmeralda derives other income from doing lab analyses.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to purchase supplies for her embroidery, such as ribbon, thread, and needles.  She has orders pending for her work.  She also needs to stock her business, to increase her earnings and thus improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy ribbon, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Vasco Fazenda

texts.pt:
Vasco Fazenda nasceu na  Provincia de Manica, centro de Moçambique, casado pai de 3 filhos de 2 a 10 anos,um vai a escola. Fez 5ª classe,e parou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia,e sustenta os seus irmãos enviando de vez enquanto dinheiro para dispesas alimentar.

Saiu de Manica para Maputo por transferencia dos serviços,é pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa ha 39 anos e tem como valor da sua pensão 6.332.00mt por mês. Este valor aplica nas despesas de casa, construção da sua residencia,e poupa algum de vez em quanto na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca fez emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas.  Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, aros, cimento, areia e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir e mobilar a sua casa para dar melhor conforto a sua familia.
texts.en:
Vasco Fazenda was born in Manica Province in central Mozambique. He is married and has three children between 2 and 10 years old; one of the children goes to school. Vasco finished 5th grade and stopped school because of financial problems. He lives with his family in his own house, and he supports his siblings by sending them money for food now and then.

He left Manica to move to Maputo because of a work transfer. For 39 years, he has been a pensioner of the Ministry of Defense, and his pension is 6,332 meticais per month. Vasco uses this money for household expenses and building his home, and he saves some money sometimes in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku through coworkers. This is Vasco's first loan with Hluvuku. He is asking for 12,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (iron rails, frames, cement, sand and other items) to continue construction on his house.

He promises to make his payments promptly so he can have other loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to finish and furnish his house so he can make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron rails, frames, cement, sand, etc.).

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. He has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & biscuits. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional bread, biscuits & beverages.

Michael is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Michael hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional bread, biscuits & beverages.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian has been a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya for the last 10 years, producing milk, poultry birds and eggs and selling to the local market. She is married with four children, three of whom are already schooling.

Lilian has requested a loan of 20,800 KES from Juhuhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this acquisition will improve her income and make life more bearable, as well as meet the basic requirements, like the education of the children.

She notes that the inadequacy of animal feeds is the greatest challenge.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
jose Manuel tiene 23 años, Es soltero vive con los padres tiene una hija de 4 años pero no vive con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Jose se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como vichos en las plantas. Su sueño es tener casa propia. 

Le gusta hacer ejercicio y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 23 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has a 4 year-old daughter but does not live with her.

The 'El Progreso' community bank is located in Aguas Frías de Mocache, in Mocache canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

José is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

José is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  He faces challenges in his business such as pests attacking his plants.  His dream is to own his own home.

José likes exercising and taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Sayra Esmelin

texts.en: Sayra lives in the outskirts of Danli, Honduras with her husband and son. She is a returning client and used her most recent credit to open up a small general store. Since then the shop has expanded and built up a good customer base. Sayra is now requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cornmeal, eggs, snacks, candy, soft drinks, lard, oil, household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Elizaveta's Group

texts.en: Elizaveta is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married; her husband went to work in Russia to make money. Elizaveta takes care of two daughters; the older daughter studies at school and the younger is preschool age (under 7). Elizaveta works as an administrator in the hotel; her monthly salary is 7000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs money to improve their living conditions; the loan purpose is the purchase of a gas cooker. In the future, she wants to save some money to repair an apartment and purchase new furniture home. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a gas cooker.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 48-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh city. She has 2 children. Her husband works as a mechanic.

To support her family, Thanh runs a business producing machinery parts and casings. She has run this business for 5 years. She plans to use this loan to buy more metal and materials to make more machinery parts and casings to sell, which will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more metal and materials for making machinery parts and casings.

loans.name: Mashrab

texts.ru: Машраб проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его дети маленькие. Машраб предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршруту Турсунзаде – Шахринав – Турсунзаде. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Mashrab lives in the Tursun-zoda.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children, all of whom are little.  Mashrab provides a service.  He transports people on the Tursun-zoda - Shahrinav - Tursun-zoda route.  He has been in this business for five years.  Mashrab is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Monica Adhiambo

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 14 to 25 years. She describes herself as obedient, kind, and straight forward. She operates a retail shop where she sells eggs, sodas, water, vegetables, and fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at the busy Kibuye market in Kisumu. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to add stock of eggs and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will diversify into a spare auto parts sales business.

loans.use: To pay for eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, two boys and one girl. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cloth selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase a popcorn machine for making popcorn for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a popcorn machine for making popcorn for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old and has been in farming in his home area of Kitale for 15 years. He produces maize, beans, and eggs with the help of one farmhand, and sells these products to the local market. He is married and has three children between the ages of 10 and 17. He also operates a retail shop in the local market.

James has made a loan request of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry for his poultry-farming business. He says this will improve his income, given his experience in the business. Later he will use the income to venture in dairy farming and diversify his trade for more secure income. He adds that reliable income will help him educate his children.

However, he laments of common animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Luz Aydee

texts.es:
A sus 36 años de edad Aydee es una madre consagrada a su familia, día a día se levanta con la ilusión de sacar su negocio adelante para brindarle a su familia estabilidad económica ya que actualmente su esposo no cuenta con un empleo estable, lo que ha hecho que desde hace varios meses Aydee genere los ingresos básicos para las necesidades del hogar.

Aydee produce y comercializa alimentos, específicamente dulces como: colombinas ácidas, crispetas acarameladas, lecheritas, y otros productos que son de gran demanda en los colegios del municipio de Bello, su labor es preparar estos productos y venderlos en las tiendas de los diferentes colegios. Sin embargo no siempre puede tener la cantidad suficiente de productos que requieren sus clientes, es por tal motivo que hoy Aydee ve la necesidad de comprar mas insumos con los cuales aumentar la capacidad de producción, pues comprando los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de los dulces al por mayor, no sólo podrá aumentar la cantidad si no también sus ingresos, pero actualmente Aydee no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de los insumos, por  lo que solicita un crédito que permita hacer dichas compras y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 36 Aydee is a mother who is devoted to her family. Day after day she wakes up with the goal of moving her business forward in order to provide her family with financial stability, especially because her husband does not have stable employment. This is what Aydee has done for several months in order to generate a basic income for the needs of the home.

Aydee prepares and sells foods, specifically sweets, such as: sweet and sour candy, caramel popcorn, caramels, and other products. They are in high demand in the schools of the municipality of Bello. Her work consists of preparing these products and selling them to the stores in the different schools. She is not always able to sell the quantity of products required by her clients. For this reason Aydee now sees the need to purchase more ingredients in order to increase production capacity. When purchasing the ingredients she needs in wholesale, it will not only help her increase quantity but also her profits. But Aydee does not have the necessary capital to purchase the ingredients, which is hwy she requests a loan. It will help her to make these purchases and consequently to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is windowed and blessed with six children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running a tailoring business for the last nineteen years to support her family. She also does farming for additional income. Florence has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has employed two people to help her to manage the business. In the next five years she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) for stocks of fabric for her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has become more financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fabric

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the past three years. He is 33 years old, and married to Everlyne.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to plant wheat and potatoes.

In the future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading wheat farmers in Naivasha area.

loans.use: to plant wheat and potatoes.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 61 años, es un hombre bueno y muy trabajador. Vive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de siete años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Él trabaja mucho para poder brindarle lo mejor a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de Alberto consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, habilitó un espacio en su casa en donde coloco andamios y algunas otras cosas más para montar una bodega. Su negocio es muy concurrido ya que tiene de todo y a un precio muy cómodo, trabaja a lado de su pareja y le esta yendo muy bien, ya que gana buen porcentaje en cada venta que realiza.
