Al principio cuando inicio, desconocía un poco su trabajo pero ahora está fortalecido con los conocimiento y experiencias que adquirió dentro de su negocio. Espera poder consolidar aun más, puesto que su establecimiento esta en una calle muy concurrida y las personas van en busca de diferentes productos y algunas veces no tiene. Por eso desea realizar una inversión más grande y así tener de todo y captar más clientes. Este será el préstamo numero 2 con MFP, está muy contento por que le volverán a dar la confianza de poder cumplir con sus objetivos, además así se sentirá mas seguro de avanzar de a poco en lo que hace, por otro lado esta muy convencido de pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que desea ser tan puntual y solidario como sus compañeros de banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más mercadería para asi tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, comprará bebidas, golosinas, verduras y algunos productos más que le están haciendo mucha falta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Alberto, 61, is a good, hardworking man.  He lives with his spouse and has a 7-year-old son.  They all live together in his own house.  He works hard to provide the best for his son and to improve his quality of life.  Alberto’s work consists in selling groceries at retail.  He equipped a space in his house where he set up some shelving and a few other things to install his store.

His store is very well attended since he has everything at affordable prices.  He works alongside his spouse and is doing very well since he earns a good percentage profit on each sale he makes.  At the beginning when he started out he was a bit uninformed about his business but now he is stronger with more knowledge and experience that he’s acquired on the job.  

He hopes to consolidate still more because his store is on a very busy street and people come by looking for items and sometimes he does not have them.  This is why he wants to make a larger investment to have everything available and capture more customers.

This will be MFP loan #2 and he is very happy because once again he will be trusted to be able to reach his objectives.  Besides, this way he’ll feel more secure of advancing gradually in what he does.  He is very convinced that he will be able to make his installment payments in a punctual way because he wants to be punctual and supportive like his fellow communal bank members.

He will use the requested amount to buy more merchandise to have more products to offer his customers.  He will buy beverages, snacks, vegetables and some other products he very much needs to have in his store.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Yosip

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Yosip; el socio tiene  31 años de edad; el socio tiene 1 hijo ,el socio es soltero,el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de turismo,el es guia de turismo y realiza guiando a turistas al valle sagrado de los incas,machupicchu entre otros lugares,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su hijo,el socio quiere mejorar en su trabajo como guia de turismo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de equipo para alquilar.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Yosip, is 31 years old, has one child, and is single.  He continues working in the tourism business.  He is a tour guide and guides tourists to the sacred valley of the Incas, Machu Picchu among other places.  With this job he gets his son ahead.  He wants to improve in his work as a tour guide.

Yosip is requesting the loan to invest in buying equipment to rent.

He is grateful for the support that will be given to him and so he is committed to making his payments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to buy equipment to rent.

loans.name: Patricia Maria

texts.es: Patricia, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de productos que son necesarios en el negocio, sodas,  salchicha, jamón, salsas, mortadela, aderezos, papas y jugos todos de estos espera que le sirvan para dar una buena atención a los clientes y generar mayores ingresos, ella está consciente que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para cambiar y mejorar en el negocio ya que cuenta con dos coches de venta.
texts.en: Patricia requests this new loan to buy the products that she needs for her business: sodas, sausage, ham, salsas, mortadella, seasonings, potatoes and juices. All of these items she would like to serve to her customers. This will generate a better income for her. She has been responsible with her previous loans. These loans helped her change and improve her business. Now she has two sales carts.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sausages, ham, salsa, mortadella, seasonings, potatoes and juices.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el mismo corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sonia;  La socia tiene 31 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos el último de ellos tiene 5 meses de edad; La socia trabaja en un jardín de niños, ella es cocinera y se encarga de prepara todos los alimentos diarios para los niños, la socia también se dedica los fines de semana a la compra y venta de flores y verduras para vender y de este modo incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su economía, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra y venta de flores y verduras.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI" communal bank, which is located in the very heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

She  is Señora Sonia, 31 years old, and she lives with her partner. She has three children, the youngest of whom is five months old. She works as a cook in a kindergarten, preparing the daily meals for the children. She also works on weekends, buying and selling flowers and vegetables, thus improving her financial situation. Señora Sonia is requesting a loan to invest in the buying and selling of flowers and vegetables.

She is grateful for this loan and committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in the buying and selling of flowers and vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, es soltero, no tiene hijos, administra una ladrillera, este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años por iniciativa propia, tiene mucha clientela que demandan ladrillo y bloques para la construcción.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de barro, arena y tierra, para elaborar los ladrillos, esta compra le ayudara para tener lo necesario en materiales para trabajar mejor.
Su aspiración es tener éxito en el negocio, crecer y mejorar su condición de vida, preparándose con sus propias cosas para cuando forme su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos is single. He has no children. He works as a brick maker. He started this business five years ago on his own initiative. He has many customers that request brick and blocks for construction work. 
He is requesting a loan in order to purchase mud, sand and soil to make bricks. This purchase will help him to have the materials necessary to work better.
His aspirations are to have success with his business and to grow and improve his quality of life to prepare himself for when he sets up his household.

loans.use: purchase mud, sand and soil.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de costurera,la socia se dedica al negocio de costura,la socia cose pantalones,blusas,faldas entre otras ropas y tambien la socia teje chompas para niños,mujeres y varones,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana al por mayor y tambien para comprar tela,hilos y palitos de tejer.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is a seamstress. She has a sewing business. She sews pants, blouses, skirts as well as other clothes. She also knits men’s, women’s and children’s sweaters. Because of this business, she can help her children succeed. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell clothes. She is asking for this loan in order to buy wool wholesale and also to buy fabric, thread and knitting needles. This member is happy to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool and also to buy fabric, thread and knitting needles.

loans.name: Mariana Isabel

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó cuando tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir un cibercafé que se encontraba en venta, con el dinero que había recibido por la liquidación de su trabajo anterior.  Ya tiene 2 años trabajando con su local y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una compañía.  Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian en la escuela fiscal del barrio.  Le gustaría poder tener una despensa junto con su negocio actual y también mantener a su familia junto con su madre.  Por ahora, requiere el préstamo para la compra de una computadora y bebidas (agua, colas e hidratantes) que expende en su local.
texts.en: This client is from the city of Machala. She started when she had the oppurtunity to acquire an internet cafe that was on sale, and used the money that she got when she left her previous job. She has been working for two years now at the business and so far it has been going very well for her. She is married and her husband works as a security guard at a company. She has 3 children, and all of them study at the public school in their district. She would like to have a small store along with her current business, as well as supporting her family along with her mother. For the moment, she needs a loan so that she can purchase a computer and beverages (water, soda, and hydrating liquids) that she sells at her business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and beverages.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en: Vacahgan is 67 years old and he lives with his beloved wife in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Vachagan has specialty of painter and many years he was engaged in his beloved occupation of painting, and thanks to his unique talent now the walls of his flat are nicely decorated with his paintings. Unfortunately now as he mentions with pity he is engaged in another work and he works at the private company. Vachagan has a son and a daughter and both of them are already married and they live with their families. Vachagan lately stated repairing of his flat and the savings that he managed to do during several years turned to be not enough. This loan of 690.000 Armenian drams he will be very thankful to receive in order to end all the repairing of his flat making it clean and comfortable with coming of New Year holidays.

loans.use: to end all the repairing of his flat making it clean and comfortable with coming of New Year holidays

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Madame B. Adjo was born in 1955 and is the mother of four children. She is a restaurant manager in Gapé where she makes pounded yam foufou. Pounded yam is a popular Togolese meal, well-liked in her town. In order to fix up the premises of her business and to meet growing customer demand, she is asking for a $500 loan to stock yam, meat and condiments. This will allow her to avoid extra expenses. Before, she bought everything on credit, which resulted in lost earnings. The loan she is seeking will be a way out for Madame B. Adjo.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Adjo est née en1955 et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Tenancière de bar à Gapé marché où elle fait du foufou « igname pilée ». C’est un repas très apprécié par la majorité de la population togolaise et sur tout dans sa localité. Afin d’aménager son local et satisfaire les besoins sans cesse croissants de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 pour faire l’approvisionner en igname, viande et condiments. Ceci lui permettrait de supprimer les charges supplétives. Autrefois, elle prenait tout à crédit, ce qui crée des manques à gagner. Ce crédit sollicité serait une porte de sortie pour Madame B. Adjo

loans.use: stocking yam, meat, and condiments

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.en:
María is separated from her husband and cares for five children, who are 28, 27, 22, 18, and 8 years old. She began with her business when she separated from her husband because her children were studying and she didn’t have any way to continue educating them. It was for them that she decided to open a small business with the help of one of her children, who had begun working and was able to give her his small savings so that she could rent a shop where she could sell sweets. Little by little, things went well and her business began to grow. At the request of her clients, she began selling more things for children’s parties, like disposable items, piñatas, etc.

María is requesting a lon of $925.00 in order to buy inventory and stock her business, which is growing. This way she can satisfy her clients and keep them. She offers to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. María hopes for your collaboration and support so that she can continue supporting her five children and give them an education. She is grateful to everyone for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta separada de su esposo y tiene a su cargo 5 hijos de 28 años, 27 años, 22 años, 18 años y 8 años; Ella empezó con el negocio cuando se separo de su esposo debido a que sus hijos estaban estudiando y no tenía los medio para continuar educándolos por ello es que decidió abrir un pequeño negocio con ayuda de uno de sus hijos el cual empezó a trabajar y le dio un pequeño ahorro que tenía para poder rentar un local en donde ella pudiera vender dulces. Poco a poco con el tiempo le fue yendo bien y su negocio comenzó a crecer y a pedido de sus clientes ella fue vendiendo más artículos que iban de acuerdo a fiestas infantiles como artículos desechables, piñatas, etc.

María esta solicitando un crédito de US $ 925 para comprar mercancía y surtir su negocio que va creciendo y así satisfacer a sus clientes y mantenerlos, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. María espera su colaboración y apoyo para poder seguir manteniendo a sus 5 hijos y brindarles educación, ella agradece a todas las personas por su ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum K. is 52 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their three children.  Chum K. grows and sells water convolvulus in the market, earning $5/day.  Her husband works as a motor taxi driver, earning $3/day.  She will use this loan to buy some tools for planting crops and also to repair her husband's motorbike.  In the future, she would like to buy more land to raise crops on.

loans.use: to buy tools for planting crops

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
I want to build a room and cover it in a tile floor, as well as a small thicket fence since I have some of the material purchased but I have to buy more and pay the labor only that I don't now have the complete amount. I request $1,200 for the construction of the room, to put in the floor and have the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

“Quiero construir un cuarto y ponerle vitropiso, así como hacer una barda pequeña ya que tengo algo de material que he comprado pero tengo que comprar más y pagar la mano de obra solo que no cuento ahora con la cantidad completa”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción del cuarto, poner el piso y hacer la barda.

loans.use: Construction of a room, floor and fence - Construcción de un cuarto, piso y barda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow - female pig (Membeli  Induk babi)

loans.name: Florisa

texts.es:
Florisa works tirelessly selling meals in her neighborhood. For more than 16 years, she has been working to improve her economic situation and cover the costs of her children, who thanks to her efforts have been able to pursue their own professions. Florisa prepares every delicious dish she offers in her home, taking advantage of the events in the neighborhood to increase her sales. Even in the face of tragedy, with the death of her husband, she continued to move forward, motivated by her children. Today, many people enjoy her meals and her culinary skills, but she still needs support to continue helping her children with the care of her grandchildren. Florisa has a great desire to useful, and wants to continue with her business. She would like to set up a small restaurant in her house where she can serve her dishes, continue to earn an income and help her family. Let's help this grandmother in her efforts to improve the quality of life for her children and grandchildren.

La señora Florisa, trabaja incansablemente vendiendo comida en su localidad dentro D. su recinto, ofrece diariamente riquísimos platillos y hace más D. 16 años es una actividad que le ha ayudado a crecer económicamente y a solventar los gastos D. sus hijos, quienes gracias el esfuerzo D. su adorada madre se han convertido en profesionales. Cada plato que ofrece los prepara en su hogar y aprovecha los eventos para incrementar sus ventas.A pesar D. esta dura situación por la que atravesó luego D. la muerte D. su esposo, ha podido salir adelante, motivada por el amor D. madre.Ahora muchas personas disfrutan D. su excelente sazón y gran versatilidad D. platos, gracias a sus habilidades culinarias, sin embargo hoy requiere D. apoyo para poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos en el cuidado D. sus nietos y por ello tiene unas inmensas ganas D. ser útil y seguir trabajando con la venta D. sus deliciosos platos. Por lo que anhela ambientar su local y así hacer más acogedor su restaurante para vender sus riquísimos platillos, D. tal manera que pueda seguir siendo aquél apoyo incondicional para sus hijos y nietos.Colaboremos para que esta cariñosa abuelita pueda seguir contribuyendo con el incremento del nivel D. vida D. su familia.

loans.use: TO SET UP A SMALL RESTAURANT IN HER HOUSE AND SERVE HER CUSTOMERS, INSTEAD OF SELLING MEALS AROUND THE NEIGHBORHOOD.  WITH HER INCOME, THIS WIDOW AND GRANDMOTHER  HELPS SUPPORT HER CHILDREN AND GRANDCHILDREN.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José is 52 years old and has five children. He runs an open-air business selling home products, and at the same time distributes these products to three other sellers. His children help him with the sales. He's requesting the loan to purchase larger quantities of supplies, since his products are in high demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don José Carlos R. tiene 52 años y 5 hijos. Tiene un negocio ambulante de ventas de artículos para el hogar al mismo tiempo que distribuye estos artículos a otros tres vendedores. Sus Hijos le ayudan con el control de las ventas. Solicita el dinero para comprar mayor cantidad de utensilios, ya que en esta época del año se registran mayor número de ventas.

loans.use: Purchase home products

loans.name: Thi Senh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Sênh is 56 but looks much older. She is always industrious. All her children are grown up and left home. She lives with her husband, a retired cadre. Everyday she makes and sells rice cakes, variety of kinds. She also delivers to various stands at the market. Her husband helps her. She’s never borrow money but this time she would like to apply for a loan at Binh Minh to buy material for cake making. Income from selling cakes everyday would be used to repay the loan, easily.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Bác Sênh, năm nay 58 tuổi, trông bề ngoài bác có vẻ già hơn. Bác rất chịu thương chịu khó. Mặc dù các con bác đã lớn và ra ở riêng, còn lại hai vợ chồng, bác vẫn làm bánh. Hàng ngày, bác vẫn làm bánh tẻ bán, giao cho các nơi đặt hàng. Chồng bác là cán bộ đã về hưu, thường giúp đỡ bác trong công việc làm bánh. Bác chưa tham gia vay vốn ở đâu cho đến bay giờ, bác vay vốn về mua các nguyên liệu làm bánh như: gạo, hành, mộc nhĩ... Mua nhiều một lúc sẽ được giảm giá, từ đó thu nhập của gia đình sẽ cao hơn. Bán bánh hàng ngày giúp bác tiết kiệm và trả dần một cách dễ dàng.

loans.use: Buy material for cake making

loans.name: Miringilab

texts.en: Miringilab A. is a fresh fish vendor in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is married with one child and has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently seeking additional funding so that he can invest in and grow his business operation.

loans.use: To invest in the growth of his business

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru:
Gulandom K. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is married and has 2 children. She has a High School education and is a stay at home mom. She is also in the business of growing potatoes. She has a piece of land on which her family plants potatoes. Most of the obtained crop is sold on the market while a small portion is kept to provide for the family. She plans to use the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer in time for the potato planting season. Gulandom's business provides her family and the local markets with potatoes. She plans to repay the loan withing a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караева Гуландом проживает в районе Шахринау. Замужем , имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Занимается сельским хозяйством имеет участок земли который засеивает картофелем.Полученный урожай использует как для своей семьи так и для продажи.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить семена картофеля и удобрения, так как сейчас сезон посева картофеля.Этот кредит поможет клиентке вовремя засеить картофель , тем самым обеспечив свою семью и рынки картофелем. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba G. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 47 years old, married and has 3 children. She has finished high school. She is a seamstress by training. This is what she does now. Mahbuba works in an atelier where she sews traditional clothing. She has been doing this for 5 years. Now, that it is spring, there are more customers wanting to buy her products, this is why Mahbuba would like to increase volume of her goods. Mahbuba needs to buy cloth and ensure that her equipment functions well (fix her sewing machine). Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan amounting to $875, which will help her. Mahbuba plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Гулямова Махбуба проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Ей 47 лет , она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Имеет средне - профессиональное образование. По специальности она портниха. Так и занимается своим делом. Работает в швейном ателье по пошиву национальной одежды. Занимаентся швейным делом уже 5 лет. С приходом весны спрос на ее продукцию увеличился, поэтому Махбуба хочет увеличить объем производимой продукции. А для этого ей надо закупить материал и обеспечить себя бесперебойной работой техники( отремонтировать швейную машину). Поэтому она решила получить кредит в размере 875 долларов США , который поможет ей. А погасить кредит Махбуба сможет в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and repair the sewing machine

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur who lives in the city of Ordzhonikidze, where she owns a small business selling footwear in the central market and in neighboring villages where she travels periodically. Natalya chose this trade because demand is stable. She started her venture 11 years ago and it has brought her a good income ever since that time. Presently, Natalya has about $9,000 in working capital. Her monthly net profit is about $1,100.

Natalya is hoping to use a loan of $525 to purchase assorted inventory and boost her sales. This will help her generate additional income. Natalya has an extensive and good credit history and is known as an entrepreneur of integrity. We believe her good record and honest approach in the matters of business will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy new inventory

loans.name: Jam Bugum 3 Group

texts.fr:
Having come together as a group, these five illiterate women used their first loan of 500 000 CFA to start a business raising cattle in their village. Two (2) other loans of 500 000 CFA allowed them to increase their production capacity. Each of the women are given one ox which she raises alone. The income drawn from this business serves to improve the daily meals and pay for the medical costs of their children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Regroupées au sein d'un groupement ,ces cinq femmes analphabetes ont avec un premier pret de 500000f cfa demarré une activité d'embouche bovine dans leur village.Deux (2) autres successifs de 500.000f cfa leur ont permis d'augmenter leur capacité de production .Chacune d'elle bénéficie d'un boeuf qu'elle embouche seule.Les revenus tirés de l'activité servent à amelliorer les repas quotidiens payer les frais médicaux des enfants.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Melania is 44 years old and lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino. She is married and has 2 kids who are 14 and 15. Her husband is a mechanic and helps with the household costs.

Melania is a cleaner and has been for 4 years. With this loan they hope to build a room in the house to make the family more comfortable. In the future they hope to finish building their house and to give their kids an education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Melania tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como mecánico y aporta a los gastos del hogar. La Sra. Melania trabaja como domestica y tiene cuatro años de estar laborando, con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para construcción de un cuarto para estar más cómoda. A futuro s terminar de construir su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To build a room to make her family more comfortable/Construcción de un cuarto para darle comodidad a su familia

loans.name: Ndiaye Et Freres Group

texts.fr:
N. and Bros. is a young people’s business run by Mamadou N.. To boost their activity, they are requesting a loan to increase their working capital. This will enable them to better meet the ever growing demand. This way, they will be able to provide for themselves.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

N. ET FRERES une entreprise de jeunes dirigee par Mamadou N.. Pour accroitre leurs activites, ils sollicitent ce pret pour lui permettre d'accroitre son fond de roulemement en vue de mieux faire face a la demande qui est de plus en plus croissant. Ainsi ils pourront se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Manufacturing of cooking pots

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier P. V. tiene casa propia en la zona de Tacagua, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Javier trabaja como tramitador independiente en la alcaldía de La Paz (por ejemplo, ayuda a los ancianos haciendo diligencias, consiguiendo documentos, haciendo sellar y revisar tales documentos, etc.). 

El muro frontal de su vivienda sufrió un derrumbe por el deterioro de las paredes de adobe (antiguo, obsoleto y peligroso material por que se remoja fácilmente). Es por eso que necesita el crédito para reconstruir el muro frontal, esta vez con cemento y ladrillo.  Es la quinta vez que confía en nosotros y como siempre, nuestra evaluación indica que es apto para recibir un nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Javier P. V. owns his own house in the zone of Tacagua. He is married and has two children. Javier works as an independent “tramitador” (someone who expedites transactions) in the municipality of La Paz. (For example, he helps the elderly with legal procedures, obtains documents, revises and stamps those documents, etc.)

The front of his house suffered a collapse because of the deterioration of the adobe walls (the old, obsolete and dangerous material soaks through easily). That is why he needs credit to rebuild the front wall—this time with concrete and brick. This is the fifth time he has come to us for credit and, as always, our evaluation indicates that he is eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Srou

texts.en:
Srou E., 44, is a silk weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The silk dress is a kind of Khmer traditional uniform, worn during the P'chum Ben ceremony and Khmer New Year. Normally hand-woven silk is more expensive than machine-woven, but people themselves prefer the hand-woven material. Srou has been weaving since 2003 and on average she makes around US$2.50 profit each day. To make one silk dress takes about 7-10 days.

Her husband, Tean Tith, 46, is one of the rice farmers in the village. He also grows vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, and so on. He sells his produce in the market and is able to make around US$2.50 in profit each day, too. This couple has five children, two of whom are students and three of whom are garment factory workers. Srou E. says that she spends monthly around US$40 for food, US$5 on utilities, and US$10 on her children's education. Mrs. Srou has requested a loan of US$800 to raise pigs and purchase crop seeds and insecticide for her husband.

loans.use: To raise pigs and purchase seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: La Sra.  Felicia Vázquez tiene 37 años y esta casada con el Sr. Jorge García de 41 años que trabaja como chofer  en una empresa de transporte de cargas internacionales. Tienen un hijo de 6 años que inicio sus estudios primarios este año.nLa Sra. Felicia Vázquez se dedica a la confección de prendas de ao poí, un tejido típico del Paraguay hecho totalmente a mano, desde hace 10 años, pero en forma independiente lo hace desde  hace 4 años , ya que anteriormente trabajaba para la prestigiosa empresa de confección de Cecilia Fadul.nLa misma desea  invertir el préstamo solicitado en la compra de telas por fardo para la confección de distintos tipos de  prendas de ao poí y de esa manera abaratar los costos de las mismasny tener mayores ganancias por las prendas que confecciona.n
texts.en:
Felicia V. is 37 years old and she is married to Mr. Jorge Garceda, aged 41 years old, and he works as a driver for an international transport company. They have a son aged 6 years and she started primary school this year. Felicia V.'s occupation is the sales of dresses, handmade in Paraguay. She has been running this business for the last 10 years, but she has been doing this in an independent basis for the past 4 years. Previously she worked in a prestigious company called Cecilia Fadul. She wishes to invest the funds of this loan in the purchase of fabrics in large lots and of different types to cut the overhead costs and improve her earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Oum

texts.en:
Mrs. Oum P., 45, farms rice as well as raising pigs at her home for income. She has four children, all are single and live in Kompong Tom Province. Her husband, Mr. Sem Him, 47, is a local chef. He cooks for wedding parties or ceremonies at his customer's house with much experience, earning approximately US$ 5 per day.

Oum is seeking a US$ 250 loan to purchase a cow for plowing her farmland. (Oum's husband is pictured, because Oum was not available.)

loans.use: to purchase a cow for plowing

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Retoño (“Sprout”) Village Bank.  She is 36 years old and separated with two children.  

Antonia lives in a rental property.  She travels to different regional markets to sell dry goods, wool and bread.  On the days when there are no markets, Antonia spins yarn from animal wool and sells her yarn in the market by the kilo.  

Antonia needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Antonia dreams of building her own home and for her children to complete their education. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. 
Antonia es separada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Antonia vive en casa alquilada, Antonia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes, lanas, panes. En los demás días Antonia hace hilados de lana de animales que luego vende en los mercados por kilos. 
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. 
Antonia sueña con construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Gulshan Fatima M. Ejaz Group

texts.en:
Gulshan Fatima baji is a 41-year-old married woman who has lived in Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. 

Multan is famous for its shrines. Every year, many people come to visit the shrines believing that their wishes will be fulfilled. Gulshan baji feels lucky to be a part of this city. 

Her husband, M. E., has a business making biscuits. He has been in this business for 10 years. Gulshan baji helps her husband to make biscuits. They both work really hard, but their burden is lightened when they hear compliments from the people who eat their biscuits. Gulshan baji is applying for a loan to buy the ingredients that they use to make the biscuits. 

Gulshan Fatima baji is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Razia baji and Shanaz baji each want a loan to buy bangles for their bangle business. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy clothes, colored thread and sketches to complete the dresses and displays in her boutique. Nasreen Begum baji and Haleema baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making biscuits

loans.name: Durlescu

texts.en: M. Durlescu is 25 years old. She recently graduated from the agricultural university in Chisinau City. M. now wants to start her own business and needs the necessary working capital. For this purpose, she would like a loan from Microinvest. M. is grateful that Microinvest is willing to help young entrepreneurs who want to achieve their goals.

loans.use: Start a farming business

loans.name: Islomidin

texts.en:
Islomidin supports and provides for his loved ones as a farmer through hard work and dedication.  He leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle.  He would like to expand his business, but he needs a loan in order to purchase young cattle and the fodder to feed them. He will cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess is a hair stylist. She also sells hair creams and hair extensions. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Abdull Jamel Group

texts.en:
Abdull Jamel is the group leader of the Abdull Jamel group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total of their group loan is 30000Af for the term of 10 months.

Abdull Jamel wants to take a loan for his business of selling vegetables. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Fowzya wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy new machine for her business. Syweta wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. He wants to expand his business. Maryna wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving.

They want to say that these loans will be used for growing and enlarging the businesses and they all want to thank the Kiva process in Afghanistan for supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Sarefa

texts.en: Sarefa is the daughter of M. A.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and she has three children. She has a business running a beauty salon, and she wants to make her business grow. So, she requests an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. She says thank you to Kiva lenders who can support all the world.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
Дилрабо Сабурова родилась в 1970 году по национальности таджичка, замужем, любящая мать 3 детей. Место жительство Дилрабо и ее семьи город Истаравшан.
Дилрабо торгует на рынке зеленью, и соленьями (солеными огурцами, помидорами, маринованным горным луком, который называется Анзур и т.д.)
Дилрабо привозит товар с города Худжанда, продает сама, а так же оптом и в розницу.
Супруг Дилрабо занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивает яблони, и получает семейный доход от реализации урожая яблок, в осенний период.
Дилрабо подала заявку на получение займа 1300 сомони на 6 месяцев, с целью товарооборота.
texts.en:
Dilrabo S., born in 1970, of Tajik nationality, is married and the loving mother of three children. She and her family live in the city of Istaravshan. Dilrabo sells leafy green vegetables and pickled vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, the Anzur mountain onion, etc.) She transports the goods from the city of Khudjand, and sells them herself, wholesale as well as retail. Dilrabo's husband, a farmer, raises apples and receives income from selling the apple harvest in fall. Dilrabo applied for a 1300 somoni, 6 month loan, for sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales turnover

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
H. Ngô Thị makes a living primarily from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Sóc Sơn. H. is married and has three school-aged children. She has been in business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month.

In 1994, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her business. H. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fifteenth loan from TYM Fund.

No. 123940805.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a salon

loans.name: Dezilanta's Group

texts.en:
N. Dezilanta is the leader of Kiwamirembe Group in Kigombya. She is married with three children, and has a business selling maize and chicken mash to the poultry farmers in her locality. She is also a poultry farmer herself, with 300 egg-laying chicks and a few broilers at home for meat. Dezilanta is one of the founding members of her group, which she started up after becoming a farmer.

Dezilanta is grateful for the loans from Kiva partner, Pearl Microfinance, because without them, her life and that of her family would not be as it is today. She is asking for a loan through Pearl Microfinance to buy and stock more maize brand, shells and mash for sale.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her poultry farm and for sale

loans.name: Abdull Jabar Group

texts.en: A. Jabar is the leader of A. Jabar group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to receive a loan for advancing their business. A. Jabar wants a loan for his general store, Sayada wants a loan for her carpet-weaving business, and Anesa wants a loan for her tailoring business. They requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan and thank all lenders, AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: To advance their businesses

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a woman determined to rise above poverty. She is a 35-year-old mother to five children; all young and still dependent on her. She lives in Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines.

She is an opportunity seeker. In 2008, when she heard about ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, she grabbed the opportunity of joining it. Her previous loans were used as capital for her resale of assorted biscuits that she sells in schools and in public places.

Now on her 3rd loan, she proposes the amount of 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used as rolling capital for her resale business. She is hopeful that with the opportunity and trust given by ASHI and KIVA, she will be able to make her business grow so it will bring her enough proceeds for her living. She dreams of sending all her children to school until they finish college and find jobs.

loans.use: as rolling capital for her resale business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Barco”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to de secundaria), vive en Chucuito - Sector Barco.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de lanas para la elaboración de  artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de redes y un disco para obtener más cantidad de pesca, ya que ahora también se dedica a la pesca artesanal.  Paralelamente continúa con su negocio de elaboración de títeres de lana acrílica, también algunas prendas de vestir como chompas, chalecos, etc.

Su deseo es seguir con el negocio y ampliarlo.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las actividades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Community Bank "Santa Cruz de Barco" located in the district of Chucuito in the Barco Sector, in Puno. She is 37 years old and she is married and is mother to 2 children. She has a grade 10 education. She lives in Chucuito in the Barco Sector.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 3 years. Her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of yarns for craft making.

She currently requires a loan of S/.300 nuevos soles to purchase fishing nets and other equipment to catch more fish, because now she is also a fisherman. She continues on with her craft making business on the side, making puppets from acryclic yarn, as well as some items of clothing such as jackets, and vests, etc.

Her wish is to carry on her business and to expand it.

She loves savings and she enjoys the timeliness of her activities.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and other equipment with which to fish.compra de redes de pesca y su disco, para realizar pesca artesanla.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
47- years old Emily P. is a farmer and a pig grower. She has one child who are 21 years old now. Her husband left her and so she just focus all her attention to her business and to her  only child. She started farming since 1986 and she wanted to make it grow to be able to withstanf the bigger challenge currently she faces.

Receiving a loan of Php 8,000 is truly worthwhile especially that she doesn't have something to use to support her business. She really needs additional capital to buy fertilizers for her farm and piglets for a piggery business.

Believing always on her dreams, she is never lose hope to the power of hard work and prayer. She thanks CEVI for partnering her through the years. She likes it services because it has the lowest interest rate of 2% a month that is very easy and affordable to repay.

loans.use: fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane A. is a 40 year old married mother of five children. She and her family live in Kenya. She runs a cereal store business along a busy street in the Nyalenda slums. She started this business nineteen years ago. Currently she sells dry corn, sorghum, millet, rice and groundnuts. She needs kshs 20,000 to buy stock of cereals in bulk.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. DesD. hace 11 años se dedica a la venta D. helados en el parque principal del poblado más cercano a su casa. Ella misma prepara los helados con una máquina especial, por lo que empieza su labor a las 11 D. la mañana hasta el medio día, y por la tarD. los venD.. Cuando su hija termina sus clases la apoya en la atención D. su negocio y al terminar, van nuevamente al mercado para comprar los ingredientes necesarios para sus helados. Este negocio le permite mejorar la economía D. su hogar, es por eso que Marcelina está pensando en adquirir otra máquina para elaborar más helados. 
Esta es la 12ava oportunidad en que tiene crédito con MFP y está muy contenta D. ser parte del banco comunal que le ha dado la oportunidad D. integrarse para trabajar por el bienestar común. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. cajas D. barquillos, servilletas, leche, manteca y demás artículos e ingredientes necesarios para su negocio, en una cantidad que le dure para varios meses.

loans.use: Compra de ingredientes para sus helados

loans.name: Latifatou Adèle

texts.fr: H. Latifatou Adèle est née en 1967 à Katagon au Bénin. Latifatou Adèle est depuis quatre ans au quartier Danto à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DOSSA Nicaise un gendarme, Latifatou Adèle est mère de cinq enfants et a un enfant en plus à sa charge. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Latifatou Adèle et Nicaise supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Latifatou Adèle n’a jamais été à l’école ; il y a environs six ans qu’elle a commencé la vente des divers (pâtes alimentaires, biscuits, piles, sucre, savons, conserves, bougies, farine de manioc). Latifatou Adèle vend également de l’igname et a une boutique à son domicile où elle vend ses produits. Latifatou Adèle s’approvisionne à Kétou, à proximité de Porto-Novo, et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et aussi sa clientèle, Latifatou Adèle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Latifatou Adèle H. was born in 1967 in Katagon Benin. Latifatou Adèle has lived for four years in the Danto neighborhood of Porto Novo, administrative capital of the Benin. She is married to Nicaise Dossa, a policeman. Latifatou Adèle is the mother of five children and has one more child in her care. All her children attend school. Latifatou Adèle and Nicaise bear together the family expenses. Latifatou Adèle never attended school; it has been about six years since she began the sale of goods (pasta, cookies, batteries, sugar, soap, canned goods, candles, manioc flour). Latifatou Adèle also sells yams and has a shop in her residence where she sells her products. Latifatou Adèle supplies herself at Kétou, near Porto Novo, and in the Ouando market of Porto Novo. She is a former customer of ALIDé that already benefitted from two loans that she repaid well. To increase her working capital and also her clientele, Latifatou Adèle requests a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of coal for wood and various other supplies for resale.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer D. is from the village of  Lumbayao , Valencia  City. He is 30 years old. Elmer is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elmer has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elmer is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth,42, is married and has four children. She styles and braids hair and sells hair extension and hair accessories to customers in her store.  To meet the demand, she hopes to employ more people and buy two hair dryers. Festive season is coming and she will be extra busy. She hopes for a loan of N100,000.

loans.use: Purchase more hair dryer.

loans.name: Nakalasa Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Josephine is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a divorced lady with seven children aged 25 – 9 years. She also takes care of one dependent.

Josephine is a farmer from Nakalasa and although her business is so much affected by fluctuating prices, she is able to make 40,000/= as profits. She is able to plan her seasons well and her target is to have two acres of maize per season.

Josephine also hopes to buy a plot of land so that she can enlarge her farming business. She needs a loan to help increase production by buying more seeds, pesticides and so on.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, pesticides, etc., for increased production

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa S. is 53 years old and lives with her husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband drives a truck between their hometown and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where more than 30% of the Mongolian total population resides. Tsetsegmaa runs a small food store at the center of the town. She sells basic food products such as soft drinks and cookies.  Her store is conveniently located right next to a secondary school, so most of her customers are students and their parents. Tsetsegmaa says that her daily income is pretty good. 

She purchases her food products from wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar and her husband usually transports these goods.  Tsetsegmaa would like to expand her business by adding more varieties of food products that her young customers would like to purchase. She is requesting a loan so that she can offer a greater variety of products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Etab

texts.en:
Etab is a 24-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their three children.

Etab has owned a clothing shop since 2008 where she sells used clothes, as well as shoes and accessories like belts, handbags and more. She decided on doing her business because she realized that it was better using the used clothes than throwing them out.

Etab requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Etab is special in her business because she sells good quality used clothes at a cheap price. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income.

When she first started her business, Etab didn’t receive a lot of clients because people didn’t like the idea but, once they realized that she sells clean and good quality clothes, she enlarged her customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 33 years old and is married with three children with ages 3, 6 and 9 years. She and her family live in Rulindo, in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately two hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Pelagie operates a business selling drinks made from sorghum. This is her tenth successful year in this business which she operates from early in the morning until 2 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Pelagie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing more sorghum to make into drinks for sale. With this loan, she hopefully will be able to satisfy the demand of her customers as well as earn more profits than previously.

If Pelagie’s plan is successful, with the earned profits she will be able to reinvest in her business so that her business can keep growing.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to make into drinks to sell

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou S. est une commerçante vivant avec son mari, son enfant de 28 ans et ses neveux dans  la ville de Diourbel située à 150 Kms de Dakar la capitale du Sénégal, le pays de la téranga (hospitalité). Cette femme âgée de 48 ans fait le commerce des pagnes et de perles très suivi dans  toute la ville.  Elle l’a embrassé depuis plus de 20 ans  pour bien s’entretenir.Adhérant à U-IMCEC au niveau de la caisse de Ndayane Diourbel, Madame S. souhaitait bénéficier des crédits de la caisse. Ainsi, elle demande un financement de 200 000 FCFA pour s’approvisionner en pagne destinée à la revente.
texts.en:
Ms Astou S., a storekeeper, lives with her husband, her 28-year-old child and her nephews in the city of Diourbel, located 150 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal, in the land of téranga (hospitality). This lady, aged 48, trades in pagnes (a colorful West African wax cloth) and beads. Her products are in high demand in the city. She started this business over 20 years ago to provide for herself. Ms Astou is a member of the Ndayane Diourbel branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC, since she wants to benefit from loans. She applies now for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to stock up with pagnes for resale.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up with pagnes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Restock his store with food products and other items

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 37-year-old single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school while one has finished the secondary level of schooling and wants to set up his own business.

Veronica runs a salon in Naivasha town and this she has done for the last thirteen years.

Veronica was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her first loan of Ksh 25,000 well and on time. She plans to buy more cosmetics and hair products to stock her salon.

Veronica plans to grow her salon and open a hairdressing school in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.ru: Саттаев Давлатмурод проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Давлатмурод занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа мелко- рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Davlatmurod S. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 33 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Davlatmurod is involved in animal husbandry. He fattens and sells livestock. He has been working in this field for over 20 years. Davlatmurod is requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock in order to increase its quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Shamila Shakila Group

texts.en:
Shamila is the daughter of H.. She is 42 years old and the leader of Shamila Shakila group. She is married with six children and lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated. Her youngest son has a retail food shop and he is the responsible one for all his family members. 

Shamila wants to take out a loan for her son. Her family has an economical problem at home. Her son needs money. His mother (Shamila) is taking a loan from AFS for her son to buy more materials for the shop such as rice, baskets and milk to make a good life for his whole family. He is the only one to help his family and he wants to find close relationships with people to find more clients to make a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy more groceries for his shop

loans.name: Yeoun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yeoun M., 42 years old, is the leader of a group loan located in Preak Ta Hang village in Kandal province.  She was selected by the eight members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Yeoun M. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. Her husband, Mr. Mith Phay, is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a small income to support his family.  To support both businesses, Mrs. Yeoun M. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed and sesame seed, to hire people to plow her farm and to repair her husband's motorcycle. This couple has four children. Three of the children are students in the local school and the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, sesame seed and to hire people to plow her farm

loans.name: Villa Mercedes Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: VILLA MERCEDES  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Villa Mercedes, ubicado en la avenida El palmar, el B.E. esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 11 personas, Se fundo el  16 D.  Octubre  del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras.

Como PRESIDENTA tenemos a la señora Gabriela, TESORERA la  Sr. Solange y SECRETARIA la Sra. Maria del Rosario; en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican en  mayoría en la  venta D. cosméticos ,ropa ,comida ,  y otros. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días viernes  a horas 11:00 AM en la casa D. la señora Gabriela. Los nuevos clientes que hemos captados, están conforme D. trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro D. la capacitación del  B.E. VILLA MERCEDES  ,se les estableció una proyección D. sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. GABRIELA (Presidenta) venD. D. cosméticos  D. manera ambulante, también desarrolla otro tipo actividad económica, como la venta D. asaditos, empanadas  en su domicilio y  en diferentes mercados populares. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona  se  siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño D. la señora  Gabriela   es tener   un pequeño tinglado para su puesto  D. venta, y  progresar en la vida con su negocio con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender Y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The VILLA MERCEDES community bank is located in the the Villa Mercedes neighborhood on Avenida El Palmar. The community bank is in its 3rd round and has 11 members. It was started by a group of women and formally organized on October 16, 2009. For PRESIDENT, we have Sra. Gabriella, for TREASURER, Sr. Sonange and for SECRETARY, Sr. Maria del Rosario. The majority of the women in the group sell products such as cosmetics, clothes, food, etc. The group's meetings are scheduled for 11:00am on Fridays at Sra. Gabriella's house. Our new customers are pleased to work with us at Emprender because we have helped them to establish a savings program for the round whereby they will learn to save and meet with their fellow members every 14 days. Sra. GABRIELA (President) is a street vendor. She sells cosmetics, but she is also developing a business to sell "asaditos" (grilled meat) and empanadas from her house and at various local markets. The community bank has helped her learn to save. It's also helped her to believe in herself and appreciate her own worth. Gabriella's greatest wish is to build a small structure where she can operate her business. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown by extending these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Joshua S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. A 25-year-old single father of a five-month-old child, Joshua was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.

For 2 years, he has been molding and selling cement blocks for construction in Thinkers Village outside of Monrovia, Liberia and plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of cement. Joshua's dream is to expand his business, build a shop and leave the block-molding business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement.

loans.name: G.s. Angeles Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Ángeles está conformado por Iveth y Loyda por lo que juntas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. Por lo que Iveth realiza la venta de cosméticos ambulante pues la mayoría de sus clientes viven en comarcas muy alejadas y pues ella aprovecha para realizar las visitas en sus viviendas en donde disfruta de ofrecer sus productos pues siempre carga un bolso con ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, trajes y cosméticos. Así fue con el paso del tiempo que logro juntarse con Loyda Jesel para realizar un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para su negocio. Juntas sueñan con ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Ángeles communal bank is made up of Iveth and Loyda, and they each work in different economic activities. Iveth sells cosmetics as a traveling vendor. Most of her clients live in very remote areas. She always visits them in their house, where she offers them her products—she always brings with her a bag with intimate clothing, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, and cosmetics. Over time she was able to join up with Loyda Jesel to obtain a loan for the products for her business. Together they dream of expanding their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cooking supplies.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila A. is from the village of Nazareth, Osmeña, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old and is widowed with two adult children. Leonila owns and operates a a food stall, selling fruits and vegetables, herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month. In 2008, Leonila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 6,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is requesting a new loan of PHP 6,000 which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila C. is 50 years old and is married with four children: three of them are adults and only one is still in school. Teofila is from the village of D'ban, Calamba. Teofila is engaged in selling cosmetics and, out of this activity, she's able to earn a monthly net income of 3,000 PHP. She has been engaged in her business for more than twenty-two years. In 2000, Teofila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for a new business: hog raising. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for a new hog-raising business

loans.name: Vuoch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who live in Preak Ta Hang village in Kandal province. The members have selected Mrs. Vuoch C., 38, as their group leader. Each group member will use their portion of the loan to support their individual businesses.

Mrs. Vuoch C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetable and rice. Her husband, Mr. La vong, is a construction worker in the village. Both occupations combined, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. To increase their family income, Mrs. Vuoch C. will use the loan to buy a fishing boat for fishing. The couple has seven children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a clothes seller, three are students in the local school, while the youngest is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his 2 parents. He is an experienced furniture painter with almost 8 years in the business. He’s a new business owner, and has owned his shop since 2009. He works upon request of his customers and also in collaboration with some galleries. He has already received his first kiva loan and he’s very thankful for the results. 

This borrower is the main provider for with parents. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members while at the same time running a business. Today, he is asking for a loan of $2000 to purchase new tools for his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open his own gallery shop.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar A. is from the village of Kabulawan, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. He is 27 years old. Joemar is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joemar owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling amakan furniture, a bamboo wave forming into a bed sheet  to local businesses and community members. Joemar has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joemar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joemar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Joemar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joemar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert K. is a 46 year-old man.  He is married and is blessed with three kids. He supports a family of five people. Albert does horticultural farming as a source of his income in Tambach, Iten; he started his farming seven years ago.  From this business he gets a monthly income of Kshs 30,000. Albert has taken a third loan of Kshs 50,000 from KADET LTD.  He intends to use the loan as follows: Kshs 8,000 for seeds, Kshs 12,000 for fertilizers, Kshs 2,000 for fungicides, Kshs 2,500 for manure, Kshs. 5,000 for weeding, Kshs.10,000 for harvesting and the remaining amount for wages and other costs, i.e. transportation.

Albert intends to use the profits from the business to pay his children's school fees and use the rest to expand his business.  His dream is to build a storage house that he will be using to store and sell his farm produce.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, fungicides, manure and the rest of money for weeding, harvesting, etc.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma  tiene 42 años, vive en casa de unos familiares en compañía de sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la agricultura, ya que posee terrenos heredados por parte de sus padre sembrando café, es así donde siembra y cosecha café; que aunque lo considera como una buena entrada económica, lo hace de manera temporal, por ello requiere de tiempo suficiene4 para que termine de desarrollarse hasta que llegue la temporada de cosecha. Paralelo a este trabajo, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lo oferta de casa en casa, de esa manera se genera más ingresos económicos. En tanto, cuando llega la etapa de recolección de sus frutos, contrata personal para que sea más rápido la cosecha y así pueda vender a la prontitud su producción en los mercados principales de las ciudades aledañas, por lo que llega a obtener buenas ganancias. Ahora su principal objetivo es intensificar en esta actividad y proseguir con la venta de cosméticos. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, en tanto le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ella desea agradecer a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de sus cafetales, asimismo desea suministrarse de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 42, lives in one of her relative’s house with her two children.  She has been farming for two years.  She inherited plots of land from her father.  She plants and harvests coffee on this land.  Even though she considers it to be good income, it is seasonal work.  The plants need time to finish growing until it is time to harvest them.

She also sells cosmetics door to door.  She generates more income this way.  

In the meantime, when it is harvest time she hires people to make the work go faster.  That way she is able to quickly sell her production at the main markets in neighboring cities.  That is why she gets good earnings.

Her main objective now is to augment her agricultural business and to continue selling cosmetics.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  She wishes to thank all of the people who will be lenders of the loan she is requesting.  It will be very useful in the progress of her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy fertilizers to improve her coffee crops.  She also wishes to stock up on cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her coffee production

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es: La señora Norma Lucia, tiene 26 años ella y tiene 1 hijo menor de edad. Ella tiene un negocio que es la venta mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 4años, empezó este negocio con recursos propios buscando como tener un ingreso económico para brindar manutención a su hijo, cabe señalarse el negocio lo heredo de su mama quien le enseño a trabajar desde pequeña. Ella solicita este préstamo con el propósito de invertir en el negocio para que tenga un mayor crecimiento y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias. El sueño de su familia es ampliar más el negocio y comprar más material para el negocio y obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Mrs. Norma Lucia is 26 years old and has one child who is a minor.  She has a business selling general merchandise which she distributes out of her home and from door to door.  She began this business 4 years ago with her own resources.  She needed a decent income in order to support her son.  It should be mentioned that she inherited the business from her mother who taught her to work at a young age.  She is soliciting the loan in order to have more merchandise and in this way obtain greater earnings.  Her family’s dream is to grow the business and by more materials for the business and earn a greater income.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, de 32 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 36 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Santa Rosa (ubicado en el interior de la selva Ayacuchana), se encuentran los cultivos de Rebeca, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus frutos como: el cacao, café y hojas de coca son muy bien cotizados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha en forma ambulatoria. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, puesto que es recompensado todo el esfuerzo y empeño que puso en sus siembras. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que perjudican el desarrollo de sus plantas. Con el tiempo espera adquirir más tierras para que pueda ampliar la siembra. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y café para sembrar, asimismo comprará sacos de abono para mejorar su productividad.
texts.en:
Rebeca, age 32, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Raúl, age 36, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better life. In the village of Santa Rosa (located in the interior of the Ayacucho jungle) Rebeca grows crops. Her products are of good quality and include cacao, coffee, and coca leaves that command good prices in the city of San Francisco, which is where she sells her entire harvest as a street vendor. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting her crops since she is rewarded for all the effort and care she invests in her fields. Rebeca has been farming for 15 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from plagues of insects that can harm their development. Over time she hopes to acquire more land in order to increase her harvest.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Rebeca is always prompt with her payments and willing to continue in the same manner. In her Communal Bank she is one of the most cheerful members who is always joking around with the others in her group. With this loan of 2000 PEN that she requested, Rebeca will buy cacao and coffee seeds to plant as well as sacks of compost to improve her productivity.

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds, coffee seeds, and compost

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
