Riziki A. is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki has operated her coconut selling business for the past six years. She sells from home to villagers and a coast coconut farm company. In addition, she operates a boutique which contributes to her income.  Riziki faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the hot summer season, fewer coconuts are available for sale while during the rainy winter season, many coconuts are available for sale. She hopes to supply 5,000 coconuts in the future.

With a loan of 40,000 KES, Riziki wants to purchase 2,000 coconuts for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2,000 coconuts for resale

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento 16 D. julio es un grupo que se encuentra en su 5ta secuencia esta conformado por 10  socias, la mayoría vive en la zona kupini en casa D. la Sra. Carmen se realizan las reuniones. Doña Carmen es la que ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, ella venD. comida en la zona  pero su principal actividad es la administración D. su taxi del cual percibe renta diaria, el esposo es albañil y ambos crían a su nieta quien es huérfana D. madre,  ambos viven en alquiler 20 años en el mismo domicilio con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración D. sus platos. La presidentes es la  señora Guadalupe  que confecciona delantales, mandiles y va a vender a los mercado, le hace en pedidos y ella va a entregar a distintos puestos del mercado, ella vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos  el mayor es el que le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa trabaja en la alcaldía como empleado la señora es bastante trabajadora  y responsable, con el dinero del crédito comprara telas e hilos para confeccionar sus mandiles, todos las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que desean sacar a su familia adelante, están muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Banco D. Emprendimiento 16th of July is a group in it's 5th loan cycle that is maD. up of 10 women, the majority of whom live in the Kupini zone.  The community bank meetings are held in Doña Carmen's house. Doña Carmen is the treasurer of the group, and she sells food in her community.  Her principal economic activity, however, is the administration of her taxi, which she rents out on a daily basis.  Her husband is a bricklayer and together they are raising their grandchild who is an orphan.  Both of them live in a rented home where they have lived for 20 years.  With the loan funds they will purchase supplies to make their plates.

The president of the group is Señora Guadalupe who makes aprons and sells them in the market.  She takes orders and delivers them to stalls in the market.  She lives in her own house with four children, the oldest of whom works at the city hall and and helps her with household expenses.  Señora Guadalupe is very hard working and responsible, with her loan funds she will purchase fabrics and strings to make aprons.  Each of the women in the group is personally responsible and hard working.  They are committed to improving their families' quality of life, and they are grateful for the help provided by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and string

loans.name: Rosa Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Rosa ella es madre sotera de tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive con ella. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque los intereses son bajos y porque en las reuniones aprende mucho, le encantan las charlas de salud.

Ella es una mujer a la que le encanta el trabajo, dice que si no realiza una actividad no  está bien. Se dedica a la cría de animales de corral en su casa, pero también vende productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catalogo, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h30 hasta las 14h00. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo. También sabe  corte y confección.

Con este crédito quiere comprar una maquina overlok (máquina para hacer hilvanes) para dedicarse a elaborar sabanas. Sus sueños son  progresar en este nuevo negocio.
texts.en: Members of the Luz y Progreso (Light and Progress) Community Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province that has long been known as the city with real tamarind. Here we find Rosa, a single mother of three adult children, one of whom lives with her. She has been with this community bank for five years and likes it because the interest rates are low and she learns a lot at the meetings, especially the chats about health. Rosa is a woman who loves to work. She says it is no good if she is not doing some activity. She makes a living raising farm animals out of her home, but she also sells Yanbal brand beauty products. She works every day from 8:30 a.m. until 2 p.m. and buys her merchandise in Portoviejo. She also knows how to sew and cut. With this loan she wants to purchase an overlock sewing machine so she can make a living making sheets. Her dream is to make progress with this new business.

loans.use: Purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Lima, de la ciudad de  El Alto, es divorciado  y tiene un hijo, el señor comerciante, tiene una librería con el  ingreso que obtiene se mantienen. Es el primer crédito q tiene en IMPRO  de la misma manera con KIVA.

El crédito solicitado es para compra de hojas de carpetas, rollos de nylon de colores, y otros artículos necesarios para surtir su librería.
texts.en:
Angel lives in his own house in the Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.  He is divorced and has one child.

He is a merchant.  He has a bookshop, and he uses the income to support himself.

This is his first loan with Impro and his first with Kiva.

The requested loan is to buy notebook paper, rolls of different colors of nylon twine, and other items that are needed to stock his bookshop.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like notebook paper, nylon twine, and other items to sell in his bookstore

loans.name: Turyagumamu

texts.en:
Turyagumamu A. is a client from Rukungiri. He is 30 years old and married with 2 children, aged 6 and 4 years. A. has a banana plantation and he is also involved in the sale of coffee, with the help of his family, especially his wife, and this has helped in contributing to his small salary.

A. needs a salary loan to be able to pay for his children's education. He is very hardworking and cooperative. His future plan is to be able to expand his business and educate his children to become self-reliant. He says that taking loans has made a great improvement in his life.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the barangay (village) of Galas, in Dipolog City. She is 56 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. Alma operates a family member's business in the clothing sector, selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Alma joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC of 70,000 PHP, which was used to purchase materials to renovate her store. Alma is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory for the RTW business. This will be the 28th loan Alma has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Yon S. is a 45-year-old mother of four children who are studying in the local school. She is married to Horn, 37,  who owns a barber shop in a busy place in his community, Siem Reap province. 

Yon S. has a grocery store where she sells food and other simple daily use items to her neighbors. To make her business grow and become more successful, she would like to ask for a loan to buy some essential items for resale. 

These are the other borrowers of this group: 
T., who owns a grocery shop and is requesting her loan to buy more products for selling.  
N., who is a barber as well as a grocery seller and is applying for a loan to buy more cooking ingredients for sale. 
T., who runs a boat delivery service and is asking for a loan to repair the boat.

loans.use: To buy some essential items for resale

loans.name: Roena

texts.en:
Roena M. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Roena operates a store where she sells products for daily use such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Roena has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Roena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Roena is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase canned goods, rice, dried fish, bagoong (fish sauce), sugar and spices. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Roena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, rice, dried fish, bagoong (fish sauce), sugar and spices

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El sr. Francisco P. A. es una persona responsable que trabaja como taxista en los alrededores de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene cuatro  hijos que dependen de el, anteriormente ellos vivian en la ciudad de La Paz, pero se vinieron a Cochabamba por motivos de trabajo y el frio intenso que no podian soportar sus hijos ya que enfermaban constantemente, su esposa trabaja todos los dias vendiendo comida fresca en el mercado campesino, un mercado popular de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, pero tienen un problema porque deben comprar casi de forma diaria la verdura que necesita para preparar la comida; por esa razón el señor P. y su esposa vinieron a solicitar un crédito para poder tener una conservadora de un tamaño aceptable  donde pueda almacenar mejor sus verduras  y otros insumos alimenticios que son para la venta de comida, esto le ayudará a ahorrar su capital en su diario consumo de los mismos.
texts.en:
Francisco P. A. is a responsible person who works as a taxi driver on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba.  He has four children who depend on him.  He used to live with his family in the city of La Paz but they came to Cochabamba for work reasons and also because their children couldn't stand the intense cold.  They would get sick all the time.

Francisco's wife works every day selling fresh meals in the 'mercado campesino', a popular market in the city of Cochabamba.  However, they have a problem because they must buy the vegetables that she needs to prepare her meals almost daily.  For this reason, Mr P. and his wife came to request a loan so that they could buy a decent-sized cooler where she could better store her vegetables and the other food supplies that she uses for making the meals that she sells.  This will help them to save money.

loans.use: to buy a cooler to store vegetables in

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 43 years old and a father of four. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has two years of experience in the business. Being a businessman, he joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, so that he could access business loans easily. Henry works with two casual laborers in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Henry has requested a loan of 15,000 KES to hire more land for quarrying and to purchase tools.

loans.use: to hire more land for quarrying and to purchase tools

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Yasmin de 14 y Mayler de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
 En el distrito de Carabayllo en Lima, se encuentra el puesto de descartables de Janett, ella vende platos, vasos de plástico descartable a muy buen precio, lo que ha hecho que tenga muchos más clientes que el resto de tiendas. Para ella su trabajo es muy importante, pues es muy conciente de que gracias a éste negocio puede darle a su familia lo necesario para vivir. Lleva 1 año en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es vender y convencer a sus clientes de llevarse algo, espera más adelante mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal en donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más descartables para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Janett, age 37, is a simple, hard-working woman.  She lives in a rented house with her two dear children, Yasmin, 14, and Mayler, 5, for whom she tries to provide the best lifestyle possible.

Janett has a stall in the Carabayllo district in Lima where she sells disposable items such as plastic plates and cups.  She has more customers than the other stores because of her competitive prices.  Her work is very important to her as she is conscious of the fact that it allows her to provide for her family.  She has been in business for a year and enjoys being able to convince her customers to buy something.  She hopes to improve and expand the store and knows she will have to work hard to do so.

This is her first loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She would not want to cause any problems to the other members in the communal bank, where she is much loved by the other members.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN she has requested to buy more disposable products to add to her range.

loans.use: To buy more disposable products

loans.name: Carla Luisa

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carla Luisa, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos. 

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa los días sábados en el centro comercial confraternidad de la ciudad del Cusco.  Ella también vende cosméticos y trabaja cada tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es de puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa compra de los proveedores. Tiene dos años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que los pantalones son muy solicitadas por sus clientes ya que son bonitos y a precios razonables.

En esta oportunidad requiere el microcrédito para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
In Cusco, capital of the department of Cusco -- known for many years as the "Archaeological Capital of the Americas" -- the members of the "Todos Unidos" ["All United"] communal bank meet every thirty days in the central offices of the Arariwa Association, Cusco, Peru.

In this place, we find Carla Luisa, who is 33 years old and married, with two children from this relationship. 

She is a housewife, and to obtain her own resources, she works selling clothing on Saturdays in the Confraternidad shopping center of the city of Cusco. She also sells cosmetics and works every three days during the week. Her selling method is door to door and on order. She provides her products on credit and collects payments each week. She receives deliveries of her products at home, and she buys the clothing she sells from suppliers. She has worked selling cosmetics for two years, and it is going very well for her. She reports that pants are especially in demand among her customers, since they are attractive and offered at reasonable prices. 

At this time she needs the microloan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal “Uniòn Arco Deustua” ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.
La señora hace cinco años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su  préstamo anterior fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas.  Paralelamente a esta actividad, Zenovia nos cuenta que también se dedica a la venta de muebles.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, comprará  insumos como: arroz, papa, chuño y otros para la preparación de  alimentos, en el negocio le ayuda sus hijos ya que su esposo trabaja en el municipio.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant y un hospedaje.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de los pagos y la facilidad del préstamo paralelo.
texts.en:
Zenovia is a member of the Uniòn Arco Deustua Community Bank located in the district and province of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She has a college-level education. 

Zenovia started working with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos five years ago. Her last loan was for S/. 300 soles which she used for her business selling food. As well, Zenovia has a furniture-selling business. 

With this new loan of S/. 1,700 soles she plans to buy ingredients such as rice, potatoes, and chuño to make the food. Her children help with the business as her husband has a job in town. 

Zenovia’s dream is to have a restaurant and hostel.

What she most likes about the Community Bank is the speed and ease of obtaining loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, and chuño

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 35 years old, she has five school-going children who are ages seven to eighteen years. Her husband is a farmer. She has owned  a general store for 10 years. From this business she has managed to have enough money to pay her children's school fees and meet her needs. Elina is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: To buy items for her shop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, five of whom are in school. She does not take care of additional family members. Christine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include her children's school fees and rent

Christine has a restaurant business. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Christine sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items for her restaurant, such as bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet potatoes. She explains that one of her major business challenges relates to transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow large so that she would own a fully stocked restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est veuve avec quatre enfants.
Adjowa a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 1980. Elle vend des produits d'alimentation générale à son domicile. Une autre personne l'aide avec son travail. 
Adjowa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 3 cartons de boites de conserves, 3 cartons de pâtes, 3 cartons de savons et 2 paniers de poissons grillés.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a 54 years old woman. She is widowed with four children.
Adjowa has been working as a retailer since 1980. She sells grocery products from her home. Another person helps her with the work.
Adjowa requested her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase three boxes of canned food, three boxes of pasta, three boxes of soap and two baskets of grilled fish.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Kasundra

texts.en:
Kasundra has been running her beauty spa for almost four years. She has taken her business to the next level by placing a greater emphasis on marketing and social media, specifically creating a monthly newsletter for clients to keep them informed of the new treatments and specials she offers. She has quarterly deals with coupon websites to attract new clients and hopes to obtain some repeat customers.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Kasundra will make improvements to her website; purchase marketing materials, including t-shirts; and get equipment for an additional employee. Kasundra is very excited about sharing her small business experience on Kiva.

loans.use: to make improvements to her website; purchase marketing materials, including t-shirts; and get equipment for an additional employee

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom work. 

Jabbar has had a grocery store since 2005 which sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, and other dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $2100 to renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate his market and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина проживает в районе Яван. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж работает врачом в поликлинике района. Сама Нигина более десяти лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Nigina lives in the Yavan region. She is 35 years old and married. She has five children. Her husband works as a doctor in an area clinic. Nigina herself has practiced animal husbandry for more than ten years. She breeds cattle at her home for future sale. She is requesting a loan to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.use: purchase livestock.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a married woman with three school-age children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Roselyne dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a divorced woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Chynarbubu's Group

texts.en:
Chynarbubu, 45, is the leader of this group. Living in a village of Karajygach, where all dwellers either breed cattle or cultivate land, Chynarbubu didn’t have another choice of occupation. Having moved here, Chynarbubu with her husband and two sons became full-fledged members of the community. She bought the very first head of cattle for 8,000 soms. Growing cattle and reselling it brought the good result of purchasing furniture for the house. Despite the fact that the house still needs more electrical appliances and improvements, Chynarbubu believes she will accomplish this goal one day. With the purpose of purchasing a refrigerator, she now addresses Kiva lenders. She hopes to open a farm in the far future. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
A sus 48 años de edad Marleny es una mujer emprendedora que a raíz de su separación decidió valerse por si misma y sacar a sus 2 hijas adelante, hoy en día una de sus hijas está casada y la otra se dedica a apoyar a su madre en todos sus proyectos, como actualmente que con la ilusión de tener un ingreso fijo, Marleny quiere montar un negocio donde venda comidas rápidas pues desde hace 5 años ha trabajado para varias personas en esta labor por lo que ha adquirido la experiencia necesaria para sacar adelante un negocio propio.

Marleny debe comprar un puesto donde ofrecer la comida e insumos para la preparación de la misma, por lo que solicita un préstamo con el cual realizar estas compras, pues hoy no cuenta con el capital necesario para emprender este proyecto. Sueña con tener estabilidad económica, posicionar su negocio y llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At the age of 48 Marleny is an enterprising woman who, after her separation, decided to fend for herself and to move forward with her 2 daughters. Today one of her daughters is married and the other helps her mother in all of her projects. Currently, her goal is to have a steady income so Marleny wants to set up a business from where to sell fast foods. For the past 5 years she has been working for various other people in this field and she has acquired the experience she needs to set up her own business.

Marleny wants to purchase a stand from where to sell foods and ingredients used in the preparation of these foods. To this end she requests a loan to make these purchases, as she does not currently have the necessary capital to undertake this project. She dreams of having stable finances, to position her business, and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food and to purchase a stand from where to sell fast foods.

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: Madame Khardiata vit au Sénégal et  est âgée  de 48 ans. Elle exerce l’activité de vente de crème et de glace. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité pour se procurer des revenus. Elle est  membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2002 et a déjà bénéficié de 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de  produits locaux de base qu’elle utilise pour faire la crème et du sucre en quantité assez importante, afin d’ accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.  L’augmentation de ses revenus  lui permet de mieux  prendre en charge ses propres besoins et aussi soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Khardiata lives in Senegal and is 48 years of age. She works selling ice cream and ice. She has picked this activity because of the need to secure an income. She has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since 2002 and had two prior loans. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 for the purchase of local products on the base of which she is going to make ice cream as well as big quantities of sugar, in order to increase her sales margin. The increase of her income will allow her to take care of her own needs as well as   help her husband provide for   everyday family expenses

loans.use: to buy local products and sugar for preparing ice cream for sale

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. Edgar has operated a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services for 15 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools and gasoline for maintenance. Edgar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edgar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Edgar Orlando

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Orlando se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares, tiene 2 años de haber inicado su negocio, Egdar vive con sus familiares y su hijo, esta actividad le da buenas utilidades, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de accesorios y celulares, desea surtir un poco su negocio ya que se aproxima la época de navidad y las ventas son muy buenas.
Su sueño es comprar su propia casa, en donde pueda vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Edgar Orlando makes a living selling cell phones and cell phone accessories. He started his business 2 years ago.

Edgar lives with his family and his son. He finds this business very profitable. He will use the loan to buy cell phone accessories and cell phones. He wants to supply his business with products as the holiday season is approaching and sales are good during that time.

His dream is to buy a house of his own where he can live with his family.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Italo Alexandro

texts.es:
Italo Alexandro tiene 40 años de edad e vive en unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 19, 14, 12, 11 y 1 año de edad ene el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.

Italo se dedica a labores agrícolas siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años. Las compras y las ventas los realizan en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura y poder obtener ganacia para mejorar el estado económico de la familia. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar insumos.

El sueño es poder tener una casa grande, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema.

En los tiempos libres le gusta  hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Italo Alexandro is 40 years old.  He lives with his partner and his five children who are 19, 14, 12, 11 and 1.  They live in Ventanas canton, in los Rios province.

The JERUSALEN community bank is located in El Caimito, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Italo has been growing corn and rice for 20 years.  He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.

Italo is requesting this loan to invest in his farming so that he can make profits and improve his family's financial situation.  The loan will enable him to buy supplies.

Italo's dream is to own a big house.  He has not experienced any problems in his work.

In his free time, Italo enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos, él se dedica a vender pan dulce y pan francés en una bicicleta todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar dos bicicletas para vender el pan esto le ayudara para abastecer a mas personas y aumentar en clientes porque tendrá varios lugares donde repartirlo y de esa forma podrá tener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de José es apoyar a su familia para que vivan en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and six children and sells “pan dulce” and French bread on a bicycle every day from Monday to Sunday.

He will use the money from this loan to buy two bikes so he can sell his bread.  This will help him deliver to more people and increase his number of customers because he will have various places to deliver.  In this way he can increase his income.

José’s dream is to support his family so that they will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two bikes.

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber lives in the village of Gomi, East Georgia, with his family: his wife Lela, three children (15, 11 and 9 years old) and his mother (retired). The children go to school. Kakhaber and Lela earn their living through agricultural business. They have a milk cow. Lela produces cheese and sells it in Khashuri (a nearby town). Also the family grows beans and potatoes, most of which is sold on the same market. Also, Kakhaber runs a small poultry farm. He purchases chickens, raises them and sells them after 50 days. The total average monthly income of the family is 470 Laris. 

With the requested credit Kakhaber will purchase 500 chickens for 1,20 Laris each and the rest of the credit will be used for purchasing feed for them. After selling the chickens Kakhaber will get income, which will be used for his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo esta solicitando un crédito para surtir su negocio, ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía de abarrotes que es productos de lata, lactéis y  verduras; ya que con las vacaciones navideñas se le termino casi toda su mercancía.
Este negocio es familia ya que entre Don Reynaldo y su esposa se encargan de atender el negocio y en vacaciones sus hijos le ayudan acomodar los artículos y a la limpiar el local, ya que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para brindarles un mejor patrimonio a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr Reynaldo is requesting a loan to stock his business, since he needs more variety of grocery merchandise such as canned goods, dairy products and vegetables; because of the Christmas holidays, he has almost run out of merchandise.
This is a family business. Reynaldo and his wife attend to the business. During the holidays, their children help them to put out displays and clean the store. This store is his source of income with which to provide his family with their needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Umugisha Group

texts.en:
Epiphanie is a group leader; aged 36. She is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 14 years, three of them go to school.

Her group is called Umugisha which means “Blessing” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better.

Epiphanie has a shop and has been running her business for 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to resell.

loans.name: Huseynboy

texts.ru: Хусейнбой мужчина 60 лет, женат, счастливый отец шестерых детей и двадцати внуков. Вот уже на протяжение сорока лет Хусейнбой занимается животноводством и земледелием. Он начал свою деятельность в 18 лет, тогда еще ему помогал его отец. Хусейнбою было сложно обеспечивать свою большую семью, ведь кроме своей жены и детей, с ним жили мать и младшие сестры. Ему приходилось подрабатывать на стройке в выходные дни, в ночную смену он выходил таксистом. Со временем Хусейнбой встал на ноги и сейчас у него стабильный доход, большой участок земли, где он выращивает фрукты и овощи, у него еще 3 коровы и 10 баранов. Сейчас Хусейнбой живет со всей своей семьей, вместе с ним живут его старшие сыновья со своими семьями. Его сыновья также помогают ему по дому. Несмотря на свой возраст Хусейнбой чувствует себя молодым и полным сил. В настоящее время Хусейнбой хочет купить и установить пластиковые окна и двери в дом,так как зимы у нас суровые и в этом году его внуки очень сильно заболели. На медикаменты ушло очень много денег. Поэтому Хусейнбой решил приобрести пластиковые окна, которые будут защищать его и его семью от холода и жары. К сожалению, Хусейнбой на данный момент не имеет полной суммы денег для осуществления своего плана. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Хусейнбой является  лояльным клиентом МДО Арванд уже на протяжение трех лет . Он благодарит за поддержку и помощь в сложные для него времена.
texts.en:
Huseynboy is a 60-year-old man. He is married and the happy father of six children and grandfather to twenty grandchildren. For the last 40 years Huseynboy has reared animals and grown crops. He started this activity when he was 18 years old when his father used to help him. It was hard for Huseynboy to provide for his large family, since his mother and younger sisters lived with him in addition to his wife and children. He had to earn extra money at a construction site at weekends, and he would work night shifts as a taxi driver.

In time, Huseynboy got on his feet and now he has a stable income and a large plot of land where he grows fruits and vegetables. He also has three cows and ten sheep. Now Huseynboy lives with all of his family, and his elder sons and their families also live with him. His sons also help him around the house. Despite his age, Huseynboy feels young and full of energy.

Now Huseynboy wants to buy and install vinyl windows and doors in his house, since the winters here are harsh and this year his grandchildren got very sick. A lot of money was spent on medicines. So Huseynboy decided to acquire vinyl windows which will protect him and his family from the cold and the heat. Unfortunately, Huseynboy does not have enough money at the moment to carry out his plan, so he has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Huseynboy has been a loyal client for three years already. He is grateful for the support during difficult times.

loans.use: to buy and install vinyl windows.

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem is 40 years old and lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He owns a shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses.

He always tries to establish his businesses through offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are in great demand and expensive as well.

Nadeem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He will invest the money into his business so that he can buy the latest cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. He hopes that through this loan, he can enhance the businesses.

Nadeem is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in his cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is 36 years old green grocer at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of five whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last three years doing well. 

This is her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the money to purchase kale, cabbages, onions,tomatoes and green bananas and the anticipated profit to expand her grocery shop.
She hopes to have a  happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase kale, cabbages, onions,tomatoes and green bananas

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.en:
Mrs. Kokoé K. is a young woman of 34 years. She is married and has two (02) children. She reached 10th grade and quickly abandoned the schoolbench to profit in the beauty products and perfume business. She has already received 2 loans which she paid off before the repayment date. She is a dynamic and determined woman who deserves to be supported in enlarging her business and augmenting her revenues for the benefit of her family, of whom she is in charge.

For her business needs, Kokoé is asking for a loan of $850, which will open the door to purchasing beauty products and perfume from wholesalers. This will allow her to enlarge her display, attract more customers, and considerably augment her income, letting her improve the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Kokoé est une jeune femme de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle a atteint la classe de 2nde et a vite abandonné les bancs au profit du commerce des produits de beauté et de parfum. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits qu’elle a soldés avant échéance. C’est une femme dynamique et déterminée qui mérite d’être soutenue pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus au bénéfice de sa famille dont elle a la charge.

Pour les besoins de ses activités, Kokoé sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui ouvrira les portes pour s’approvisionner des produits de beauté et de parfum chez les grossistes. Cela lui permettra d’agrandir son étalage, d’attirer plus de clientèle et d’augmenter considérablement ses revenus pour contribuer à l’amélioration du mieux-être de la famille.

loans.use: To obtain a supply of beauty products and perfume from wholesalers

loans.name: Wilter

texts.en:
Wilter has worked in markets since he was 15 when he helped his aunt out in her store. Once he was older he decided to start his own business with the help of his father and a brother. After working for several years with his brother, Wilmer decided to start a bakery on his own. He used the money he had saved from his previous business and a loan he received from his father to get things going. He is now very happy to have a business of his own. He is very dedicated to the enterprise as he often works from 6 am until 10 pm. His wife also contributes greatly to the business.

Wilter is requesting a loan because he wants to begin selling beverages. He would like to upgrade his refrigerator and also make some other improvements to the business.

Wilter is 25 years old, is married and has one son who is in school. Thanks to hard work and a successful business, he owns his home and his bakery. With the extra profits he plans to make improvements to his house and possibly his business.

loans.use: Begin selling soft drinks, juices and other beverages

loans.name: Gulnisa

texts.en:
Gulnisa was born in 1960 in the Salyan region , Yenikand village. She has 3 children.
One day  she bought a pregnant cow and so she started her own business. 
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 2 pregnant cows.
She has been in this business for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy 2 pregnant cows

loans.name: Djafar

texts.en: Djafar has a fruit orchard which he has been tending for 6 years. This  51-year-old  man is married, has 2 children and lives in Khachmaz region, Godakli village. Now Djafar needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and weed control products for his orchard.

loans.use: To buy weed control and fertilizer

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer by profession; he has farmland which he cultivates and harvests in order to sell his crops. He is proud to be a farmer. He learnt farming from his father.

Moses is from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. Moses needs the loan of $325 for his farm maintenance.

loans.use: To maintain his farm

loans.name: María Gertrudis

texts.en:
María Gertrudis P. is a 47-year-old woman who is striving in order to make a living and fend for her five children.  She runs a grocery store that she opened five years ago with her husband. 
She gets the merchandise in the township, since there are a lot of fields there and she can obtain the goods fresh.  She sells all kinds of vegetables, beans, rice, flour and other foodstuffs.
The entrepreneur would like to augment the operations volume of her sales activity.  She thinks that she would attend to more customers if she could buy some products in bulk.  Given this loan, María Gertrudis will see her business dream fulfilled and will earn as much as necessary to keep on running the business and looking after her children.

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts of goods to supply her grocery store in order to increase the store's operations volume.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria C. is a merchant. She has a site in the bustling Managua market where she sells breakfast. She began construction on several bedrooms in her house, but due to a lack of funds, she has not been able to finish them. She needs to finish the construction because her house is getting too small for the six family members that live with her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Maria C. es comerciante. Tiene un local en un populoso mercado de Managua, se dedica a la venta de desayunos. Empezó la construcción de unos cuartos de habitación en su vivienda, pero debido a la falta de dinero no los ha podido finalizar, tiene la necesidad de terminar esta construcción porque su casa se está volviendo muy pequeña para los 6 familiares que viven con ella.

loans.use:
Finish bedroom construction

Finzalizar la construcción de cuartos de habitación

loans.name: Kawala 1A (I) Group

texts.en:
Jane is a 48-year-old-widow. She has a poultry farm. With the extra profits from the expanded business, she intends to pay school fees for the orphans.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more birds for a poultry business

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
For the past 10 years Esperanza Valásquez has worked selling vegetables in the city of León, specifically in the district of El Sauce. She started her business with an investment of C$500 (five-hundred Córdobas Netos) and little by little, as the years passed, the economic situation of her business has improved.

She has the responsibility to provide for her three small children (a boy and two girls) who need her. For this reason Esperanza works hard everyday to provide her children with an education, food, clothing and a decent place to live.

This is why Esperanza has come to Ceprodel to ask for a microloan which will allow her to improve her economic situation. With the loan she will be able to purchase products in bulk and then sell them for a profit.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 10 años la señora Esperanza V. se dedica a la venta de verduras en la ciudad de León específicamente en el Municipio de El Sauce. Su negocio lo comenzó con una inversión de C$ 500 (Quinientos córdobas netos) por lo que a través de los años ha venido mejorando poco a poco la situación económica de su negocio.

Actualmente tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres pequeños hijos (Un niño y dos niñas) que necesitan del calor de su madre y para ello se esfuerza grandemente brindándoles educación, alimentación y un digno techo donde habitar.

Por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos directos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica en la adquisición de mayores cantidades de productos para su respectiva comercialización.

loans.use: Purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Pea

texts.en:
Mr. Pea B., 38, drives a soil truck and earns up to $4 a day. His wife, Mrs. Loch Sary, is a grocer in the Russey Krok District in Bateay Meanchey Province and earns about $5 a day. Pea B. has three children, all of whom are still young. 

To earn a living for the family, B. is now requesting a loan of $800 to increase inventory of groceries for his wife’s business, so Sary can efficiently customer demand. He thanks Kiva for their support and promises to be accurate and faithful in his loan payment.

loans.use: To increase inventory of groceries for his wife's business

loans.name: Emumuwean

texts.en: Emumuwean J. resides in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has 5 children. She bakes snacks with her husband and also sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She worked with Rayman Bakery for 3 years before she started on her own in 1995. Mrs. J. is focused and determined to enlarge her business. She is requesting a loan of $875 so she can buy more baking material and foodstuffs for her business. This will help her to better serve her customers. She thanks all who will make her loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more bakery material and foodstuffs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther N. is 50 years of age and lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children.  She sells dried river fish, a business that she learnt from her mother and started on her own in 1985. She is now requesting a loan of $1,125 to expand her inventory. She has been a dedicated LAPO client for the past 10 years.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Eddys Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Eddys is 58 years old, he lives in Los Laureles norte, is married and has a 15 year old son, his wife is a house wife and helps him in the grocery store they have on their one room house.

Mr. Eddys works as an electrician, he has 30 years of experience, and they have difficulties when the business sales are slow. He started the business with his own savings.

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to invest in working capital to buy supplies and products for his business and therefore satisfy his clients and gain more profit from sales.

He plans to have enough money to educate his son and improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Eddys tiene 58 años de edad, habita en los Laureles Norte, casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con una pulpería que tienen en su casa de habitación. El Sr. Eddys se desempeña como electricista, tiene treinta años de experiencia, las dificultades se dan cuando el negocio va mal en las ventas. El comenzó con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que adquiera pretende invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos para invertirlos en su negocio y así fortalecerlo y poder sastifacer a los clientes con sus productos y obtener más ganancias y utilidad con las ventas. Sus planes son llegar a poner una miscelanea, poder educar a su hijo y mejorar la vivienda.

loans.use: To buy products for his grocery store  / Comprar productos varios para invertirlos en su pulpería

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana started her business after her husband sustained a car accident while driving his cab and he had to pay for the damages to the other party involved in the accident. That's when he started to work as a labourer to pay off the debt but he often didn't have enough work. So they decided to set up a little stand to at least earn a minimum amoun of money every day. They started 3 hyears ago selling only the basics, milk, pop, bread, tortillas, cooking oil. But now they have set up some appliances where they can make snacks: deep fried foods, rinds, nachos with cheese, etc. It is a great success.

She needs a loan in the amount of $200 US that will be repaid in a term of 4 months to purchase a supply of groceries to keep their store well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Juana inicio el negocio cuando su esposo tuvo un choque con el carro de sitio que manejaba y tuvo que pagara los daños a la persona afectada quien le dio suficiente plazo para que le arreglara el coche, en ese entonces se metió a trabajar en la obra para pagar la deuda pero en ocasiones no tenia trabajo y fue cuando decidieron poner una tiendita para asi sacar mínimo algún ingreso diario. Inicio hace 3 años vendiendo solo lo indispensable leche, refresco, pan, tortillas, aceite, ahora puso algunas maquinitas y otras cosas como tipo snack: donde vende frituras, chicharrones preparados, nachos con queso, etc. y le va muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 4 meses para la compra de abarrotes, y así mantener surtido su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea is 43 years old. She completed elementary school. She's married and mother of 5 children who depend on her financially. They live in the town of Chuachua in the district of Zepita in the state of Chucuito.

She's a member of the communal bank called "Andres Santa Cruz D. Chuachua". With her previous loans, she invested the money in some livestock and with the savings she decided to open up a store six months ago in the downtown area.

With this loan, she would like to purchase 3 boxes of soda, 2 bags of noodles, 2 boxes of cookies, 6 cans of oil, etc. to stock up her store. She will repay this loan within 4 months.

Dorotea is very happy since she was a young girl she always wanted to own her own grocery store. Little by little, she's able to increase her merchandise and her profit.

Her future goal is to have her own farm and raise guinea pigs, stock up her store and that her children will all finish school and become professionals.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Dorotea tiene 43 años D. edad, estudió hasta primaria completa, es casada, madre D. cinco hijos todos depenD. D. ella y están domiciliados en el Centro Poblado D. Chuachua, del distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito – Juli y Región D. Puno. Es socia del Banco Comunal Andrés Santa Cruz D. Chuachua, los préstamos anteriores se dedicó en el engorD. D. ganado y D. ello tuvo ganancias y hace seis meses decidió abrir una tienda en la plaza D. armas del centro poblado, quien en la actualidad se dedica a ese negocio. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará 3 paquetes D. gaseosas, dos bolsas D. fideos, dos cajas D. galletas, media docena D. aceite entre otras para la tienda. Su crédito será pagado en cuatro meses. Dorotea esta muy feliz, por que tiene ya una tienda que anhelaba desD. su juventud, además poco a poco esta incrementando su mercadería y mejorando sus ingresos económicos. Su visión futura es tener una empresa D. crianza D. cuyes, equipar más su tienda y sean profesionales sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy items in bulk

loans.name: Justine Nabanoba's Group

texts.en:
Justine is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 28-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 6 and 4 years old. Both her children go to school. She owns and resides in a three-roomed house, living with no additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Justine works seven days a week and rents her working place. She deals in household goods and sells to all categories of people, both wholesale and retail. Justine sells to an average of 40 people per day and buys the items from Kasubi. She uses public transport back to her home. Justine has been in this business for the last five years .She is also rearing chickens in her village.

Justine has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her second loan, working all this time with the same group. Her major challenges are those of damaged goods and transportation costs. She wants to increase stock in her business. She aspires to construct rental houses in the free space near her home. .

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa A.  est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est boulangère et habite à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame fabrique et revend des pains  depuis plus de 5 ans. La particularité de ce travail consiste à avoir assez de stock de farine de blé et de bois de chauffage .Elle tient son activité au serieux et ne fait pas de doute avec ce second crédit de FECECAV. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter la capacité de son activité qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente et tirer rapidement un bénéfice de cet investissement et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Adjowa A. is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is a baker and lives in Lomé, the Togolese capital. She has made and sold bread for five years. In her line, it is important to have enough wheat flour and firewood on hand. Adjowa takes her business seriously and has not any doubts about a second loan with FECECAV. This loan would permit her to expand her business, assuring her of a substantial sales margin to make a quick profit from this investment to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of wheat flour and firewood

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun S. is a villager in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Khen Mao, owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Although Mrs. Saroeun S. and his wife have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions.

In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Saroeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and pig feed to start a pig-breeding business. Mr. Saroeun S. is 45 years old and the father of five children, one of whom helps on the plantation while the others are attending the local school. Both husband and wife are in the photo.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig feed to start a pig-breeding business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Cada día se ocupa de la crianza de animales, y cuando se acerca la época de siembra cultiva  los productos de su zona, entonces, a la agricultura también le dedica el tiempo requerido. Son 4 años que realiza esta labor con la que se siente muy satisfecha porque le ha permitido fortalecer la economía de su familia en momentos difíciles, cuando no alcanzaba el dinero. Referente a los animales que cría, Alicia vende su carne, principalmente de oveja, llevándola a los pueblos más alejados de su localidad. De esa manera solventa la educación de sus hijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP y desde el primer momento no deja de cumplir con sus cuotas. Este dinero será invertido en preparación de su tierra de cultivo de papa con sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Alicia is married, and she lives with her husband and three children. She spends every day raising animals, and during the planting season she also grows local crops. Alicia has been doing this work for four years, and she's very satisfied because it allows her to strengthen her family's economic situation during hard times when money is scarce. Alicia sells the animals that she raises, primarily sheep, for their meat. She brings them to the most remote villages in the region. In this way she pays for her children's education. This is the third time that Alicia has asked for a loan with MFP and from the beginning she's never stopped working toward repayments. This money will be invested in preparing her fields with fertilizer in time for potato planting.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer to prepare her fields

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.en:
The Los Olivos (“The Olive Trees”) Village Bank has 13 members, all women, and is beginning its second loan cycle. The group is named after the Los Olivos neighborhood, where all of its members live. Meetings are held at the home of one of the group members. The women are involved in a variety of different businesses. Some sell dry goods, cheese or cosmetics from a catalogue, while others work as cosmetologists, make and sell textiles, or prepare meals and juices to sell.

Some sell from door to door or on foot, while others sell in the city’s markets. The group members are requesting different loan amounts: 300 soles (US$ 100), 450 soles (US$ 150), 600 (US$ 200) or 900 (US$ 300) soles. Los Olivos is requesting a total of 6,450 soles in loans.

The loans will be invested to buy sugar, rice, milk, pasta, various fruits, wool, and dyes. Some of the group members’ dreams are to own their own homes, to improve their homes, to expand their businesses, and to proviD. their children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

El Banco Comunal Los Olivos inicia su segundo ciclo con 13 socias. Todas las socias son del barrio D. Los Olivos, nombre que lleva el Banco Comunal, las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio D. alguna socia.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios, como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, quesos, cosméticos por catálogos, brindan servicios D. cosmetología, elaboran textiles y preparación D. jugos y comidas. Sus ventas los realizan D. manera ambulatoria, D. casa en casa y en los mercados D. L. ciudad.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles y 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 6,450 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, leche, quesos, frutas variadas, lanas, tintes. Los sueños D. las socias es tener casa propia, mejorar su casa, ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, pasta, various fruits, wool, and dyes

loans.name: Ahmad Zaky Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Zaky is the group leader of the Ahmad Zaky group. There are six members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Shalla and Shakerya want to take out a loan for their husbands' tailoring businesses; they want to make the businesses larger and they need a small loan for this. Also, Ahmad Zaky and Ahmad Jawad want to take out a loan for their businesses of fruit cart and general store. They want to complete necessary materials for their shop. Anesa wants to take a loan for her son’s business; he sells books, pens, and so on. Also, Deeba wants to take a loan for her husband’s cosmetics business. He needs to buy necessary materials for his shop, and make his business larger.

They want to say that these loans are intended to help their businesses progress and for expanding their businesses so they are useful. They all want to thank Kiva lenders for the Kiva process in Afghanistan which supports poor people.

loans.use: make their businesses larger and better

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells palm oil. Palm oil is an essential commodity in Nigeria and it is used in the preparation of local soup in Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says, "Thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support."

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 53, is a widowed rice farmer who lives in the Kampong Cham province with two of her children. She typically makes US$2 each day and is supported economically by some of her children. Her children are the biggest source of her income and she wants to take out a loan to aid them with their expenses. With a loan of US$700 from CREDIT, Sem S. wants to purchase blacksmith materials for her children.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 28 years old and married with a child. She sells eggs at Uselu Market in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq F. is a 59-year-old merchant who sells different kinds of food in his own store. Rafiq started his business more than 20 years ago. He is also an accountant which helps him to run his business. Rafiq is married and has five children.

Rafiq has dedicated his life to bringing up his children and providing excellent education for them. Rafiq would like to expand his business and purchase more food products and in the future open one more store where his son will be working.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S. is a fisherman. He fishes and sells his catch in the village for a living. He learned fishing from his father. Now he is teaching his son to fish to have food to eat on their table. His wife Milagros is a fish vendor. They both buy fish from other fishermen to sell in the market. The income is what they use to buy their needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Some of the loan will also be used to buy fishing materials like nets and baits. He will also have his boat repaired.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and other fish to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie E. is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children. Her husband does traditional gold mining, locally known as "pamiling". Rosie thinks of a way that she could help her husband in raising their family and in providing for the needs of their children. She decided to put up a variety store from the amount she received from HSPFI, a KIVA partner, when she took her first cycle loan. As of now, she is applying for her third loan. If granted, the amount will be used to purchase additional items for her variety store. She will gain more income and be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To procure additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice Atta-Brayo is fifty years old, married, and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Beatrice works very hard to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Beatrice is a trader, trading in cosmetics. She buys her goods such as powder, pomades, body cream, lotion, body spray, etc. from Accra and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Beatrice has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Akomédi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris l’électronique, il a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel il fait la  réparation et la vente des appareils électroniques, ce commerce lui réussit bien il veut l’agrandir, pour le faire il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son premier crédit  et acheter 8 lecteurs, 15 antennes, 01 carton de VCD, 04 poste téléviseurs.
Il est divorcé de son mari et a ses 02 enfants a sa charge.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has learned electronics. He opened his own workshop in which he repairs and sells electronic equipment. This is a successful business for him. He wants to expand. To do so, he is inquiring with WAGES to obtain his first loan to buy 8 players, 15 antennas, a box of VCD, and 4 television sets. He is divorced and has two children in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a long-time hog raiser. Maintaining the business helps provide for her family's needs. She is 58 years old and married to Diosdado, a service driver for the Department of Agriculture. They are blessed with five children who are now married; however, some of them are still living with Evelyn and Diosdado.

Because of financial problems, she has difficulty sustaining her hogs with enough feed; thus, she is requesting to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 from Kiva. She is planning to buy additional piglets to raise and sacks of pre-starter and grower feeds for the livestock. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will grant her loan.

loans.use: To buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Señora Lili is 62 years old, single, and has one child. She lives near the center of the city of Pucallpa. She is one of three co-owners of a restaurant called "Chicharrones Porkys", which is located next to her house. The other two co-owners are Lili's siblings.

Lili has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for about nine years and is a member of the communal bank, "Las Guerreras" (“The Warriors”). Lili invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in the sale of fruits and juices. Later, she and her siblings set up their restaurant, which specializes in chicharrones (fried pork rinds).

Lili is currently requesting a loan of 3,000 soles which she will invest both in her restaurant and in the production of corn and papaya on her farm outside the city.

Lili has worked well with Manuela Ramos over the past nine years. The organization has helped her through some difficult times. She was even able to construct her house with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos and earnings from her business. Lili is committed to making her loan payments on time and to being a responsible member of her communal bank.

loans.use: To invest both in her restaurant and in the production of corn and papaya on her farm

loans.name: Jogueraha Group

texts.es:
The women of this committee are dedicated to several activities from selling clothes, food for example: empanadas, tortillas, croquets, barbecued beef, etc., recycling of carton, plastic, and all types of metal not being used, among other activities all of the women are heads of their households and are in charge of providing for their families. 

Actually, this committee is in their tenth cycle in which they can … They hope that their children will not have the same limitations, in both the work place and education, and this is what drives them twice as much to be able to offer their children better opportunities.

loans.use: to invest in their activities

loans.name: David

texts.en:
“Ask the Lord to bless your plans and you will be successful in carrying them out,” says David C., the loving husband of Sanie. They live harmoniously with their three children at Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Their children have already finished their studies in college and are now employed. They believe that this is the fruit of their strong faith and determination to move forward.

In addition to being a farmer, David is also a Pastor in their church. Furthermore, he cultivates their farm by planting rice and some vegetables while his wife manages their piggery business. He is now requesting a loan of PHP15,000 as additional farming capital to develop his rice farming business which provides his family with an adequate supply of food and assists them in maintaining their pig-raising business.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en: Stella N. is a married mother of two children. She lives in Nyamasaria, but runs a second-hand clothes business at  Kibuye market. She has been in this business since 2001. Stella has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa S. is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Toafa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community.  Toafa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Toafa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Toafa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Toafa is now requesting a new loan of 2500 WST which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Toafa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco R. K. is 39 years old and is married with seven children aged 1 through 12. He also cares for an additional dependent that lives with the family. Bosco and his family live in Gatsibo district in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

Bosco has had his beverage shop since 2006. His business is well located and busy most of the time. He employs three people in his successful beverage/soft drink retail business. His shop is open every day from 6:00 in morning to 6:00 in evening.

Bosco is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva in order to have sufficient working capital to purchase more soft drinks in greater quantities at better prices for his store. With this loan he hopes to increase his business, which will help him to serve more customers and hopefully attract new ones as well, and provide more food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more Fanta and other soft drinks

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson N. is a Tanzanian small-businessman. He runs a business selling broilers to customers. He purchases from the nearby villages in various Tanzanian regions and transports and sells at Dar es Salaam Market. Local broilers are highly demanded in hotels and for domestic use. Thus, the market is high. His business plan is to open up a big business and be a big supplier. He has been in this business for three years. He needs a loan of TSHS 600,000 to meet his customer's demands.

loans.use: To increase his business

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr: A. Angèle est née le 28 Novembre 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Angèle est mariée à GANSSOU Gildas et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Angèle vit avec ses enfants au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou depuis sept ans environs. C'est le conjoint qui supporte les charges de la famille. Angèle n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a onze ans de cela que Angèle vend des parfums, déodorants, laits corporels à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Missèbo, un marché du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Angèle s'approvisionne. Angèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. En vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa clientèle, Angèle sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Angèle was born on November 28, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to GANSSOU Gildas and is the mother of two children who are both in school. For about seven years, she has been living with her children in the Agbodjèdo district in Cotonou. The husband is the one providing for the family. Angèle has never been to school. For eleven years since then, she has been selling perfumes, deodorants, and body lotions at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She goes to stock up at Missèbo, a market in Bénin, and in Lomé in Togo, a country neighboring Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans. With the aim of bolstering her business and increasing her customer base, she's requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, deodorants, and body lotions

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu M.. She is 54 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. She has two children: one boy and one girl, both in secondary school.

Isatu has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Isatu sells Sierra Leonean staple goods such as rice, Maggi (a common spice) and hot pepper (used in almost all local cooking) at the Wharf in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing additional inventories of these goods.

With her new loan Isatu hopes to increase her business in the same way and make a greater profit. She then intends to put some of this profit aside in a bank savings account.

loans.use: To buy rice, Maggi, and pepper

loans.name: Tchaa

texts.en: Mr. M. was born in Kara, but now lives in the Agbalépedo region of Lomé. He has been earning a living selling prepaid cell phone cards since 2008 in Adidogomé.  He is single and has no children. This will be his first loan with WAGES, which he will use to replenish his supply of prepaid cell phone cards.  With this loan, he will continue to benefit from the ever-growing popularity of cell phones in Togo.
