loans.use: To purchase prepaid phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 52-year-old woman who has three children. Her husband is in the printing business and one of her children is studying at the university. She has a business in a busy market in Gikomba where she sells clothes and provides tailoring services. She employs two people and has been in the business for less than one year. Previously she was involved in computer typesetting. With loan of Kes 20,000, she hopes to buy more clothes such as skirts and shirts. Thanks to Faulu, she is focused and well informed in business matters. She wants to expand her business to employ more people and economically empower them. She hopes to buy her own plot of land in the future to build residential houses. Veronica describes herself as friendly and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock in clothes

loans.name: Hawrank Zeeb Group

texts.en:
This is Hawrank Zeeb group. There are five members in this group. All members would like to receive money for their businesses. The group leader, Esmatullah is a married man with his six children, he wants to take a loan for his business of a battery-charging shop. He needs this money because he wants to buy essential supplies for his business. 

Yasamen wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She needs to purchase a machine and a desk for her business. And Hawrank Zeeb wants to take a loan for his business of a general store where he sells different kinds of things and supports all his family members. He would like to expand his business and buy some more materials for his shop to attract more clients. Nazefa wants to take a loan for her business of quilt-sewing. She wants to make her business larger. Noezeya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling vegetables. He needs money because he wants to buy a new shop for his business.

They requested a group loan of 45,000 Afghani.

They all would like to state that Kiva is an effective process which can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their business

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Madame Ramatoulaye G. sollicite un crédit de 150 000 FCFA pour un fond  de roulement de son commerce. En effet,  Madame G. s’est impliquée  dans le commerce pour mieux prévoir les charges familiales. Elle vend des produits céréaliers comme le mil, maïs, arachide…..etc. 
Madame Ramatoulaye G. est mariée mère de famille. Elle a 6 enfants dont les âges varient entre 12 mois et 11 ans. Elle compte actuellement  sur son commerce pour  compléter  les charges quotidiennes de la maison. C’est ainsi qu’elle remercie d’avance U-IMCEC et ses partenaires tout en espérant avoir un financement dans les plus brefs délais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramatoulaye G. is requesting a loan of 150,000 FCFA to use as working capital for her business. Mrs. G. became involved in trade in order to better provide for the needs of her family. She sells cereal products such as millet, corn, groundnut, etc. Mrs. Ramatoulaye G. is married and a mother. She has six children ranging in age from 12 months to 11 years. She currently relies on her business to fulfill her daily responsibilities at home. This is why she would like to thank U-IMCEC and its partners in advance, in hopes of receiving funds as soon as possible.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mighty Power Group

texts.en:
Mighty Power is a group of five borrowers led by Akine S., a 35-year-old single father of a five-year-old child, currently in kindergarten, whom he dreams of providing with a good education. Akine could not continue his education through university due to poverty. He lives in West Point, Monrovia, Liberia, a very crowded community whose high poverty rate pushes its residents to try many different ways to make a living.

For five years, Akine has been selling general goods such as soap and batteries at the Waterside Market. He buys his goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of his community. Because of the wide variety of goods in his shop, customers are encouraged to continue buying from him. Akine will use this loan to purchase more soap and batteries.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Akine, is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more soap and batteries.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 49 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouélégana : région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage et font essentiellement la vente de produits alimentaires.
Elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé le premier. 
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 200 sacs de feuilles de baobab, 150kg de mil et 100kg de potasse alimentaire. 
Elles se ravitaillent dans les villages de Benzena, Wessebougou, Donzana et Sonkebougou et effectuent leurs ventes au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte, à domicile, en ambulant et aux marchés de Ségou. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000FCA qui sera utilisé pour l’achat des condiments, les soins de santé et de scolarisation des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambitions l’achat des matériels agricoles dans ce partenariat avec Soro /Kiva
texts.en:
The six women of the Benkadi group are married, the majority living in polygamous families. They have an average age of 49 years old and an average of four children. They all live in the village of Ouélégana in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and marriage, and their principal activity is selling food products. They are on their second group loan, having repaid the first without any problem. This loan will be used to buy 200 bags of baobab (monkey bread tree) leaves, 150 kg of millet and 100kg of edible potash. They get their supplies in the villages of Benzena, Wessebougou, Donzana and Sonkebougou, and sell for cash and on credit to a mixed customer base, at home, walking around and at the markets in Ségou. They envisage making an average monthly profit of 19,000 FCA which will be used to buy condiments, and to cover health care and the children's schooling costs. Their ambition is to buy agricultural equipment in partnership with Soro/Kiva.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is a wife of B. A. and they both live in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
Her husband is a mason and has twenty-five years of experience in this profession. They are not an educated but they want to raise their children: two boys and one girl with good education. Her husband works hard to achieve the dream for their children. 
She is applying for a loan to buy mason tools so he performs his work more effectively and generates good income.

loans.use: To buy mason tools

loans.name: Zalmai Tabesh Group

texts.en: Zalmai, the son of N. M. and a married father of four children, is the 31-year-old leader of Zalmai Tabesh Group.  He lives in Kabul Afghanistan where he has a taxi that he wants to buy new tires and some tools for. He is therefore requesting a loan from AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company), happy that there is a process that can solve entrepreneurs’ problems.

loans.use: To buy new tires and tools for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour, sugar, yeast,  groundnut oil and firewood

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene años de edad,  vive junto a su hijo en el sector Colector del distrito de San José, una zona agrícola donde sus habitantes se dedican mayoritariamente a la crianza de ganado vacuno para comercializar la leche que este produce, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Manuel se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, posee un terreno agrícola de 1.5 hectáreas en donde  siembra forraje y granos, actualmente ha sembrado arroz; además cuenta con un pequeño rebaño de vacas de las cuales tres se encuentran en producción lechera, la leche que estas producen es vendida a un acopiador de la zona. Estas actividades le ha proveido de sustento desde hace muchos años y el piensa seguir valiéndose de ellas para salir adelante.

El desea mejorar la cantidad y la calidad de la producción lechera de sus vacas, ya que esta actividad le provee de ingresos permanentes y por lo tanto es la que mayor cuidado merece, para lograr su objetivo piensa comprar alimento balanceado, para adquirirlo, ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.

Manuel es un hombre responsable y que gusta mucho de las actividades que realiza, el nos comenta que actualmente está buscando un buen molino donde pilar su arroz y así poder obtener un ingreso adicional. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and son in the Colector area of San José district, an agricultural region where the inhabitants are mainly devoted to raising milk cows in order to sell the milk that they produce. This area is in the Lambayeque province, which is located half an hour outside the city of Chiclayo. Since the time that he was very young, Manuel has worked in agriculture. He has 1.5 hectares of agricultural land where he cultivates pasture grass and grains, and where he is currently cultivating rice. In addition, he has a small herd of cows, three of which are producing milk. The milk that they produce is sold to a wholesaler in the area. These activities have provided him with a livelihood for many years, and he plans to continue with them so that he can continue to prosper. He wants to increase the quantity and quality of his milk production, since this activity provides him with a steady income and therefore merits his attention. To achieve this objective, he plans to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his cows. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 1,700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Manuel is a responsible man who really enjoys the work that he does. He tells us that currently he is looking for a good mill where he can husk his rice, and in this way have an increased income. He has worked with our institution before, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his milk cows

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1959 au Bénin, A. Colette est mariée à GBEHOU Joseph un conducteur. Le couple a deux enfants à charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Colette vit depuis douze ans environs au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou capitale économique du Benin, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Colette n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la couture. Maitresse couturière, Colette mène comme activité secondaire la vente de produits de la mercerie depuis huit ans environs dans son atelier de couture. Colette achète ses produits au grand marché international du Bénin Dantokpa. C’est la deuxième fois que Colette sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, pour faire évoluer son activité ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1959 in Benin, Colette A. is married to Joseph GBEHOU. The couple have two children under their care, both having attended school. For the past ten years Colette has been living with her husband and children in the Fidjrossé borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple shares the handling of family expenses. Coleet has not attended school herself, but learned sewing instead. An accomplished seamstress, she has also been running a side business for the past eight years, selling haberdashery items in her sewing workshop. Colette buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This is the second time Colette is requesting a loan from ALIDé, to make her business evolve and become better suited to meet customer demands.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy haberdashery items

loans.name: Paula Maria

texts.es: Paula Maria de 52 años, su negocio es la venta de carne ella tiene 9 años de de realizar esta actividad pues cuando dio inicio fue por la ayuda de una de sus hijas que le  proporciono la ayuda necesaria para que avanzara con esta actividad, pues también invirtió su ahorros poco a poco con esfuerzo su negocio de fue creciendo. Actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria en su negocio. Para darles un mejor servicio a los clientes ella quiere comprar una amplia variedad para ofrecer. Una de sus metas es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Paula Maria is 52 years old. She has been selling meat for nine years. One of her daughters helped her start her business, and she has gradually been able to invest her savings in it, too. Paula will use this loan to buy some of the basic supplies she needs for her business. In order to better serve her customers, she wants to offer a better variety of meats. One day, Paula would like to have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia B. tiene 43 años está casada con el señor Orlando juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12, 8 y 4) años 2 mayores están en la escuela. Doña Alicia y su esposo  han  sufrido mucho ya que tuvieron  que viajar a España a trabajar por necesidad, para lo cual dejaron  a sus hijos y a su hermana al menor con  tan solo con 18 meses, siempre al pendiente de sus hijos trabajaban y les llamaba por teléfono todos los días después de trabajar, hace un año que volvieron y lograron reunir lo suficiente para comprar una casa donde ahora están muy cómodos sus tres hijos y un vehículo  con  el cual su esposo trabaja de taxista.

Actualmente doña Alicia vive en la ciudad de CBBA  en la comunidad de SIRPITA – CUATRO ESQUINAS, su principal actividad es la producción espinacas y también vende patos (pelados) a diferentes restaurant de la ciudad.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas y abono para la siembra de espinacas así como también incrementar patos ya que tiene muchos pedidos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es tener un restaurant propio, ya que no quieren volver a salir del país lejos de sus hijos  y que los tres hijos estudien una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alicia B. is 43 years old and married to her husband, Orlando. Together they have three children (ages 12, 8 and 4), and the eldest two are in school. Alicia and her husband have suffered a lot since out of necessity they had to travel to Spain for work, leaving behind their two sons and their young daughter, then just 18 months old. They always thought of their children as they worked and called them on the telephone every day after they were done with work. After a year they returned and were able to earn enough to buy a house, where they now live in comfort with their children, and also purchase a vehicle, which Alicia's husband uses as a taxi. Alicia currently lives in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, in the community of Sirpita - Cuatro Esquinas, and makes a living producing spinach and selling plucked ducks to different restaurants in the city. She plans to use to the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant the spinach as well as to add more ducks since she has many orders. One of her dreams and goals is to have her own restaurant because she doesn't want to have to leave her children to work overseas again, and she also wants to see her three children earn professional degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spinach seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio C. is from the village of Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 36 years old and married with one small child. To make a living, Antonio operates a tricycle transport services. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the second loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane B. is from the village of Alinguigan 3rd. She is 32 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Mary Jane owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling boiled eggs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is highly skilled at cultivating crops on her own farmland and began this work when she was unmarried.   She is now married with two school-aged children. Her husband helps be responsible for the family by working in construction. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year following both the rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Neang S. has insufficient capital to use on her farm. Therefore, Neang S. is seeking a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds.

loans.name: Bella Linda

texts.en:
Bella Linda C. is from the village of Datu Tangkilan. She is 53 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Bella Linda runs a general store. Bella Linda has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Bella Linda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bella Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. and is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Bella Linda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. is thirty-five years old and married. Her husband is a driver and they have five children between the ages of thirteen and two. Her business is located at Mwiki, a fast growing residential area in Nairobi. She sells clothing which includes trousers, shirts, dresses, handbags, shoes and jeans wear. Her customers are her friends, family and walk in shoppers. 

She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that her customers do not pay their debts to her as per agreement, which slows down her business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more dresses, handbags and shoes to increase the stock in order to attract new customers and to meet the demands of her existing customers. 

In the future, she sees herself becoming a millionaire, having expanded her business to a big boutique. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy more dresses, handbags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bags of rice, tomatoes, beans, red oil, salt, and so forth

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa vive en la ciudad de el Alto la Paz, en la Zona de Villa Bolívar, la casa donde vive es familiar de propiedad de la hija, la  señora Rosa es soltera tiene un hijo de 18 años  dependiente de ella, cuentan con terrenos en los yungas localidad de la asunta. Donde se encarga de plantar  coca, hoja tradicional que se usa como medicamento natural y tradicional de Bolivia, llevan con esta actividad más de 8 años y cuentan con toda la documentación respectiva para comercializar este producto ya que requiere de un permiso especial. El crédito será destinado para la compra fertilizantes y plantines  de coca, la Sra. planta y comercializa este producto, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosa lives in the city of El Alto La Paz. The house where she lives is owned by her daughter. Mrs. Rosa is single and also has an 18 year old son who is her dependent. She owns fields in Yungas, in the area of La Asunta in Bolivia. She plants coca, a traditional leaf that is used as a natural medicine and is traditional in Bolivia. She has been in this business for 8 years and has all the necessary documentation to commercialize this product, since it requires a special permit. The credit will be used to buy fertilizer and coca seedlings. Mrs Rosa plants and commercializes the product and is very thankful for the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for coca production

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es:
Juan Cruz M. O. tiene 40 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 6 hijos.

Juan pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además ayuda en las tierras de los padres que se dedican a la misma actividad,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar tierras y una casa propia para la familia.
Le gusta visitar a ala familia, festejar las fiestas.
texts.en:
Juan Cruz M. O. is 40 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Guaranda canton, in the province of Bolívar.  He has 6 children.

Juan belongs to the Guantucoto solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in crop farming and livestock farming, especially the sowing of corn and potatoes in the mountain region and rice in the coastal region.  This solidarity group has 25 members.

Juan has been farming for several years.  He farms corn and potatoes.  He also helps on his parents' land as they also farm.  He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is requesting this loan to buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help her to fulfil her family's financial needs.  They face challenges such as pests and diseases in their crops.  His dream is to buy land and to buy his family their own home.

He likes to visit his family and to celebrate fiestas.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento UNION  integrado por  9 integrantes de los cuales 6 viven en la zona de San Jose y los restantes viven en el barrio  San Jorge, Su actividad es la venta De bisutería, venta. De frutas, venta de comida, servicio.                                                                                          La Presidenta es la Sra.  Mariela, comerciante en la venta de cerveza hace 1 año, alquila un local cerca de su domicilio y cuenta con un hijo menor que se encuentra estudiando, la Sra. lleva muchos años con esta actividad también vende papas fritas y bocaditos, es un apersona muy responsable y con el dinero del crédito comprara refrescos y cerveza por caja. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                            La Secretaria es la Sra. Cristina es  ayudante de cocina en el mercado de la zona, concubina con el sr. Gilberto Condori el cual es motosierrista y tienen dos hijos en su poder, la Sra. Trabaja en un restaurante conocido de la localidad del Torno, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería.                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Todas las Socias son personas responsables y puntuales y están agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo económico y la motivación de superación en sus negocios y actividades.
texts.en:
The Entrepreneurial Bank UNION is comprised of 9 members; 6 reside in the San Jose zone, and the rest live in the San Jorge neighborhood.  Their activity is the sale of costume jewelry, fruits, food, and services.  The President is Mariela, who has been selling beer for 1 year.  She rents a locale close to her house, and has a young son who is in school.  She has many years of experience, also sells French fries and snacks, and is a very responsible person.  She will use the loan to buy beverages and cases of beer.  

The Secretary, Cristina, is an assistant in the kitchen of one of the area’s markets.  She is married to Gilberto, who provides transportation services, and they have two children in their care.  She works in a well-known restaurant in the locality of Torno, and will use her loan money to purchase merchandise.

All the members are responsible and punctual, and are thankful to the institution for its financial support and the motivation to make their businesses and activities improve.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling business from home for over eight years, and her potential customers are neighbours, college students and passersby. Mesaid faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate from home. She hopes to establish a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and green vegetables for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat oil and green vegetables for her food stall.
